detailedDescription:
This spacious 5 bedroom extended semi detached family house is set a short distance away from popular Chislehurst Village. Boasting good sized rooms with bright interiors, there are ample living and work from home opportunities, together with a large well maintained sunny garden plus large storage shed. Space for two cars on drive and side access to garden via side gate.

Situated in a popular location near Edgebury Primary school and St Olave's Prep School, its lovely suburban location benefits from numerous restaurants, shops and local amenities also well served by surrounding green spaces and fantastic transport links. New Eltham train station is within walking distance with trains to London Bridge taking approx 19 mins. Buses to Chislehurst Station, New Eltham Station and Bromley in close proximity.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
EPC band: C

Stunning first-floor apartment situated within walking distance to the heart of Beckenham. The owners of this property have loved and looked after their home, fully renovating it to a high standard, maximising space and light throughout. Both the kitchen and bathroom are newly fitted and the communal gardens are well maintained by a regular gardener, making it an enjoyable outside space for all residents. The property also offers off-street parking and a secure garage.Beckenham Junction is a busy commuter stop, on the line between London Victoria and Orpington, with regular trains arriving in the capital every 20 minutes. There are also frequent services to London Bridge and to the Tramline network. Shortlands and Ravensbourne stations are only 10 minutes walk away providing regular Thameslink services to the City and beyond. The bustling Beckenham High Street is a 10-minute walk, offering a wide range of shops, pubs, restaurants, and cafes. Away from the shops, there is a number of green spaces, including the spectacular Beckenham Place Park and Kelsey Park.

detailedDescription:
***Guide Price £825,000 - £850,000***

A fully refurbished and modernised five bedroom semi-detached family home, located in the heart of Bromley South.

This spacious property has undergone a programme of refurbishment by the current owners and comprises, to the ground floor; welcoming entrance hallway, guest WC, reception room with working fire and an open plan kitchen/diner to the rear. The stunning southerly facing garden newly landscaped has been beautifully maintained and offers side access, two entertaining spaces, Tiki hut complete with electricity and heating and two sheds, one with electricity. The garden also has night lighting throughout and an automated irrigation system.

To the first floor there are two double bedrooms, one currently used as a second reception, a good size single bedroom and a brand new family bathroom. The top floor has been extended to offer a further two double bedrooms, one with brand new en-suite and Juliette balcony. Further benefits include new carpets, triple glazing windows to the front and off street parking for up to three cars (currently configured for two).

Queen Anne Avenue provides the ideal location for popular local schools rated by Ofsted as Outstanding and Good including Harris Academy, Shortland Highfield Primary, Valley Primary, St Mark’s CofE and Langley Girls and Boys and Harris Academy Beckenham. Bromley South Station is 0.5 miles away providing fast and frequent services into Victoria. Shortlands Station is also 0.7 miles away. Bromley Town Centre is nearby offering a wide selection of shops, bars and restaurants including The Glades shopping centre, Churchill Theatre and St Mark’s Square, with well known restaurant chains and a state of the art nine screen cinema complex.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
Acorn are thrilled to offer this attractive two bedroom ground floor apartment within a residential block.
Enter via a well kept communal hallway which is carpeted with intercom system, the apartment door opens onto a good size hall with storage and wood effect flooring.
First up is the very good size impressive reception with a large square bay window with the added benefit of plantation shutters a great place for a dinning table and chairs, an additional window to front, bright fresh neutral décor and wood effect flooring, next to this is a superb size kitchen-diner with white wall and base units, oven, hob and extractor, tiled splashback, grey rolled edge work top, granite ceramic flooring that highlights the sparkle when caught by the light, the bathroom is a standard three piece suite with slate look flooring, lastly there are two very good size double bedrooms the master having new high gloss wardrobes that the vendor is willing to leave.
Outside is a wrap around communal garden/grounds with a parking space to rear.
Orchid Court is located just at the top of Whitefoot and close to Forster Memorial Park with good local bus service.

detailedDescription:
Situated in the ever popular Great Thrift in Petts Wood East is this delightful three bedroom semi detached house. The property is ideally located for Petts Wood mainline station, serving an array of London termini as well as the popular Crofton Primary school.

The accommodation comprises a spacious hallway, cloakroom and a sitting room to the front with feature fireplace. The dining room opens to the rear reception room which overlooks the 77' rear garden. The fitted kitchen also overlooks the rear reception room.

To the first floor is the family bathroom and three generously proportioned bedrooms, two of which are doubles with fitted wardrobes.

The property offers ample off street parking to the front while to the rear is the delightful mainly laid to lawn garden with patio area and an array of mature plants and shrubbery. There is also a detached garage.

This three bedroom semi offers fantastic potential to extend (stpp) to both the side, rear and current loft space.

Internal viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate the location, size and potential of this delightful family home.

detailedDescription:
Situated in this quiet cul de sac on the Bickley Park estate we are delighted to offer for sale this beautifully well presented modern four bedroom detached house. This property has we feel been thoughtfully extended to provide light open plan living space of approximately 2000 sq ft and ideally suits the needs of any growing family and being a short five minute walk to Chislehurst station is perfect for those looking to commute. The living accommodation briefly comprises a bright lounge, modern kitchen open plan onto a huge dining room, sitting room, study and WC on the ground floor while on the first floor there are four equally well proportioned bedrooms, the master with ensuite and a family bathroom. The South facing garden is well maintained and well stocked with a large patio area to entertain however of particular note is the purpose built detached home office / studio that has become in recent times essential for home workers. There is a large double garage to the side in addition to a fair sized driveway to fit at least three cars and in our opinion your earliest attention to view is well advised to avoid disappointment.

address: Wilberforce Court, Holwood Estate, Keston, Kent BR2
detailedDescription:
Set within the 100 acres of the exclusive and historic Holwood Estate in the sought after village of Keston, Wilberforce Court is a gated development of luxury apartments offering tree lined walks, landscaped gardens, parkland teaming with wildlife (including deer) and a large pond with its resident ducks and geese!

This first floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment measuring almost 1120 sqft is in immaculate condition and offers secure living in beatuiful grounds but is also within easy reach of central London, Bromley town centre and transport links to international terminals.

Situated on the first floor and reachable via a lift or stairs the property offers many fine features including a large entrance hallway and 18ft bay reception room with Karrs flooring. The master double bedroom is complimented by an ensuite bathroom and offers access to the adjoining balcony with views over the courtyard. The kitchen/breakfast room is fitted with Amtico flooring and benefits from dual aspect views of the drive and also the courtyard.

The property also comes with 2 private, allocated parking spaces in the secure undercroft which are reachable via the lift.

This development and the surorunding area really needs to be seen to appreciate its natual beauty but don't forget to visit the village with its coffee shops, restaurants and public houses.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Hilldrop Road, Sundridge Park, Bromley BR1
detailedDescription:
Constructed in 1931, this delightful end terrace home provides much charm with welcoming three bedroom/two reception room accommodation and is located within a popular crescent road close to convenient local shops in Burnt Ash Lane and within easy reach of Bromley town centre.

The property, which is beautifully presented throughout, comprises:- a spacious entrance hallway; living room with feature working fireplace; separate dining room; modern fitted kitchen with integrated double oven/microwave combo, hob and dishwasher. Upstairs, there are the three bedrooms - two double size rooms both with fitted wardrobes- plus a single room/office. The bathroom is upstairs along with a separate WC.

Outside, the attractive sunny rear garden extends to around 50' and is neatly laid to lawn with well stocked borders. To the rear is a large l-Shaped shed/workshop with a gate providing secure rear access. The garden backs onto Burnt Ash Cemetery and there is a lovely outlook to the rear.

Hilldrop Road forms part of a crescent with Gladwell Road and is conveniently located just off Burnt Ash lane. Nearby Kings Meadow recreation ground features a hugely popular recently opened playground and there are some fantastic local shops nearby in Burnt Ask Lane. Bromley town centre can also be easily reached on foot and nearby stations are situated at Grove Park, Sundridge Park, Bromley North and Bromley South. The property is also close to well regarded local schools including ofsted Outstanding rated Parish School.

Entrance Porch

Covered porch with outside light.

address: Barkway Drive, Farnborough, Orpington, Kent BR6
detailedDescription:
Barkway Drive is a much sought after cul-de-sac in Locksbottom situated close to local shops, restaurants and cafes and approximately half a mile from Darrick Wood junior and senior schools. The property is also close to local walks within Farnborough Village and beyond and is a short walk from Tugmutton Common. A short bus ride away is Orpington mainline station with fast trains taking less than twenty minutes to London.
The property itself is a versatile and well-presented four bedroom semi-detached town house with almost 1500 sq ft. Of accommodation including a former garage/ store. Accommodation is over three floors, the ground features a study, second bedroom with en suite shower room and utility. The first floor comprises of a spacious 16 x 12ft living room to front and kitchen opening to dining room plus cloakroom. The three further bedrooms on the upper floor feature a master suite with both a dressing area and en suite shower plus two further rear bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is an attractive garden to rear and parking in front. Viewing essential.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Attractive three/four bedroom detached property with extended ground floor annexe, set within a large plot of approximately a third of an acre, superbly situated in a quiet residential location. The property offers bright and spacious accommodation arranged over two floors including
three reception areas, further study, well equipped kitchen and two bath/shower rooms. Well maintained throughout, the house offers excellent additional scope for re-configuration or customisation to own taste, with further potential for extension, subject to the normal planning consents. Features include gas central heating, double glazing, off street parking, garage and delightful large private garden.

Accommodation comprises a welcoming entrance hall with access to guest WC, front aspect study and stairs rising to the first floor, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with attractive bay window to front and views to the rear over the garden. The separate kitchen comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances. A hallway, with access to front and rear of the property, leads into the extended annexe area, comprising a utility room with inset sink, large annexe room and further rear reception, plus a useful shower room. To the first floor, there are three well proportioned double bedrooms, all with inbuilt storage, plus a family bathroom with white three piece suite.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Elmstead Woods station, with numerous regular bus routes offering good connections to the surrounding area. Chislehurst is close-by for a variety of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants, with Sidcup and New Eltham also within easy reach for a wider selection of shops and amenities. The area is also well served by good local schools and lovely open spaces.

detailedDescription:
** sale by auction - 16 July 2021 **
Timed Online Auction .

Prime investment opportunity. Rare chance to purchase approximately 0.1 Acres (0.04 hectares) of land within the affluent village of Keston in Greater London. Offers potential for multiple uses. Plot is largely flat with excellent access offered from a track north of the plot as depicted on the map. Prime location with land at a premium in and around London. 8 miles from Croydon and 13 miles from the Centre of London. Layhams Road is just a mile away from West Wickham, Bromley and this particular plot are around 1.9 miles from the town centre. The closest Train station is West Wickham which is around 3.4 miles away. Layhams Road is connected to A232 via Addington road. This plot is sold on an unconditional basis allowing purchasers to secure now and take forward their plans for their own use or development subject to necessary consents where required. Currently, the plot is mainly level with prospects for a range of uses. The plot sits within the green belt. Buyers may wish to consider future development prospects for these sites but are deemed to rely on their own inquiries. This plot is offered without planning permission and all queries in relation to planning should be directed to the local planning department. Buyers may wish to consider future development on this site. This is open land/plot and buyers may pass by the site on their leisure in daylight hours, no appointment necessary and we have not seen the land by ourselves. When viewing the land we request that you respect the privacy of adjoining residents and do not park vehicles on private parking areas or in a manner that may obstruct access for others.

Keston is a village in Greater London, England, located within the London Borough of Bromley and the historic county of Kent. It is part suburban, part rural in nature and lies on the edge of Hayes Common, just beyond the London conurbation to the south of Bromley Common. It includes the small hamlet of Nash to the southwest. The northern, more suburban part of Keston is sometimes referred to as Keston Mark.

detailedDescription:
An attractive five bedroom double-fronted Victorian semi-detached house positioned on the favourable section of a popular, centrally located street just off of Belvedere Road.

This characterful property is brimming with period detail and has been improved, remodelled and upgraded by the current owners to offer a warm and inviting family home. A welcoming entrance hall divides the principle reception room and a generous kitchen diner, with a tiered seating area and brand new bi-fold doors to the garden.

A long list of features include stripped wood flooring, high ceilings, marble surround fireplaces and wooden sash windows to name a few.

Other points to note such as cellar & loft storage, a hand utility room, ground floor wc, five double bedrooms and a luxury bathroom.

Externally there is a beautifully planted rear garden with a south-easterly aspect - ideal for enjoying sunny days.

This rarely available style is moments from a wealth of leisure and shopping options at the centre of town, also Crystal Palace station and the park.

A house that should be seen to be appreciated.

detailedDescription:
** No Chain ** share of freehold - 2/3 Bedroom First Floor 1334 Sq Ft Period Apartment
A stunning, rarely available, circa 1870's, period conversion apartment offering approx 1334 sq ft which runs the entire length of the first floor of the building and also benefits from its own approx 86ft private garden, garage, off street parking and cellar! The property can be used as two double bedrooms and two reception rooms or as three double bedrooms and one reception room !
Located on a private road in the heart of Beckenham with its array of shops, boutiques, restaurants and Beckenham Junction station just a short walk away.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase a substantial split level ground floor apartment within this imposing locally listed building.The large elegant rooms retain character but have been adapted and updated to make a very comfortable 21st century apartment.

Features worthy of note are the large and welcoming entrance hall with an original fireplace leading into the spacious lounge which has French windows giving access to the balcony and private garden beyond.

The kitchen is of good size and is fitted with a range of modern wall and base units with granite worktops and Meile appliances.

There is a lower ground floor to this apartment which houses the utility room, a storage area with restricted head height and a further double bedroom which could easily be used as a home office.

To the rear is a private garden which is attractively designed and stocked with a variety of shrubs. There is also a terrace area and steps leading up to the balcony.

At the side of the property is a large detached garage which provides three narrow parking spaces one of which is used by the owners of this flat.

The location is excellent being 0.8 of a mile from Chislehurst and Bickley stations and quarter of a mile from the highly regarded Bullers Wood School. Bromley town centre is only a mile and a half away.

Early viewing of this end of chain property is highly recommended.

Council Tax:- London Borough of Bromley, Band F, £2,306.55

detailedDescription:

Located moments away from Bromley town centre, where you can find a huge range of shops, amenities, restaurants and fantastic transport links into central London.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Vine Road, Green Street Green, Orpington BR6
detailedDescription:
Chain free. Extended four bedroom semi detached family home set on a corner plot in a popular residential location, close to local amenities, Green St Green Primary school and Glentrammon recreation grounds.

The property is in need of updating throughout and offers further scope to extend (stlp), the ground floor comprises, entrance hallway, extended kitchen, spacious lounge/diner with patio doors to the garden and a double bedroom to the front.

To the first floor there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom with corner bath and heated towel rail, bedroom one has a walk-in wardrobe. The property benefits from loft space, double glazing and gas central heating.

Outside, the secluded rear garden is mainly laid to lawn, bordered by hedges and mature shrubs, there is a timber shed and patio seating area. To the front there is off street parking for a couple of cars, storage garage and gated side access.

Vine Road is a short walk from the shops on Windsor Drive and Green Street Green High Street, both with an array of convenience stores and local amenities. There are further shopping facilities in Orpington and Bromley and the M25 can be joined nearby for major road networks, Gatwick and Heathrow airports.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Open day Saturday 10th July by appointment only

Offered to the market chain free is this four bedroom semi-detached family home located in the heart of Beckenham, which requires extensive renovation.

Internally, the property comprises of large entrance hall, downstairs W.C., two large reception rooms, large kitchen, and integral garage. The second floor comprises of four large bedrooms, family bathroom and separate W.C.

The property benefits from off-street parking for several cars, large 100+ ft secluded rear garden. There is also potential to significantly extend this property (STPP).

The property is ideally located for Beckenham High Street, Beckenham recreation ground, mainline stations, and a number of excellent schools.

detailedDescription:
Overview

Hunters are pleased to offer to the market this recently upgraded four bedroom mid terrace family home. The property has previously been extended boasting expansive accommodation and the current owners have recently installed a new kitchen and bathroom.

Situated in a popular location near Edgebury Primary school with transport links including New Eltham mainline station. Chislehurst high street is 1.0 mile with shops, restaurants, pond and commons.

The property consist of porch, entrance hall, living room leading to bedroom four/ reception room, dining room, kitchen, utility room and WC. Stairs lead to the first floor landing with three bedroom and family bathroom. Outside there is off road parking to the front and a tiered rear garden with a large store room/ outbuilding which can be used as a studio/ office to the rear of the garden. Internal viewings are highly recommended. EPC Band D

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Black + Blanc are delighted to be bringing to the market this wonderful four-bedroom semi-detached house spanning over approximately 1500 sq ft on Kent Road, West Wickham. The property consists of four bedrooms, an open plan reception room, kitchen/dining room, family bathroom, converted loft room with en-suite and a superb private and secluded large rear garden. Have a look at Kent Road’s virtual 3D tour now, where you can walk through the property within a few clicks.

Tell me more about the property…

This splendid property is nestled away on the popular residential street of Kent Road, in the heart of West Wickham, the property has pleasant curb appeal, a large driveway. As you enter the property the spacious hallway, benefitting from high ceilings leads you to the open plan reception room (11’3 ft x 27’4 ft) it is light and airy, and the colour palette is complimentary to the furnishing. The dining room (9’10 ft x 10’6 ft) has fantastic views of the garden and the French patio doors allow access to the garden.
The open plan kitchen dining impressively measures (6’9 ft x 20’0 ft) and is integrated with high end appliances and is perfect for a family that enjoys cooking. The ground floor is completed with a downstairs WC.

The first floor of the house is perfectly laid out and consists of three bedrooms and a family bathroom. Two of the bedrooms are similar in size (10’5 ft x 14’1 ft) and (10’6 ft x 13’0 ft) which both offer plenty of space with integrated built-in storage keeping the room clutter free and large bay windows. The third bedroom is currently being used as a work from home office. The first floor is completed with a well-presented family bathroom.

The second floor which is a loft conversion, presents a substantial size double bedroom with good high ceilings, integrated storage and ensuite shower room. It has the added benefit of views of Bromley which is rather pleasant.

The property has a large private and secluded garden, it is beautifully landscaped with the first segment of the garden has a patio area and perfect for summer evenings, the second segment is lawned.

What’s the location like?

The property is ideally located for local schools such as Hawes Down Primary and Langley Secondary schools as well as being in walking distance to West Wickham station that gets you into London in 27 minutes. Within walking distance to the local High street.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market is this charming and well-presented four bedroom Victorian mid terrace house, located on a very popular residential road in Beckenham.

Arranged over three floors, the downstairs accommodation comprises of a living room with a feature fire place, separate dining room, extended modern fully fitted kitchen with double doors leading out to the well maintained garden.

The first floor has two good size double bedrooms and a large family bathroom with separate shower. The second floor has a further two bedrooms. Further benefits include gas central heating and storage throughout.

Located within the Balgowan Primary School catchment area and fantastic transport links near by including Clock House Train Station and Beckenham Junction both offering fast and reliable links into Central London. Energy Efficiency Rating D.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Chain free. This modern, contemporary, two double bedroom apartment constructed in 2018 & is located convenient for rail services at Petts Wood & Bickley. The property features a master en-suite, high gloss integrated kitchen & under floor heating throughout as well as parking to the front.

Located between Bickley & Petts Wood with access to both these mainline stations plus Chislehurst station, is this stunning, contemporary two double bedroom apartment, which was constructed in 2018 to a high specification. The property is set on the first floor with a large open plan lounge diner which features double balcony doors leading to a Juliet which overlooks the communal gardens to the rear. To the front there are two spacious bedrooms, with the master benefitting from an en-suite & bedroom two a range of built in wardrobes. The kitchen features near full integration & is finished in a high gloss grey. There is also a family shower room off of the hallway. Further benefits include access to a communal garden, allocated parking to the front, a long lease and offered chain free. A viewing is very highly advised.

Hallway Accessed via wood front door and video entry phone system. Large hallway storage cupboard, karndean flooring and spot lights.

Open plan lounge/kitchen 24' 6" x 12' 11" (7.47m x 3.94m) Double glazed sash windows to rear plus double glazed doors opening onto a Juliet balcony. Fully kitchen kitchen with a range of built in high gloss wall and base units with solid contrasting work surfaces. Inset composite sink with mixer tap and drainer to side. Built in Bosch oven with four burner gas hob and fitted extractor fan over. Glass splash backs, integrated dishwasher and fridge freezer. Cupboard housing combo boiler. Built in microwave, spot lights, karndean flooring with under floor heating.

Bedroom one 14' 6" x 9' 9" (4.42m x 2.97m) Double glazed box sash windows to front. Two built in wardrobes and fitted carpet.

Ensuite Double glazed box sash windows to side. Three piece suite comprising panel enclosed bath with thermostatic mixer taps, glass screen and wall fixed shower over. Wall mounted wash hand basin with mixer tap and low level W.C. Wall mounted heated towel rail, tiled walls, spot lights and karndean flooring.

Bedroom two 10' 6" x 10' into wardrobe (3.2m x 3.05m) Double glazed box sash windows to front. Range of built in wardrobes, spot lights and fitted carpet.

Bathroom Three pieces suite comprising walk in shower cubicle with thermostatic shower and extra mid level shower attachment. Wall mounted wash hand basin with mixer tap and low level W.C. Wall mounted heated towel rail, karndean flooring, spot lights, extractor fan and partly tiled walls.

Communal garden Laid to lawn with an allocated timber storage shed.

Parking Allocated parking space to the front.

Directions From Station Square, Turn right to stay on Station Square and continue onto Fairway. Turn right onto Tudor Way then at the roundabout take the 3rd exit onto Queensway, turn left onto Lakeswood Road then left onto Southborough Lane. Pass the Crooked Billet, Bromley and at the roundabout take the 3rd exit onto Blackbrook Lane.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented 1st floor 1 double bedroom maisonette with own large private garden.
This lovely maisonette has the benefit of being presented in excellent order throughout having been lovingly cared for by the present owners. Who have occupied the property for the last 20 years. The coup de grace as it were is a wonderful large private garden. Although a larger than expected size the garden is easily maintainable and has the added benefit of being secluded with a large good size summer house and two large sheds.
Inside the maisonette there is a hall area with storage for coats and shoes, then there are stairs to the 1st floor where there is a large sunny lounge/living room to the front, a double bedroom with built in wardrobes and ample storage. There was a Juliet Balcony that the vendors have turned into extra storage along with overhead cupboards above the stairs and a loft space that is used for even more storage, coupled with the outside space that the summer house and sheds provide this home has more storage than some houses!
The property is in excellent order with a modern bathroom and kitchen overlooking the rear of the property. The kitchen area also boasts a large pantry cupboard that has been utilised as a utility area for storage of a large fridge/freezer etc.
All in all this maisonette would make an ideal first purchase, investment or just for someone looking to downsize from a larger property whilst needing extra storage.
Located just off the Bromley Rd and within easy reach of multiple railway stations including close proximity to Grove Park which is a 5 or 10 minute walk depending on pace and buses to Bromley and Beckenham, Catford & Lewisham are all a few minutes walk away.
Beckenham Place Park is also about 5 mins walk away according to the vendor which is an excellent place for cycling, walking, family picnics etc..
Please call now for more information or an appointment to view.

title: 4 bed link-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This immaculately renovated top floor studio flat is bright and airy with a fine view over the Victorian rooftops and offered to the market chain free. The main room is L-shaped which facilitates the separation of the sleeping and living area. The property is located on Penge High Street and is a stone's throw away from the beautiful Crystal Palace Park. The flat has excellent transport links as it only takes a 0.2 mile walk to reach both Penge West (Zone 4) & Penge East (to Victoria). (walking distances estimated by google maps).

The property would be an ideal buy to let investment as the property has been previously let for £800pcm which which would achieve a 5.3% rental yield in South East London.

Viewings are highly recommended to appreciate all the flat has to offer.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.
The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991

Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. detailedDescription:
We are pleased to offer this attractively presented three bedroom semi detached house situated in a popular road of similar type properties on the New Eltham/Chislehurst border.

The ground floor accommodation is further enhanced by a family room and double glazed conservatory which is ideal for entertaining. There is also a separate utility room off the kitchen, a must for a growing family.

Upstairs there are two double bedrooms and one single. There is also a bathroom which is fitted with a contemporary white suite.

Outside to the rear is a pleasant garden of ample proportions comprising a patio area and lawn with shrub borders. To front is a small garden and off street parking.

The location is excellent being less than a mile from Chislehurst village centre, 1.2 miles from New Eltham station and 0.9 of a mile from the popular Redhill Primary school.

Council Tax:- Royal Borough of Greenwich, Band E, £2,004.44

detailedDescription:
EPC band: D

Situated in the Heart of Bromley Old Town conservation area, this stunning two bedroom Victorian cottage with purpose built loft room is a pleasure to view. Cleverly planned and lovingly refurbished with great attention to detail throughout. The attractive open plan double reception room is light and airy with access from the dining room to the beautiful patio garden. The newly appointed kitchen is fitted out with integral appliances and a new combination boiler, It boasts lots of natural light from the expanse of windows in the room. On the first floor there are two bedrooms plus a sleek and modern bathroom suite with a separate shower cubicle. The third floor benefits from a loft room which can be used as a bedroom for occasional use or as a fabulous home office, the separate staircase can is closed off by a door for peace and quiet from the rest of the house. Conveniently placed between three stations, Bromley North and South plus Sundridge Park. Bromley High Street, the Glades shopping mall and many pubs and restaurants are less than half a mile away.

A unique opportunity to acquire this beautifully modernised two bedroom Victorian cottage, located in the heart of the fashionable Bromley Old Town conservation area, conveniently between Sundridge Park and Bromley North stations. The accommodation comprises a lounge with fireplace, dining area, fitted kitchen and white bathroom. On the first floor are two double bedrooms. Outside there is a patio garden. Bromley High Street, The Glades shopping mall & many pubs and restaurants are all less than half a mile away. EPC: D

Fantastic and extremely rare opportunity to purchase this immaculate four double bedroom link-detached family home. The property is located in a sought after location, within close proximity of Common land and the historic Royal Parade.

The ground floor boasts a welcoming entrance hall, WC, large bay fronted living room, dining room and a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances. The first floor benefits from four bedrooms (master with en suite) and a luxury family bathroom.

Outside enjoys a landscaped rear garden that has been extremely well maintained, there is also a driveway to the front that leads to the tandem garage.

A stunning four/five bedroom detached family home forming part of three private houses set behind electronically controlled gates in Bickley.

Arranged over three floors, the property comprises a spacious entrance hall, reception room with French doors leading to the rear garden, downstairs WC, separate play room/study which leads to the double garage with utility area, impressive kitchen/diner with luxury touches such as quartz worktops, integrated appliances, underfloor heating and bi-folding doors opening onto south westerly facing garden.

Across the first and second floors there is an immaculate family bathroom with separate shower and five double bedrooms of which two benefit from en-suite shower rooms. Notable features include off street parking for up to two cars on the driveway, cat 6 wiring, well maintained front and rear garden.

Located in a quiet cul-de-sac off Southborough Lane with Bickley Station only 0.9 miles away, providing regular access into central London. A variety of shopping facilities are available in Petts Wood which is just over a mile away.

Energy Efficiency Rating C.

detailedDescription:
One of the best additions to SE20 is this extremely well designed and planned development. Hidden behind Anerley Hill, the Crystal Palace Triangle with its huge array of facilities is on your doorstep as well as fantastic connections via Anerley Station, Crystal Palace Station and local bus routes.

Built just over a year ago, the development centres around gorgeous communal gardens that are available for all residents to enjoy.

The flat itself is on the 1st floor and benefits from far reaching views from the elevated position with large windows providing good light flow.

Internally the property has been extremely well kept offering the perfect opportunity to move straight in with a pleasant balcony to enjoy all year around.

The kitchen is fully fitted with white gloss units featuring built-in electric oven and ceramic hob.
The development is within 12 minutes walk to Crystal Palace station and less than a 5 minute walk to Anerley Station.

Crystal Palace and Anerley station offer around a 25 minute journey to London Bridge and 28 minute journey to London Victoria. Benefitting from the overground line, trains run regularly to Canada Water within 19 minutes.

Further benefits include gated private parking space, cycle store, lift, remaining NHBC warranty and a long lease. Call iMove for your viewing asap.

detailedDescription:
Well presented three bedroom 1930s house on Clayhill Crescent ready to move in. Features include: Open plan living, lounge/diner and just a short 0.9 mile stroll to a city bound station.

Arranged over two floors, the ground floor starts with a broad entrance hall offering access to all rooms with a exposed wood staircase and under stair storage. The galley kitchen has access to the rear, through lounge and dining room - featuring a bright bay window. The first floor landing gives way to two larger than the average double bedrooms and the third would work perfectly as a home office/single bedroom or a cot room for a new addition to the family. The over 80ft south facing garden is particularly pleasant from the French doors in the dining area – ideal for BBQs & summer parties.

The location is second to none, just 0.9m from Grove Park station, 0.7m from Bannatyne’s Health Club and just 0.4m from the local convenience shops on Chinbrook Road - all the while only a short drive from Eltham High Street, Blackheath Village or Bromley town centre for the shoppers out there. Grove Park station is Zone 4 & offers direct links into London Bridge, Charing Cross, Waterloo East & Cannon Street in as little as 15 minutes.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

address: Holwood Park Avenue, Keston Park BR6
detailedDescription:
On the market for the first time in almost fifty years, and situated deep into the ever popular gated Keston Park Estate, we are pleased to offer Barfield a 1930s residence sitting on this mature 0.68 acre plot at the end of Keston Parks most prestigious road next.

Approached via its own gated drive, the property enjoys a 40m wide frontage with west facing aspect to rear and is positioned next to woodland.

Barfield has retained all of its original character, with accommodation that extends to just over 3000 sq ft., its feature gardens have been well tended and are to three sides of the property.

There are four principle reception areas, in addition to a sun room and fitted kitchen breakfast room,

With four bedrooms, two bathrooms and dressing room, all rooms enjoy secluded views over the established grounds. The property has excellent potential to develop or extend subject to the usual planning consents.

There is also garaging for up to four cars, with attached workshop and utility room.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
In the heart of Keston Park and occupying a registered double plot, Glen Gables is one of the few original properties remaining from the conception of the estate in the 1920s and itself dates from 1927, having been built by the founding family for their own occupation. In the ownership of the present occupiers since 1976, the house has been maintained very well and is typical of the period with charming exteriors of whitewashed textured render under a pitched, tiled roof and double glazed windows and French doors. Internally features such as parquet flooring, exposed wall panelling, quarry tiled window sills and a variety of fireplace styles add to the warm and welcoming atmosphere. Reception rooms are gracious and the kitchen/breakfast room neatly arranged, supported by a utility room along with an inner courtyard, additional WC and a cellar. Laid out across the first floor are four bedrooms, supported by two bathrooms, one en-suite to the principal bedroom, whilst the attic is accessed via a fixed staircase.

Outside
Approached via a crescent shaped ‘in and out’ drive, the house occupies a commanding position, adhering to the original concept of the estate by not having an enclosed frontage or large gates. The gardens are very secluded and mature with a large variety of tall, majestic trees, specimen shrubs, dense perimeter hedging, areas of lawn, colourful herbaceous borders, a stream and various terraces from which to enjoy the gardens and outdoor entertaining. A garage has parking for two cars plus storage and there are several timber sheds and a greenhouse.

Situation
Keston Park is one of the most prestigious and unique places to live within the M25. Its enviable location allows for an exclusive, protected gated community and yet is close to both London and the beautiful Kent countryside. Designated as a Conservation Area and laid out over approximately 140 acres, the estate includes two large swathes of woodland for the use of the residents as well as charming features such as the original 1920s street lamps. Local shopping, bars and cafes can be found at Locksbottom, whilst the vibrant and thriving town of Bromley lies just over three miles away to the north with its collection of nationally known stores and restaurants, The Glades shopping centre, cinemas and the Churchill Theatre arts complex. Train services to London Victoria (from 18 mins), London Blackfriars (from 30 mins) and London St Pancras (from 45 mins) as well as to the ports on the coast can be found at Bromley South with trains to London Charing Cross/London Cannon Street (from 40 mins) from Hayes village and also Orpington, both of which are about 2.2 miles away. The area is renowned for its choices in schooling at both primary and secondary levels, state and private sectors including the local state school Darrick Wood which was rated ‘Outstanding’ by Ofsted, grammar schools Newstead Wood and St Olave’s and independent schools Sevenoaks School, Bromley High School for Girls, Whitgift, Trinity School and Eltham College.

Additional Information
Over the past few years, our clients have made thorough investigations as to any potential at Glen Gables for extension and/or redevelopment of the site as a whole. Various consultations with planning consultants and the local planning authority have taken place with all being very favourable. A Deed of Variation is in place which confirms the site as a double plot and therefore could give rise to the potential of replacing the existing property with two separate dwellings which would take advantage of the contours of the plot and have accommodation arranged over four floors. All and any potential would be subject to any necessary planning permissions with the required authorities.
Please apply to the agent for further details

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £1,000,000 - £1,100,000 / Virtual Viewing Available*

Occupying 1/3 acre is this spacious four double bedroom detached home with a considerable rear extension.

The ground floor comprises a large entrance hallway, three reception rooms, two of which are generously sized with one benefitting from French doors on to a private patio area and the other including a characterful original wood burning fireplace that has been retained and updated during refurbishment. The third occupies part of the magnificent rear extension along with the kitchen and dining area. A bespoke kitchen has been fitted with contrasting white and dark blue shaker style units and finished with quartz work surfaces, it also includes a range cooker, kitchen island with breakfast bar and has ample storage. Built with two roof lanterns, plenty of windows and French doors onto the garden this bright space in the property allows open plan living at its best.

A fourth bedroom, which could also be used as a playroom or large office, plumbed utility room, family bathroom and study completes this floor.

The first floor comprises three further double bedrooms; one enjoying the stunning views in to the rear garden and the other two benefitting from built in wardrobes. This floor also has a family bathroom with a modern high end walk-in shower.

Externally the property benefits from a substantial and beautifully secluded 188 ft x 53 ft south facing garden with a patio wrapped around the house. The garden backs onto Goddington Park offering a peaceful outlook with a choice of playing fields and sports facilities.

Other benefits include off street parking, garage and side access to the rear garden.

Nearby there are a selection of highly regarded schools such as Highway Primary School (0.6m)* and the super selective St Olave’s Grammar School for boys (0.7m).

Chelsfield Station (0.9m) and Orpington Station (1.4m) both offer good links into central London and around Kent.

*Distances are measured in a straight line.

detailedDescription:
Located in a quiet cul de sac, this extended 1930's mid terrace family home, offers well designed and modern accommodation over three floors.

The interior of the home briefly comprises of an entrance hallway, lounge, open plan kitchen/dining room with modern units and integrated double oven and microwave fitted in 2019. Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom and finally the loft has been converted to provide an additional bedroom/occasional room.
Outside there is off street parking for two cars to the front and a detached garden lodge (converted from the garage) complete with w.c., at the rear. This provides an ideal space for a home office or gym or as the current owners enjoy as an additional play room/living space.
Other features include double glazing, a new roof (2018), a gas Combi boiler system (installed 2019), neutral and inviting décor throughout and a beautiful low maintenance rear garden.
Located within an approx. Five minute walk of Grove Park station which provides fast and frequent trains to London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing X, or change at Lewisham for the DLR.
School options are in abundance so a perfect base for families and professionals alike. There are regular buses into Bromley and surrounding towns and shops within easy walking distance.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

detailedDescription:
This 3 bedroom 1930's built semi-detached property offers a fantastic development opportunity to an incoming purchaser.

Accommodation briefly comprises a bright entrance hall with understairs storage; spacious sitting room with a feature curved window with an aspect over the the front of the property and feature fireplace; large dining room which spans the width of the property and leads to a large kitchen extension which is light and bright and offers views over the garden to the rear. The ground floor accommodation offers ample living space to this property, which will make an ideal family home once modernised.

To the first floor are two double bedrooms and one single bedroom and a family bathroom.

Externally to the front there is an area of lawn which could be adapted to provide for off street parking like many of the other properties in the road. A shared driveway then leads to the rear and provides access to the large garage and rear garden. This consists of a patio area with the remainder featuring strip paving, together with pebbles and flower bed with fruit trees to one side. To the bottom of the garden there is a greenhouse and fruit bushes.

This much loved family home is located within walking distance of Hayes railway station and Station approach with its many shops and restaurants. Bromley town centre is also within a 5 minute drive and boasts an array of some 400 shops not to mention the new St Marks square complex which will bring many more shops / bars and restaurants, together with a multi-complex cinema. The very highly rated Hayes secondary school is within 0.6 of a mile, whilst Hayes Primary School and Pickhurst infant & junior academies are all within walking distance.

Other main points worthy of noting include gas fired central heating, double glazing throughout, off road parking at the front, extended ground floor living area, situated within Hayes Secondary School catchment area and priced to reflect the need for refurbishment. It is offered with no onward chain.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Tucked away from the street this property is conveniently located for transport links, schools, amenities and greenspace.

Boasting two double bedrooms, an upstairs bathroom, and an conservatory overlooking the low maintenance garden. The property is neutrally decorated and well presented, and offers scope for further extension (stlp).

Located just 0.9m from Elmstead Woods station which offers frequent trains into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street. There are bus links close by taking you towards Eltham, Greenwich, Chislehurst, New Addington via Bromley. You are situated in between Mottingham and Chislehurst where by you will find a range of amenities including shops, restaurants, and cafes.

The property is situated close to Marvels Wood and is also close by to Elmstead Woods making it a perfect balance between leafy surburbia and London connections.

Local schools include Castlecombe, St Vincent, Mottingham and Montbelle Primary schools and Eltham College.

address: Carfax House, Worcester Close, London SE20
detailedDescription:
Positioned on the raised 2nd floor of the extremely well located and popular Scholars Court, this larger than average 1 bedroom flat is sure to generate immediate interest.

Built just over 7 years ago, the flat is extremely economical and comes with a South facing private balcony with one of the best outlooks in the development.

Internally, the flat is tastefully decorated throughout with wood flooring in the hallway and reception room.

The lounge has a fantastic outlook benefiting from views over the landscaped communal gardens.

The kitchen is fully stocked with built in appliances including a dishwasher, white gloss units and darker work surface.

The bedroom is a great size with views over the communal gardens and a double fitted wardrobe.

The hallway includes fitted storage cupboards, something that can be easily overlooked.

The property further benefits from solar energy which only a few flats in the development benefit from which significantly lower your monthly energy bills.

Located at the end of Versailles Road, Crystal Palace and Anerley stations are a short stroll away as well as The Crystal Palace Triangle and its huge array of facilities.

Offered chain free, we recommend your earliest viewing.

Guide Price - £300,000 - £325,000.

address: St. Pauls Cray Road, Chislehurst BR7
detailedDescription:
A beautiful two bedroom, two bathroom second floor retirement property (over 60's) in a fantastic location.

Internally the property consists of two spacious bedrooms with the master bedroom having the bonus of an en-suite and walk in wardrobe. There is also a further shower room, a light and airy lounge and a good sized kitchen with integrated appliances. Further benefits include underfloor heating throughout, airflow system and a water softener.

Faulkner House was completed in 2015 and boasts luxurious landscaped gardens, a residents' lounge in which a variety of functions and clubs are held and an onsite concierge, who is available during office hours. Each flat has a 24 hour emergency personal alarm call system and an electronic entry system. There is a lift to all floors and a guest suite available for use by visiting friends and family.

The location is second to none with Royal Parade and it's boutique shops, fine restaurants and the popular Bulls Head pub practically on your door step. The beautiful Chislehurst Commons and ponds are also within walking distance and Chislehurst High Street is just 0.6 miles away. The property is well serviced for transport with Chislehurst station offering regular services into Lewisham (for DLR), Central London and The City and bus stops can be found on Royal Parade itself.

detailedDescription: Open house event Saturday 3rd July. We are delighted to present to the market chain free this 3 bedroom house nestled in a quiet close within a popular development. Internally, the property comprises a welcoming entrance hall leading to the lounge which is bright and airy, the dining room has double doors opening onto the rear garden. There is a fitted kitchen with built-in oven/hob and fridge/freezer. There is a ground floor cloakroom and separate utility room with a courtesy door to the integral single garage. To the first floor are 3 double bedrooms, the master benefitting from an en suite shower room and completing the accommodation is the family bathroom. Externally, the rear garden is low maintenance and is fully paved. To the front of the property, there is a single garage and a paved driveway. Winnipeg Drive is ideally situated for Green Street Green High Street with its array of popular shops including Waitrose, and also public bus routes which offer frequent services into Bromley, Orpington High Street and Orpington Station (providing fast trains into London), also within close proximity is the ever-popular Green Street Green Primary School. Additionally, Winnipeg Drive offers the 'best of both' with the M25 only a few minutes drive away whilst the popular and picturesque High Elms Country Park and Golf Course is located nearby. Interest will inevitably be high for this attractive property therefore we urge your earliest attention.<br /><br />

Charming 3 bed split level conversion flat within grade 2 listed former Bakery situated in the heart of this unspoilt village on the edge of open countryside yet within easy access of neighbouring town centres. Chain-free.

Occupying the top two floors of the "Old Bakery" this character and spacious residence offers an abundance of charm and original features such as exposed brick work and stripped wood floors. The accommodation comprises; 2 double bedrooms, dining room/bedroom 3, large kitchen, bathroom and a well-appointed lounge. The property is accessed through a gated entrance and has a private staircase with seating area leading off a cobbled Courtyard. Being in the heart of the village you're right on top of local shops, public transport and also on the doorstep of open countryside including Farnborough fields and High Elms (ideal for dog walking). Converted in the mid 1980's the property benefits from a host of improvements and must be viewed internally to be appreciated. Chain-free.

This 3-bed house is not expected to be around for long!

A fantastic family home in a quiet cul-de-sac. Built with love in 2019, by the current owners, this home is looking for a new family to take it on to its next chapter.

Step in from the driveway to the hall, which has a handy cloakroom toilet off it. There is an open plan living/dining/kitchen space with a modern approach to living on the ground floor, giving a lovely light and airy feel to the space. The living area looks out to a well-maintained garden with a garden hut and space for a kid’s trampoline/swing and is accessed via bi-fold doors. The kitchen is beautifully appointed with integrated appliances including an induction hob, dishwasher, single oven, microwave, and washer/dryer.

On the first floor there are 2 large bedrooms, 1 with en suite, and the family bathroom. On the second floor there is a large master bedroom with storage into the eaves.

As a new build, this property benefits from a structural warranty which will be valid until 2029; Gas central Heating powered by a GloWorm Boiler; and double glazing throughout. Ample Storage has been built in to this property as a further benefit.

The parade of independent shops and restaurants is a 2-minute walk from your front door offering everything from your morning coffee to lunch to an afternoon glass of fizz. Equally close is South Norwood Park which is perfect for family walks or for runners and cyclists looking for something a bit more off-road.

detailedDescription:
This delightful second floor converted apartment is now available. In a tree lined residential location close to all amenities transport links and in excellent condition the property is ready to move straight into for its new owners.

The local area is fantastic as you have choice of frequenting Crystal Palace for its excellent eateries and wineries and also its Every Man Cinema, not to mention excellent coffee shops and local amenities. If Palace is not for you then you also have Beckenham in the opposite direction which is known for its excellent restaurants and bars and also as an array of superb amenities, cinemas and boutique shops, Beckenham Spa Leisure Centre, library, Odeon cinema.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.
The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful home located within a handsome detached Edwardian property positioned in the much sought after Rodway Road in Bromley North.

This gem of a home is positioned on the ground floor, on entering the flat there is a hallway where you can kick off your coat and shoes.
The open plan kitchen living space is spacious, over 15 ft., large and beautiful timber frame sash windows allow the light to flood. The kitchen includes plenty of fitted units, an integrated hob, oven and extractor. The kitchen is clean, minimal and tastefully designed with neutral handless cupboards and a smart slate grey worktop. Within the living space there is plenty of space for furniture and the open feel makes it a great space for entertaining.

The bedroom is a bright, light and restful space, there are two windows that allow light to fill the room, the carpet is neutral and keeps the room feeling cosy and there is a luxurious ensuite shower room. There is also a further separate WC in the flat which is handy for guests.

The communal areas in the building are in impeccable condition and there are shared grounds which include washing lines outside for drying clothes on a sunny day.

Rodway Road is positioned in Bromley North within approx. 5 mins walk of Bromley North and Sundridge Park mainline stations, Bromley South station is less than a mile away. The stations have direct lines and connections to London’s central railway stations including Victoria, London Bridge and Charing Cross.

Bromley North has an almost seaside village feel, populated with cute Victorian cottages and grand Edwardian mansions. Within staggering distance there is a selection of good local pubs including The Red Lion, The White Horse and Anglesey Arms. Slightly further afield in Bromley town Centre there is an abundance of high street shops, a M&S, Sainsburys, Boots, Costa Coffee etc. Plus a great mix of small, local independent boutiques, bars, cafes and restaurants. Bromley is also home to The Churchill Theatre, a Picturehouse Cinema, a number of gyms and several mall shopping complexes.

Sundridge Park has a local feel with a strong sense of community, there are a number of excellent independent shops, cafes bars and restaurants. Some of our favourite spots include the grocers Roots & Shoots, The Larder and for a good curry Raj Moni.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Attention Buyers! Neo's is proud to offer on to the market this beautifully spacious and very modern first floor one Double Bedroom flat which is ideally located within close proximity to Bromley South Station with its great links to Victoria station.
The Property itself offers a spacious lounge-diner with an open-plan kitchen with integrated appliances including fridge/freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. There is a spacious hallway with storage with door leading to one well-proportioned bedroom with storage and also off the hallway is a modern bathroom with 3 piece white suite. There is the added bonus of a private terrace which is the perfect setting for a morning coffee or Al Fresco dining . The property is located on Bromley High Street which offers an array of shops, restaurants, cafes and bars. Bromley is an ideal place to live and benefits from being walking distance to the churchill theatre and also two cinemas.
This beautiful home benefits from a electrical heating system and is fully double glazed throughout. If you are looking for an abundance of storage then look no further as this home will not disappoint you. Please call today to avoid any disappointment and book your safe covid viewing, I will always meet you outside the property and we will conduct a safe viewing.Whilst on the viewing to keep all as safe as possible if you prefer I can open doors, cupboards etc don’t be shy to ask as I am happy to do so.
Important information: EPC rating C.
We are informed by the current owner that the remaining lease is approx. 120 years(to be confirmed), Ground Rent approx. £300 (to be confirmed), Service charge approx. £1500 which is being reviewed and potentially will decrease (to be confirmed).

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Three Bedroom Mid Terrace Town House – all interest and offers are invited.

*Guide Price £600,000 - £625,000*

Property is situated within highly sought after and quiet location, making this the perfect family home. With flexible living space and private rear gardens.

Internal:
Entrance Hall - Front door opens to. Fitted with wooden effect flooring throughout and understair storage cupboard. Rear door access to garden.
Bedroom Three - Double sized bedroom with fitted wardrobe/storage cupboard and wooden effect flooring throughout. With window bringing plenty of natural lighting.
Shower Room - Modern 3 Piece Suite comprising; Shower enclosure with overhead mixer tap and surrounding tile walls. Low level WC and wash hand basin. With fitted tile flooring and extractor fan.

First Floor Landing -
Lounge - Generous sized lounge area with fitted wooden effect flooring throughout and ample space for a range of furniture. Lounge also boasts French door access to Juliette style balcony.
Kitchen - Fitted with a range of modern wall and base units, including integral combi electric oven, hob and overhead extraction fan surrounded by splash back tile walls. Kitchen also boasts integrated appliances such as Bosch dishwasher, fridge freezer and washing machine.

Second Floor Landing -
Bedroom One - Double sized bedroom with fitted wardrobe/storage cupboards and door to;
En-Suite - 3 Piece Suite comprising; Shower enclosure with overhead waterfall shower tap and surrounding tile walls. Low level WC and wash hand basin.
Bedroom Two - L-shaped double sized bedroom with fitted wardrobe/storage cupboard and window bringing natural lighting.
Bathroom - Modern 3 Piece Suite comprising; Panelled bathtub with overhead shower tap attachment and surrounding tile walls. Low level WC and wash hand basin within vanity unit. Also boasting a heated towel rail and extractor fan.

External:
Rear Garden - Private garden with both wooden decking and paved patio areas, providing ample space for outdoor furniture, plant beds and shrubbery.
Garage - Integral single space garage with power and lighting. Up and over door providing off road parking and storage space.
Driveway - Paved driveway to front of property providing off road parking.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

The rear private garden is beautiful and this flat offers more space than some small houses and represents excellent value for money.

There is also an allocated car park space and visitor parking which is a real bonus being situated so close to Bromley Town Centre.

detailedDescription:
This detached family home comes to the market with no onward chain and is situated ideally for Chelsfield station and is also under half a mile from the 'outstanding' rated Warren Road Primary School.
The property has been extended and renovated and includes four bedrooms over the two floors.
A hallway at the front has the stairs to the first floor and on the ground floor you will find a through lounge/diner to one side that opens on to a double glazed conservatory. The conservatory is double glazed and has a door to the rear garden.
There is a second reception room that makes an ideal home office that could also double up as a ground floor (4th) bedroom.
The modern fitted kitchen/breakfast room is fitted with a range of wall and base units and comes with an integrated oven and hob, dish washer and washing machine. Here, you will also find the wall mounted gas boiler for the central heating system.
On the first floor there is a landing with a window to the side and doors to the three bedrooms and family bathroom.
The master bedroom has its own en-suite bathroom comprising a bath with shower screen, WC and wash band basin in vanity unit.
The family bathroom also has a bath with shower screen, WC and wash band basin in vanity unit.
Outside, a driveway leads to a detached single garage and there is a private rear garden with lawn and patio.

Many people drawn to the area for the reputable schools the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. Chelsfield station is just a third of a mile away. There are local shops close by at Windsor Drive and Orpington Town Centre has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. You will also find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Great opportunity to purchase a substantial 6 bed detached house overlooking the Common which is end of chain, so ideal if looking to move quickly. The house was rented and is now a blank canvas so is a great opportunity to update and decorate to your own taste and specification.

As you will see from the floorplan there is plenty of accommodation, so the house offers flexibility in terms of how you use the space. There is also an amazing large veranda with ornamental fretwork to the rear of the property overlooking the garden.

Gates give access to the front garden which provides plenty of off street parking and access to the integral garage.

Located approximately 0.25 of a mile from the bustling village High Street in one direction, where there is a good choice of restaurants, cafes and shops and a similar distance to the historic Royal Parade in the other direction. Chislehurst station is approximately 1.2 miles away with fast trains to London Bridge taking from just 18 minutes. Farringtons School, a leading independent, co-educational, day and boarding school, for pupils aged 3 to 18 is is only 0.4 of a mile.

A spacious family home awaiting some tender loving care from its next owner.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase one of Chislehurst's oldest Grade II listed properties dating back as early as the 14th Century. Cadlands is a Unique and charming five bedroom detached family home set on nearly two acres of beautifully landscaped gardens, centred around a picturesque pond complete with its very own duck house. This characterful, period property, set in a tranquil haven, boasts over 5,000 sq ft of living accommodation which includes an additional self-contained two bedroom detached cottage.

Throughout the property there is a wealth of original features, including exposed wooden beams, high ceilings, sash windows, external weather boarding, fireplaces, ceiling roses and cornicing, to name but a few.

Arranged over three floors the property comprises a spacious entrance hall with feature fireplace, three large reception rooms all with original fireplaces, boot room, separate utility room and a large kitchen/diner with central island and feature wood burning stove. Across the first and second floors there is a family bathroom, separate WC and five double bedrooms of which two benefit from en-suite facilities and the master from an additional fitted dressing room. Notably, bedroom number five that occupies the top floor, has access to a rear facing roof terrace providing panoramic views over the surrounding grounds. Across the rear of the main house is an impressive New England style veranda measuring approximately 23'6ft, offering an exceptional entertaining area with outside bar.

To the rear of the property is a detached cottage comprising two double bedrooms, separate WC, bathroom with roll top bath and an open plan kitchen/reception room which is currently arranged as a home office. Towards the rear of the garden are two further outbuildings including a studio, a West facing summer house and private direct access into Scadbury Park, famous for once being the home of Thomas Walsingham and now a bustling 300 acre nature reserve.

Close by is Royal Parade and the High Street offering a great choice of gastro pubs, restaurants and cafes, as well as local stores and a Sainsbury's supermarket.

There are several excellent schools within proximity including Bromley High School, Bullers Wood, Farringtons, Babington House, Bickley Park and Eltham College.

By car, the M25 is easily accessible with City Airport just 12.5 miles and Gatwick Airport 33 miles away.

Energy Efficiency Rating E.

detailedDescription:
One of two available, this newly refurbished one bedroom maisonette makes an ideal buy-to-let investment or first time buy and is offered to the market with no onward chain.

Situated in a highly convenient location above shops on the edge of Orpington town centre, stations can be found close by St. Mary Cray (0.85 miles) and Orpington (1.0 mile).

Access to the property is behind Carlton Parade where external stairs lead to a landing, off of which you will find the private front door. The shop below is currently a Co-Op store.

Once inside you will find a hallway with laminate wood flooring and a built-in storage cupboard, which in turn leads to the open plan kitchen/reception room.

The kitchen area has a range of wall and base units with contrasting work surfaces, a stainless steel sink unit and appliances including a gas hob, electric oven, washing machine and fridge freezer.

The living room area has three double glazed windows to the front and laminate wood flooring.

The double bedroom has a double glazed window to the rear, laminate wood flooring and a radiator.

The modern shower room is accessed from the hallway and includes a large walk-in shower cubicle, wash hand basin inset into vanity unit, low level WC and chrome heated towel rail. Here you will also find the wall mounted gas combination boiler. There is a frosted double glazed window to the side.

The property comes with a new lease of 125 years.

Orpington is a thriving suburban town within the M25 and therefore ideally situated for access to the motorway network and the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. The town centre has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. A little way out of town you will find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Larger shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.<br /><br />

Guide Price £800,000 - £850,000.
Hunters are proud to offer to the market this beautifully presented four bedroom semi-detached family home situated 0.5 miles from Elmstead Woods station (Zone 4) and 0.8 miles from the amenities of Chislehurst high street, pond and comnmons.

The accommodation comprises to the ground floor entrance hall with storage cupboard, dining room, lounge with feature brick fireplace and further reception area with sliding patio doors to the rear garden, open plan kitchen, utility room with door to garage and garden and downstairs bathroom. Stairs lead to the first floor landing with doors to four bedrooms and a storage cupboard. The master bedroom has a large en-suite shower room. Outside to the front there is an integral garage, driveway, well maintained front lawn garden and a side gate leading to the rear garden. The stunning rear garden is landscaped with a patio area leading to the lawn garden with plant and shrub border, enclosed patio seating area and timber shed.

Internal viewing is highly recommended. EPC Rating D.

detailedDescription:
A lovely five bedroom detached family home offered in superb order. In quiet sought after residential road just
0.3 from Chislehurst High Street, a lovely walk passing the duck ponds.

With five bedrooms and three contemporary style bathrooms, two being ensuites, you can house your growing family easily here.

Having a front to rear lounge with feature stone fireplace, a family room with ceiling lantern and doors to the garden, a large study for those working from home or could even be used as a playroom, versatile to your needs. The bespoke fabulous quality wood kitchen with central island and ceiling lantern is a lovely hub of the house.

A utility room and downstairs w c. Complete the ground floor accommodation.

The garden to the rear is simply stunning, with large patio area, fabulous for your barbeques and garden parties this is such a lovely garden, very private. To the front there is a driveway for several cars leading to the double garage.

In essence you need to view to appreciate what is on offer.

London Borough of Bromley - Council Tax Band G - £2,819.20

detailedDescription:
Situated in the popular Shepperton Road is this three bedroom detached bungalow that is ideally situated for Petts Wood village with its array of shops, amenities, bus routes and mainline station which serves an array of London termini. The popular Crofton Primary school is also conveniently located.

The accommodation comprises hallway, three bedrooms, family bathroom with separate toilet, modern fitted kitchen and two spacious reception rooms. To the front is a carriage driveway which provides ample off street parking and access to the attached garage. To the rear of the property is the garden which is mainly laid to lawn with the addition of a garden shed.

Internal viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate all that this detached bungalow has to offer.
