detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available.

Located on one of West Wickham's favourable roads, is this fantastic extended four bedroom semi-detached home that is offered in excellent condition and has further potential to extend (STPP).

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall, reception room, kitchen/dining room with a selection of wall and base units, wooden worktops and tiled splashback, integrated appliances that include gas hob, oven, extractor, microwave, fridge, Bosch washing machine and dishwasher, wooden flooring throughout and sliding doors onto the garden, downstairs cloakroom with integral access to the garage. The upstairs accommodation consists of three double bedrooms and a good size single, separate cloakroom, modern family bathroom that includes a separate shower cubicle.

To the rear of the house is a paved patio area, lawn area and side access. To the front of the property is off street parking and a lawn area.

Notable features include mains pressure hot and cold water throughout, photo voltaic solar panels and any unused electricity from the solar panels is used to heat the water in the cylinder.

Oak Grove is a sought after location with exceptional access to the High Street with its array of amenities, train station, school catchments that include Hawes Down Primary and Langley Secondary.

Energy Efficiency Rating B.

detailedDescription: Vincent Chandler are delighted to offer for sale this first floor, 2 bedroomed maisonette. Set within the leafy and quiet Beckenham Grove residential area and set back from the road with a generous garden. Located within walking distance to Shortlands Main line station, offering direct rail links into London Victoria, Blackfriars, City Thameslink and St Pancras International. Shortlands Village, and Bromley Town Centre are both within Walking distance. Beckenham High Street is a short bus ride away. This property is ideally located to access all three areas and their array of shops, cafes and restaurants easily. The property would make an ideal first time buy investment and can be lived in immediately and is offered with no onward chain. The property comes with its own garage and outdoor garden space. The block is self-managed by the resident owners and as such comes with a very long lease, low service and maintenance charges. We would recommend a viewing immediately to realise the investment potential this property has to offer.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This fantastic split level maisonette is situated in the heart of Orpington town centre with all the shops and amenities, cinema and sports centre within easy reach of your front door. Perhaps most importantly, Orpington station with its fast service (c.16 minutes) into London is just half a mile away. Forming part of a mews-like setting to the rear of the High Street, this development of maisonettes enjoy a communal entrance gate with entry phone system and shared garden area but the property also benefits from having its own private decked garden terrace with direct access from the patio doors. It is ideal as a safe and secure area for children to enjoy some outside space or the adults to enjoy a BBQ or glass of wine!
The property, accessed from the end of Juglans Road (behind the High Street) has split level accommodation over two floors and includes three bedrooms upstairs. It was completely refurbished 4 years ago and comes with a fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, including an induction hob, and a modern bathroom with bath, shower screen and combination shower with 'waterfall' shower head. The living area enjoys views over the High Street and the dining area is open plan to the kitchen which also has patio doors to the garden. The lease has in excess of 120 years.

Orpington is a thriving suburban town within the M25 with many people drawn to the area for the reputable schools the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. The Town Centre has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. You will also find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.<br /><br />
title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A superbly presented two bedroom top floor converted apartment located just a few minutes walk to Shortlands Railway Station offering regular rail services into Central London and the West End via London Victoria.

Bromley Town centre is within easy reach with over 400 retail units to choose from being one of the most extensive shopping centres in the region.

The Glades shopping Centre boasts over 130 stores alone. Bromley South is currently part of a regeneration programme at St Marks Square offering a new brand of leisure and dining units including a new cinema complex.

The property has been decorated in recent years with a contemporary theme throughout., the next owner can move in with nothing to do.

Features include a bright and airy lounge with storage cupboard, modern fitted Kitchen with integrated appliances, 2 proportioned double bedrooms, the master benefiting in-built storage space/wardrobes and part tilled bathroom.

The property offers, gas central heating, communal off-street parking, delightful well maintained communal garden and wooded area.

All of these aspects make this property one which should not be missed, we strongly recommend your earliest viewing in order to take advantage of this fantastic opportunity.

detailedDescription:
Linay & Shipp are pleased to offer this sympathetically refurbished and recently modernised family home with further development potential. A character 5 bedroom semi-detached house occupying a substantial plot with the possibility of building a further dwelling to the side. Enjoying a sought after location, close to Warren Road Primary School and with easy access to Chelsfield station.

Built in 1907, a good size 5 bedroom semi-detached family home with spacious rooms and high ceilings, the accommodation comprises, entrance hall leading to 2 generous reception rooms, kitchen with utility room and a ground floor shower room, on the first floor there are 4 bedrooms and a family bathroom with staircase to the top floor where there is a further good size bedroom which is currently used as an office. There is also scope to create further rooms in the spacious loft area and also to extend the ground floor accommodation, if required, subject to the usual consents.

The property enjoys a generous size plot with the potential to build a further detached dwelling to the side of the existing property (planning consents required).

detailedDescription:
Chain free

We are delighted to offer the 'coolest' luxury 3 bedroom penthouse apartment in Bromley right now - this flat benefits from air conditioning to almost the entire flat!

Located in a particularly quiet position of Bromley North, and forming part of a recently constructed private development at the end of a cul-de-sac, this luxury property benefits from contemporary neutral decoration and flooring throughout, three double bedrooms, all with built-in wardrobes, an ensuite shower room to the main bedroom, together with a spacious family bathroom, and a beautiful open plan living, dining and kitchen area with Juliet balcony.

Bromley town centre is approximately 10 minutes walk from the property, with Bromley North, Bromley South and Shortlands stations all within easy reach. There is a private residents' car park to the rear and this flat benefits from one private allocated parking space.

There is also a loft space above the flat which the vendors advise forms part of the property.

Priced for a quick sale - an early viewing is highly recommended.

Entrance Hall

Panelled multi-point locking front door, wood flooring, wall-mounted air conditioning unit, video entry phone system, ceiling light fitting, two storage cupboards.

Open Plan Living/Dining/Kitchen

White panelled door, fitted carpet, radiator, double glazed French doors opening to Juliet balcony, large lounging space, separate area for dining, modern grey integrated kitchen suite with integrated fridge/freezer, integrated dishwasher, integrated washing machine, wood effect worktops, tiled splashback, recessed down-lights, wall-mounted air conditioning unit.

Bedroom 1

White panelled door, fitted carpet, wall-mounted air conditioning unit, double glazed window, built in wardrobes, radiator, ceiling light fitting.

Ensuite Shower Room

White panelled door, tiled flooring, pedestal wash basin, WC, corner shower enclosure with glass folding door, wall integrated shower controls, chrome heated towel rail, shelving, mirror, recessed down-lights.

Bedroom 2

White panelled door, fitted carpet, double glazed window, ceiling light fitting, radiator, built-in wardrobe that connects to hallway.

Bedroom 3

White panelled door, fitted carpet, wall mounted air conditioning unit, double glazed window, built-in wardrobe, radiator, ceiling light fitting.

Bathroom

White panelled door, tiled flooring, WC, pedestal wash basin, white bath with shower mixer and additional wall integrated shower controls, glass shower screen, chrome heated towel rail, extractor fan, recessed down-lights, modern large bathroom cabinet with mirrored doors.

Parking/Outside

There is a residents' car park to the rear of this development, within which this property benefits from an allocated parking space.
The development also benefits from two communal garden areas.

detailedDescription:
Jdm are delighted to offer to the market this extremely well presented three bedroom terrace house. The property is conveniently located for number of popular schools as well as offers access to Bickley, Bromley South and Petts Wood mainline stations.

detailedDescription:
Individually designed by the Architects Anthony Goddard and Donald Manton in 1975, Tapiola was constructed to maximise social living space and natural light by way of large glazing throughout. Inventive in its design and systematically integrated into a wooded environment, the property won the Architects a commendation from the riba shortly after it was built. Set within leafy surroundings and occupying a desirable cul-de-sac aspect, this unique family home briefly comprises three double bedrooms arranged over two levels, three reception rooms, bright contemporary kitchen to front aspect, en-suite bathroom of the main bedroom, family bathroom with shower and sauna, utility room, cloakroom and large garage. Many of its original high quality design features have been retained to include: The use of floor to ceiling windows, exposed brickwork and central double height ceiling with four roof lights. Behind the chimney stack and wood burner you will find the main living area leading to the rear garden. An open tread staircase ascends to the vast galleried landing where there is a master bedroom, an en-suite bathroom and versatile reception room overlooking the living area. Two double bedrooms on the ground floor connect to the courtyard garden and family bathroom. Outside you will find a secluded frontage, deep driveway for parking, woodland style rear garden and large garage. Benefits to note include: Gas central heating, part underfloor heating, double glazing, pressurised hot water system, electric car charging unit and parking for several cars. Beechcroft is conveniently placed for village amenities, a 10-15 minute walk to Elmstead Woods mainline station, reputable nearby schools, the Commons for outdoor space, good transport links and just a short drive to motorway connections (M20 and M25). To fully appreciate the design detail and space on offer (2545 sq ft approx.) we recommend interior viewing. Exclusive to proctors.

Any golfers are served well by Chislehurst Golf Club which offers excellent facilities.

The original part of Moorlands was developed by William Willett and designed by Amos Faulkener in 1902, It was the first house in the Wilderness to be occupied.

Entering the apartment you will find a large welcoming hallway with wood flooring, a door to the guest w c and a utility cupboard housing the washing machine and tumble dryer.

A range of soft grey shaker style wall and base units are complimented by a marble effect worktop along with soft grey tiles to the floor. There is an integrated Neff fridge freezer, AEG dishwasher, oven and induction hob, a stainless steel chimney style cooker hood and stainless steel one and half sink and drainer. The large lounge has a grand fireplace with gas fire grate and feature bay window overlooking the communal garden This is a very grand elegant room with ornate ceiling and coving and is really something quite special.
There are three bedrooms and bedroom two has a door onto the communal garden. The shower room is mainly tiled, with white w c and a sink in a vanity unit, the large walk in shower is flush to the floor, a luxurious room.
The whole flat has white plantation shutters.

There is a garage en bloc. Viewing really is essential to get the essence of the apartment

Location, Location, Location.

Agent One51 are delighted to offer to the sales market this one-bedroom first floor apartment, situated in a period Coach House building nestled away on a private road, moments from Crystal Palace Park and numerous stations. Offered to the market chain free, this flat represents a great buy for a first time buyer looking for a prime asset that will always be extremely sought after, or a buy-to-let investor looking for a good rental return.

Property details: The kitchen offers a range of base and wall cabinets with integrated appliances, and a generous worktop space. There is a reasonably sized living room, a light and airy double bedroom with sash style windows, and a fully fitted bathroom suite with shower. Also benefiting from gas central heating, a communal garden and a designated parking space.

Location wise, Melton House is located just south of the wonderful Crystal Palace Park boasting acres of beautiful grounds and its famous dinosaurs and National Sports Centre. Anerley station is a few minutes’ walk away as is Penge East, and Crystal Palace overland is a short stroll away too; this is near the central triangle formed by the one-way system of Church Road, Westow Hill and Westow Street, lined with pubs, restaurants and independent shops. Vintage is big here and the area is best on a Sunday morning, when junk shops and stalls spill out on to the pavements of Church Road.

Externally, the property features Garage, residential shared parking and well kept communal gardens.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
In excess of 7,000sqft and perfect for entertaining, this spectacular six bedroom, six bathroom detached family home is set back in an elevated position overlooking a shared private green on a half acre plot (approx) with it's own heated pool and nearby to the acclaimed 36 hole Sundridge Park Golf Club.

The scene is set with a stunning double height entrance hall and the magnificent proportions continue with a spectacular valued ceiling living room on the first floor with it's own bar area.

The ground floor has a front aspect formal dining room and a kitchen / breakfast room that leads through to a spacious triple aspect double reception with bi-fold doors that open up on to the screened westerly facing rear garden. There is also a separate utility and a versatile guest suite with en-suite that has a study currently used as a music room.

On the first floor are five well proportioned, bright and airy bedrooms with four bathrooms (three en-suite). The rear aspect principal suite is cleverly situated in the middle of the house offering hypnotic views of the rear garden and includes a spacious dressing room and an oppulent en-suite with a separate bath and shower.

Spanning the entirety of the top floor, is an additional guest suite that could double as an nanny annexe or den with an en-suite, walk-in wardrobe and plenty of storage space.

Outside is ample off-street parking to the front, an integral double garage and to the rear is a well maintained rear garden laid mainly to lawn, with a fabulous patio for entertaining, a heated pool and a changing room with a sauna.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Sundridge is one of the most exclusive neighbourhoods in the area with independent shops, international and British restaurants and good commuter links from Elmstead Woods station (0.5 miles) to central London all nearby.

Bromley's historical and retail heart lies in Market Square, just 1.4 miles away where a number of independent shops and restaurants supplement the high street establishments. Lively open-air markets occur three times a week and it is also home to a cinema, Ripley Arts Centre and the Churchill Theatre that hosts national tours and sees many of its productions transferring to the West End. The boutique shops and cafe's of Chislehurst High Street are also nearby (1.4 miles).

For residents who are interested in taking advantage of the local leisure facilities a number of clubs can be found locally including The Sundridge Park Tennis and Squash Club, Bromley Cricket Club and the independent Progressive Fitness Personal Training Studio.

Away from the hustle and bustle of the town centre, Bromley benefits from a desirable location between the leafy Kentish suburbs of Beckenham and Chislehurst, and is north of semi-rural Keston and its picturesque ponds. Beyond Chislehurst, the National Trust's Petts Wood and Hawkwood comprise acres of ancient woodlands and are a haven for wildlife.

Robin Hood Cottages are set back from St. Pauls Wood Hill providing access to St. Mary Cray Station, local schools, shops at Petts Wood and Chislehurst, and bus routes. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A two double bedroom ground floor period conversion flat with its own front door. The property has been renovated to a high standard by its current owners and offers good size accommodation. The property has a contemporary fitted open plan kitchen/reception room, built-in wardrobes to both bedrooms, and a stylish bathroom suite. The property is being sold with no ongoing chain.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.
The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.
Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.
Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

share of freehold


Winkworth are delighted to present to the market this truly unique and stunning 2 bedroom Victorian conversion apartment .

This impressive Victorian mansion house was converted into stunning homes of grand proportion some years ago and the beautiful original tiled grand communal entrance hall with imposing staircase leads you to the apartment.

This fabulous property has been sympathetically modernised so as not to lose its abundance of charm and allows contemporary living to meet period and character harmoniously.

This spectacular home has a wealth of original period features to be admired and appreciated including high ceilings original skirting boards and the most splendid feature fireplace and immaculately presented.

In brief this lovely home consists of a welcoming hallway leading to spacious grand reception room with feature fire place, wood flooring and shutters, two large charismatic double bedrooms with bespoke fitted wardrobes, spacious kitchen offering integrated fridge freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, electric fan oven and gas hob and a modern white bathroom suite with shower above the bath and under floor heating.

Situated in an enviable location on a popular road this splendid apartment is within easy reach of the vibrant Beckenham High Street offering an array of restaurants, bars and specialist stores to be enjoyed. Ideal for commuters as situated within ten minutes' walk of New Beckenham and Beckenham Junction stations serving most of the major London Stations.

There are numerous local parks including Kelsey Park and the very popular Beckenham Place Park which boasts large areas of ancient woodland ideal for walks, a stunning lake and the beautiful Georgian Mansion within its grounds offers an arts, cultural and community centre.

This imposing detached mansion house is approached by a sweeping gravel driveway and has off street parking.

Further benefits include easily accessed beautiful mature communal garden and boasting allocated storage in the basement handy to house garden furniture.

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £675,000 - £700,000/Virtual Viewing Available*

Built in 2017 by renowned local house builders, Purelake, a stunning 1521 sq ft four bedroom modern house with gated parking for two cars right in the centre of Orpington.

The ground floor comprises an entrance hallway leading to a bright and generously sized open plan reception room/kitchen and dining area. The kitchen includes white matt handleless units, integrated double Bosch oven and AEG induction hob. The reception area has a door directly on to the beautifully landscaped rear garden which comes with patio and lawned area and a gate to the rear which leads to the private parking area. A spacious modern WC completes the ground floor accommodation and comes with enough space to be converted to a shower room.

The first floor offers three bedrooms; two being good sized doubles, one benefiting from an en-suite with walk-in shower. The third could also be used as a study/playroom. Also on this floor is a family bathroom.

The second floor boasts a spacious master suite with double aspect windows allowing in floods of light. The room also consists of an en-suite bathroom, a dressing area with built in wardrobes and plenty of storage space.

Orpington boasts excellent pre-schools, Primary and Secondary schools including the likes of; St Olave's Grammar School and Newstead Wood School.

Just 0.1* mile away is Priory Gardens, which is a beautifully landscaped public garden and ponds. Orpington High Street is on the doorstep allowing convenient access to an array of amenities including shops, restaurants, a cinema and gyms. For travelling there are a range of buses near-by and Orpington Station is only a short walk away (less than 1 mile) with trains to London Bridge in 15 minutes.

Energy Efficiency Rating: B

*Distances are measured in a straight line.

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £450,000-£475,000* Galloways are delighted to market this immaculately presented two bedroom luxury apartment positioned in the well-known development ‘Premier Court’. Having had only one owner, this property has been kept to an impeccable standard and oozes appeal with its high specification throughout. Premier Court is perfectly located on a cul-de-sac almost hidden from the surrounding roads and benefits from being just a stone's throw away from the hustle and bustle of Penge and Anerley High street with an array of local amenities, as well as being just 0.3 miles from Kent House station, 0.6 miles from Birkbeck station, 0.7 miles from Anerley station, and 0.7 miles from Clock House station, all giving commuters flexible access into Central London (distances estimated via google maps). The property is also well placed for both Beckenham and the famous Crystal Palace Triangle and park, well known for its brand new ‘Brown and Green’ café, its giant dinosaurs and maze attractions as well as Crystal Palace National Sports Centre and arena.

Boasting over 934 sq ft of spacious accommodation, this property comprises; hallway with storage cupboard and guest WC leading through to the bright and airy open plan reception room showcasing a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, dining area and patio doors leading onto a South West facing balcony. The master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom and separate dressing area with floor to ceiling bespoke wardrobes. The second double bedroom also benefits from built in wardrobes and en-suite. We feel that this property is an absolute must see and would appeal to those looking for an impressive home. Immediate viewing is recommended.

The property also benefits from off street parking and is being sold with a share of the freehold.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
*guide price £300,000 - £325,000*
Unveiled to the SE20 market is this recently refurbished, one bedroom ground floor flat. Offering a mass amount of floor space being just shy of 394sqft, and situated on one of SE20s premier roads.

This stunning accommodation is practical in its layout and boasts well-proportioned rooms. The brand-new integrated kitchen is finished with a seamless white marble effect worktop and backsplash and matt blue cupboards, which neatly tidy away a slimline dishwasher, washer/dryer and separate fridge and freezer. The bathroom is well-laid out, modern and on trend in its design with mid-century style tiles for the flooring. The reception room is most definitely the focal point of the apartment, with direct access to the communal grounds, providing stunning green views over the tree lined street. The whole flat benefits from having engineered oak flooring, including the double bedroom, and a newly fitted double glazed window and door, making this property perfect for someone to move straight into. Additionally, the flat has ample storage; from a triple built-in wardrobe with fitted drawers as well as large cupboards in the hallway and porch area, wi-fi controlled thermostatic heating, a long lease tenure and residential parking.

Crystal Palace Station is just a short stroll away, with the platform itself visible at the end of the development and provides superb access into central London and East London via the highly rated Overground line. Crystal Palace Park is also just off Thicket Road, which has a vast amount of beautifully landscaped green spaces, state of the art sporting facilities and the historic Crystal Palace Bowl boasting both summer and winter events.

Energy Efficiency Rating D; Remaining Lease Length 157 Years (160 from 17.09.18); Service Charge £1090pa

detailedDescription:
Winkworth are delighted to offer one of the most exclusive homes in Beckenham ever to come to the market and only the fourth owner of this stunning property since it was built in the late Victorian era.
This magnificent family mansion c1895 is located on the prestigious Beckenham Place Park estate. This substantial property is situated within the original Beckenham Place Park set over 245 acres of parkland which was once the home of the famous Cator family.
"The Park" is approached via electronic security gates leading to a large gravel driveway providing off street parking for several vehicles and double garage to side.
Upon entering this amazing property you are immediately welcomed by a spacious and inviting entrance hall perfect for greeting those all-important guests and family. In turn leading to the three grand reception rooms, music room and kitchen/ breakfast room with aga cooking range. Plus second kitchen, utility room, laundry room, and three separate cloakrooms, with staircase leading down to sizable four chamber cellar.
This is also a side passage leading to 40ft by 20ft pool house with large heated pool, jacuzzi, sauna, shower and changing room.
The grand staircase leads to the first floor landing where the half landing faces you with a stunning and spectacular stained leaded light window.
The first floor benefits from six double bedrooms, five bathrooms and separate WC.
The second floor leads to a vast annexe/ au pair accommodation currently used a a large home office space. Consisiting of 36ft by 12ft reception, two double bedrooms, shower room and kitchen area.
Outisde the property sits on grounds covering a plot of over two thirds of an acre. Including a 160ft west facing fully landscaped established garden mainly laid to lawn with flower, shrub and tree borders, summer house, large patio area and garden pond with water feature.

Main Description
Newman Court was built by McCarthy & Stone in 2001 and comprises 39 flats. Situated on the third floor, this well maintained one bedroom balcony flat has just been fully redecorated, and has new carpets and floor coverings. The property is accessed via a communal entrance hall with security entrance system and lift to the third floor. The accommodation comprises entrance hall, good size living room opening onto a small south facing balcony, modern fitted kitchen with built in oven and hob, double size bedroom with built in wardrobes, and a bathroom. The property has the benefit of electric heating via storage heaters, double glazing and a new hot water system. detailedDescription:
This well presented Mock Tudor three bedroom semi-detached house is located close to local schools including Darrick Wood and Ravenswood boys schools and is also in a convenient position to Keston with its many walks, ponds and village primary school. The property is a short walk from Locksbottom with many shops, cafes and restaurants and notably is very close to Beverley park ideal for dog walkers and home to a children's playground. A short bus journey away is access to Bromley South and Orpington mainline stations, the latter on both the Victoria and Charing Cross lines.
The property features a spacious entrance hallway opening to large living room with bay fronted dining room, plus feature conservatory to rear, modern kitchen and cloakroom. There are three spacious bedrooms and a large family bathroom to the first floor. The property also comes with a garden to rear in excess of 120ft with two outbuildings, beautiful shrub and herbaceous borders and a vegetable garden to rear. There is a detached garage and substantial off street parking to front. Viewing highly recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented three-bedroom house in the sought-after Gillmans Road.
Having been extensively renovated, this wonderful home now wants for nothing, having been completed to an exceptional standard throughout.
Externally the front drive is completed with basalt black crushed stone with a red brick wall. The drive provides for 3 vehicles.
The front porch is perfect for boots, wellies, and coats, providing security and thermal insulation to the front of the house.
The front room with wood flooring and recently painted walls provide a perfect family room. The TV point and high-speed fibre internet connection are located in the corner.
The dining room with wood flooring benefits from the fireplace and sliding glazing door into the garden.
The kitchen is superbly presented with an integrated dishwasher, fridge, freezer, and washing machine. A full through-wall over-hood extract fan has also been installed. There is ample storage and a small larder.
Further storage below the stairs.
Upstairs features two double bedrooms including the master with bay window. A third single bedroom is located at the front of the property. The family bathroom is finished to a high standard tiled throughout and complete with a through-wall extract fan.
The boarded loft is double insulated, and benefits from lighting and power.
The true pièce de resistance for this property is the rear garden which has been comprehensively landscaped. A new premium fence and superior lawn has been installed in conjunction with a full porcelain tile patio, seating area, and path which leads down to the purpose-built professional office which houses 4 desks. Adjacent to the office is a workshop which is used to store garden equipment.
There is a further 6ft to the side of the property with double door access to the driveway. External power is provided within the garden and also to the side of the property. Opportunity to extend back and sides and loft conversion STPP.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

Guide price £1,450,000 - £1,500,000. Most prestigious location. Kenton are delighted to present this incredibly spacious detached house situated in the most desirable and prestigious of locations and amidst circa a 1/3 of an acre (plot) of attractive garden area. Approached via a wide Marshall block paved drive with inset lighting providing parking for several cars, this exceptionally spacious detached house of character is of London stock brick construction relieved by tile hanging and sealed unit double glazed windows being leaded light to the front and stands beneath a fully insulated mellow clay tiled roof. Internally, to the ground floor, the property offers extensive accommodation with well-proportioned rooms throughout and features specifically; a wide and welcoming entrance hall, a spacious lounge, formal dining room, study room, a luxury-fitted Clive Christian breakfasting Kitchen (which in itself features quality hand-crafted limed oak units and granite work surfaces) and furthermore a utility room and cloakroom. The first floor accommodation is equally impressive, boasting 5 generously-sized bedrooms (two of which are en-suite), in addition to a luxury family bathroom, with all bathrooms featuring ceramic tiled flooring with under-floor heating. The aforementioned gardens are attractive as mentioned and furthermore, the property also backs onto open farmland. The off-street parking via the aforementioned driveway is ample and additionally there is also a double garage. Also worthy of mention is the extensive use of rustic English oak strip flooring and handmade Italian oak doors, the marble fireplace in the Drawing Room, security alarm system throughout and also hard-wiring throughout for TV/Sky and for a Data (Cat 5) system, sealed unit double glazing and furthermore a hard-wired smoke alarm system. Situated in the ever-desirable and prestigious Chelsfield Park, the property lies less than a mile from both local shops in Windsor Drive and Chelsfield Main Line Station (10 minute walk) the former of which offers more than adequate facilities for day to day requirements, whilst the latter provides fast and frequent services to central London (18 minute direct trains). Further shops can be found in Orpington and Bromley with the latter offering a good range of quality shops and many of the major department stores. Education is well catered for with a number of highly regarded state and private schools within a ten mile radius. Sport too, is of abundance with a variety of activities offered at the Walnuts Leisure Centre in Orpington including badminton, swimming and squash. There is golf and horse riding available with several courses and schools within the vicinity. There is also a strong residents association within the Park and the residents can enjoy the benefits of a private sports ground with cricket and tennis facilities being offered. Finally, also worthy of mention is the fact that planning permission has been granted for a significant extension (effectively doubling the property in size) with full details available on the Bromley Council website Planning Department page and structural drawings are available upon request.

This generously proportioned accommodation which competes dimensionally with other offerings of this age and style has been refurbished in recent years and requiring no immediate redecoration or modernisation.

Silverwood Close is just off Brackley Road which is a peaceful tree lined residential area, the property is a commuters delight with New Beckenham station located just a couple of minutes walk and Beckenham Junction is under a mile away served by a local bus route. If recreation is important the house is a five minute walk to a popular gym and playing fields. Both stations offer regular services in Central London via London Victoria, Blackfriars, Charing Cross and London Bridge (Direct service to Cannon Street from New Beckenham). The property is just a short stroll from the vibrant town centre, featuring a range of restaurants, wine bars, retail and bespoke clothing outlets.

Comprising of a light and airy 18’4 x 11’11 reception room overlooking communal gardens, kitchen with matching wall and base units, spacious master bedroom with built in wardrobes and en suite shower with w/c, good size second bedroom, bathroom with shower over bath, separate WC and two storage cupboards to hallway.

Further benefits include lease in excess of 946 years, New gas fired central heating, double glazing, security entry phone system, new flooring, communal gardens, garage and shared parking.

In our opinion, demand is likely to be instant and significant for this truly outstanding example.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional two bedroom, two storey apartment within the iconic, Grade I listed mansion. The apartment boasts a grand entrance and a beautifully restored circular staircase with an ornate rooflight and original full height windows.

The master bedroom in this apartment is truly luxurious with original detailing, an ‘Adams style’ fireplace and views over the beautifully landscaped entrance courtyard. The master benefits from a bathroom adjacent with twin basins, freestanding bath and a walk in rain-dance shower. The second bedroom benefits from windows looking onto the apartment’s private terrace and a stylish en suite with a bath and shower.

The property has a luxurious handmade Ladbury kitchen with views onto The Mansion’s internal courtyard and a dining room which provides access through double doors to the apartment’s private terrace. The oval drawing room is flooded with light and features historic mouldings, ceiling cornice and a beautiful fireplace. This apartment benefits from a light study space and separate snug. There is also a WC and utility located on the ground floor.

This apartment is sold with a fully inclusive specification, access to the communal gardens and a double garage.

Images are typical of the development and are for illustrative purposes only.

The kitchen also benefits from a Juliette balcony with views on to the east lawn. From the kitchen, through a set of double doors, are the dining and drawing rooms, both generous spaces with engineered oak flooring.

Also on the ground floor is an outstanding master suite with a dressing room and en-suite shower room appointed with Villeroy & Boch sanitaryware, quality brassware from Crosswater and porcelain tiling. Also on the ground floor is a utility and cloakroom.

At lower ground level the property benefits from a cinema room with exposed brick. The exceptional family bathroom boasts a freestanding bath and large rain-dance shower. There are also a number of storage cupboards on this level.

detailedDescription:
Situated in a residential road in the top part of Biggin Hill, this four-bedroom detached house offers a superb 20'6 'L' shaped lounge/diner and a master bedroom with en-suite shower room. Requiring some updating internally, early internal viewing is highly recommended.

This four-bedroom detached house is situated in the top part of Biggin Hill along a sought-after unmade road. Features include a 20'6 'L' shaped lounge/dining room, downstairs WC, and a flat rear garden.

Local Area

Biggin Hill is a district on the south-eastern outskirts of Greater London, England, within the London Borough of Bromley. Biggin Hill Airport occupies land formerly used by RAF Biggin Hill, one of the principal fighter bases protecting London from German bombers during the Battle of Britain.

Transport

Biggin Hill is part of the Transport for London operating area and is thus served by several London Buses services as well as one route operated by Southdown psv. Buses provide connections to Bromley, Keston, Hayes, Bromley, Westerham, Downham, Catford, Oxted, Locksbottom, New Addington, Tatsfield, Orpington, and Green Street Green.

The nearest National Rail station to Biggin Hill is Hayes station (located 5 miles away) as well as Oxted station in Surrey plus Bromley South station and Orpington station in London. The nearest Tramlink stop is New Addington located also in London 4 miles away.

Schools

Charles Darwin School is a secondary school within three miles of the centre.

Two main primary schools operate Oaklands Primary School and Biggin Hill Primary School. Beyond the outskirts are Cudham CoE Primary School near Foal Farm, Tatsfield Primary in Tatsfield to the west, and Downe Primary in the Downe village.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are delighted to present this substantial three-bedroom maisonette in close proximity to Grove Park Station.

This stunning home is set over three floors and has its own front door and offers internal living space.

The property has been up kept to a fantastic standard and will largely appeal to first time buyers and professional couples that are looking to take advantage of the excellent local amenities along with the excellent transport links which provide convenient links in central London.

Upon entering this property you will find the extremely generous and spacious hallway with stairs leading to the first floor where are you have a large front living room, great sized family bathroom with separate shower room and a separate w.c., large bedroom to the rear and a separate kitchen which provides access onto a roof terrace and the rear garden. The kitchen contains fully fitted units and appliances and is large enough to house dining / breakfast table. The rear garden has been beautifully up kept and contains a large summerhouse which contains double glazing, heavy duty doors / windows and electricity. On the top floor there are two double bedrooms with a wealth of built-in storage throughout. The property has retained beautiful period features throughout with high ceilings, fireplaces and detailed coving.

The vendor is open to serving a section 42 notice to begin the lease extension process.

This home really is one-of-a-kind within the area and viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Located in a period property is this two bedroom first floor flat. In immaculate condition and with no onward chain this property is ready to move into with no work required. In a residential road close to all amenities and transport links. Modern kitchen and bathroom compliment this property with a wealth of natural light and the added bonus of a wonderful roof terrace. You must see this property to fully appreciate it.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
Simply Stunning! This spacious and well-designed premium apartment is offered with a Share of Freehold and boasts beautiful decor which cannot fail to impress. Set in established gardens in the leafy area of Upper Sydenham, this immaculate purpose-built block is close to the local amenities and transport links, and a stone’s throw to Crystal Palace Park.

This apartment is an outstanding example of design at its best, with great attention to detail. Features include a large 16'9" reception room which leads to a contemporary kitchen with granite worktops and top spec appliances, Neff Microwave / oven combination, Neff Slide & Hide oven, integrated fridge freezer & dishwasher plus an electric waste disposal.

There is also ample clever storage and a separate utility area with white storage cupboards and a solid oak countertop. Oak hardwood flooring is laid throughout the property, and there is a generous luxury bathroom. Here you will find a stunning large walk-in shower with rainfall shower head, under floor heating, granite countertop and a heated mirror. Other benefits in this apartment include high end LED lighting & concealed lighting, a Nest thermostat, garage en bloc. This building has also benefited with recently fitted aluminium grey & white window frames and double glazing.

This property will suit a buyer looking for an apartment in excellent condition with no work to do, set in a very secure building with great outside space.

Location

Located on one of Sydenham's most desirable roads, within the Lawrie Park Triangle, moments from Sydenham and Penge West Stations, Crystal Palace Park and Sydenham High Street.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This exceptional maisonette is finished with a very high spec and has a 'New York Loft' styled feel. Located in the heart of Sundridge Park Village, a vibrant and affluent area close to Bromley with it's own station, cafes and range shops and a butchers.

With it's own front door and and porch area on ground floor which leads up to the first flight of stairs into the spacious open plan kitchen/living room with a bright view to an outdoor private roof terrace. The open plan layout of this area makes it an ideal entertainment space and features an exposed internal brick wall (original yellow stock bricks), vintage wall-mounted lighting, crittall style double doors, large box sash windows and the forever famous Amtico herringbone flooring.
The bespoke kitchen comes with new fully integrated appliances including dishwasher, washer-dryer, fridge-freezer and built in microwave. The marble effect quartz worktop creates a grand breakfast bar ideal for eating, drinking or working activities with integrated usb charging point’s ideal for working at home.
A further flight of stairs surrounded by bespoke safety glass takes you to the master bedroom and a further double bedroom with great views. On the same floor you have the main bathroom, this design is well presented, includes a wet-room shower, bath with hand held showering facility’s, WC and basin all with gold accessories complimenting the white marble surrounding tiles. The stairs in the master bedroom lead to a mezzanine floor ideal for use as a dressing room, storage or whatever you may have in mind. From the kitchen are double doors providing access to a professionally landscaped roof terrace with resin bound flooring and hedging.
(Please note the use of this outdoor area is by formal agreement by a Deed of Variation, the roof space is owned by another property).

Viewings are considered essential in order to fully appreciate the standard of accommodation on offer.

Location

The property is ideally located for Main line train stations such as Sundridge Park (Zone 4), Bromley North or South and four convenient bus routes. Local boutique style shops, restaurants, cafes and leisure facilities including Sundridge Park Lawn Tennis & Squash club plus the very well known Sundridge Park Golf Club. The property is offered with No Onward Chain.

Lease Information

The property is offered with an exceptionally long lease of 954 years with a peppercorn ground rent.

title: 3 bed town house for sale

detailedDescription:
The Address is delighted to offer this unique property to market, chain free. Set behind imposing electric gates and then accessed via a sweeping driveway to the house the property is extremely secluded. The property is located at the top of a hill which offers picturesque views of the local open green spaces.

There is a large double garage on the left as you go through the gates which is opened via electric shutters. The garage also benefits from an adjoining shower room; it could be converted to an annex and/or summer house (subject to planning permission).

The ground floor of the property benefits from a large L shaped living/dining area, perfect for entertaining a large family. With double aspect views the room is bright, spacious and offers great views. There is a large modern kitchen with breakfast bar, integrated appliances and stunning views of the local scenery. Also to the ground floor is a shower room and study area which could also be used as a 5th bedroom for an elderly relative.

To the right hand side is scope to extend the property underneath the master bedroom (subject to planning permission - permission previously granted).

To the first floor are four double bedrooms, a study and family bathroom. The master bedroom benefits from double aspect views and a balcony on both sides. All four bedrooms benefit from views of the garden and scenery to rear.

To the rear is a mature, split level garden. A decked area leads on to a turfed zone where a brick built tandoor/pizza oven is situated. There are

a few stairs that lead down to an additional area behind the grass area on a different level.

Internal viewing highly recommended.

Situated on the top floor, the property comprises one bright and spacious reception room, good-sized modern kitchen/dining room with fully fitted appliances including fridge freezer, one large double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a good-sized three piece bathroom suite.

Further benefits include ample storage in the hallway, well-maintained communal gardens, garage en-bloc and off street parking.

Albemarle Road is within walking distance to Beckenham Junction Rail Station (0.4 miles) and Shortlands Station (0.8 miles) both offering regular and frequent services into London Victoria, London Blackfriars and London St. Pancras. The Tramlink at Beckenham Junction also gives easy access to East Croydon, with its 15-minute service to Gatwick Airport. Beckenham High Street is a short distance away with its vibrant atmosphere and array of shops, bars and restaurants. This property also resides within the ever sought area Clare House Primary School catchment.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks bring to the market this two double bedroom detached bungalow which is situated within the popular area of Biggin Hill and is within walking distance to bus stops, Tesco Express, Waitrose, Costa as well as other local shops.

The property sits on a generous plot with a large mature, well maintained and stocked rear garden along with its own block paved driveway with parking for several cars to the front.

Entrance to the bungalow is through a security gated storm porch which leads to the front door and through to the entrance hall. Here there are doors leading to Two Bedrooms, the Bathroom, Lounge and a Fitted Kitchen which opens onto the large Conservatory at the rear. The conservatory spread across the whole property and is accessible via both the Kitchen and Lounge through a set of double glazed patio doors.

Outside to the rear is one of the features of the home with is its well maintained and mature rear garden offering a degree of privacy as well as a good size. To one side there is a covered storage area with access to the front through a secure door and the other side has a secure door rear access to the extended single garage.

To the front is the blocked paved driveway with parking for Several Cars and some flower beds and borders with direct access to garage.

No onward chain......

Local Area

Biggin hill has the advantage of being surrounded by Green Belt countryside and yet is only 7½ miles from Bromley’s main shopping centre to the North whilst to the South is the village of Westerham and its many places of historical interest, such as Chartwell and Squerryes Court. Access to the M25 motorway is 7½ miles away.

detailedDescription:
EPC band: D

A meticulously designed, grade 2 locally listed upper ground floor apartment, upon entering you are struck by the abundance of natural light that flows into all of the rooms. The open plan living area is the heart of the property, with a bespoke kitchen that has been beautifully designed and well planned, the perfect haven in which to catch up and prepare a delicious meal. The two double bedrooms are spacious and light, with ample storage space, the principle room has an en-suite shower. The owners of this property have loved and looked after their home and now want to pass it onto a new owner to enjoy it as much as they have. Situated in the heart of the bustling Bromley High street which offers a wide range of shops, pubs, restaurants and cafes and a 7 minute walk to both Bromley South and North train stations which offers excellent links to London. There are a number of green spaces, including the idyllic Sundridge Park nearby, with a driving range and Golf Club plus sports fields and playgrounds within walking distance.

address: Forest Ridge, Keston Park, Kent BR2
detailedDescription:
‘Keston House’ is set back towards the middle of the 1.5 acre plot behind private electric gates and surrounded by mature trees on the highly popular Gated private estate Keston Park

Behind the impressive Georgian style elevations the property offers beautifully presented accommodation of in excess of 14,000 sq ft. With a grand marble floored entrance hall approached via a pillared entrance.

There are four principle reception rooms that include a bespoke fitted study by Chambers of Knockholt, dual aspect drawing room, separate dining room and family room.

The bespoke Chambers kitchen is comprehensively fitted has a beautiful semi-circular breakfast bar, a second kitchen area adjacent and a large bay window to allow the natural light to flood in and enjoy the view over the patio terrace and garden. The appliances are Gaggenau and include sub-zero refrigerators. The sitting room is a very comfortable space with bay window and two double doors to the garden.

The leisure complex is also on this level offering swimming pool with shower and changing room, gym and glass house morning room. A contemporary glass staircase provides access to a very well-proportioned games room/ entertainment room with bar.

The first floor offers five bedrooms, all with en suite bathrooms the principle suite benefiting from dressing area and walk-in wardrobe.

The second floor has a further bedroom suite with bathroom, walk in wardrobe and a relaxation reception.

There is also a self-contained one bedroom apartment

The lower ground level which is designed for maximum entertainment with a cinema room with Bose cinema surround system, a fabulous bar and lounge area for before and after the screening and of course a wine cellar as you can never have too many luxuries.

Outside the grounds extend to 1.5 acres include a patio area with outdoor kitchen to enjoy some ‘al fresco’ dining, a sunken hot tub, a further patio on a lower tier to enjoy some relaxation time, a recently re-surfaced multi sports court and the remainder laid to lawn.

There is a triple garage and ample parking for your vehicles and guests.

Forest Ridge is situated within Keston Park which is located close to Locksbottom village with its local shopping facilities including a Sainsbury’s superstore, restaurants and public houses including the popular Chapter One restaurant.

Comprehensive Shopping: The Glades in Bromley, Orpington High Street and Bluewater Shopping Centre.

Mainline Rail Services: Services direct to London
Orpington (2.7 miles) to London Bridge, Charing Cross, London Victoria, Cannon Street, Blackfriars . Bromley South (3 miles) to London Victoria.

Primary Schools: Keston C of E, Crofton, Darrick Wood and Farnborough.
Secondary Schools: Ravenswood, St. Olaves, Newstead Wood (selective) and Darrick Wood schools.
Private Schools: Bromley High School for Girls, Bickley Park Boys’ School, Eltham College, Farringtons and Babington House.

Motorway Links: The A21 Hastings Road leads to Junction 4 of the M25 giving access to Gatwick and Heathrow Airports, Channel Tunnel Terminus, Ebbsfleet International, the South Coast and Bluewater shopping centre.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
This much loved mid century detached home has been fully renovated and extended during the current owners occupancy.
Located on a quiet unmade road close to the Common, a tranquil and quiet setting within West Wickham this home offers upside down living and a two storey outbuilding with studio room.

The spacious and well designed accommodation is over 1900sq ft in very good condition which briefly consists of four double bedrooms, two bathrooms, an en suite and walk in wardrobe. A modern kitchen/diner with access to a terrace, a generous reception room overlooking the garden and the outbuilding is currently used as a storage room on the ground floor and upstairs is a studio room.

Other features include double glazing and gas central heating throughout. There is parking for two cars and a generous and well maintained garden.

Hayes Railway Station and Hayes High Street are walkable distance, as are local amenities in Coney Hall with bus services to Bromley, Croydon and West Wickham all close by.

The sought after schools of Hayes and Wickham Common are also within walking distance.

This really is a must see home - viewings are a must.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Accommodation comprises a warm entrance hall with inbuilt storage cupboard, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with feature square bay to front, and ample space for relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen, with dual aspect windows, comprises a modern range of matching high gloss wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with plenty of space for free-standing furniture, and a stylish bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling. The property is conveniently located close to excellent transport links, with Anerley, Birkbeck, Penge West and Norwood Juntion stations all within easy reach, as well as numerous regular bus routes linking the surrounding area. Nearby Anerley and Penge offer a variety of shops and amenities, with the fashionable Crystal Palace Triangle also within easy reach for a variety of cafes, bars, restaurants and shopping facilities. The famous site of Crystal Palace Park is also just a short distance away, with lake, childrens' zoo and dinosaur trail. Viewings are strongly recommended.

The Modern Way To Move
Estate agency is stuck in the past, Nested's mission is to empower people to make the move they want, when they want. We're the first estate agent using live data to keep you informed about your performance so you can achieve the best sale price for your home. We even offer a cash advance so you can move when you want, even before you sell. Nested put you in the position of a chain-free buyer, giving you the power to negotiate a better price on your new home. Along with our excellent agents who help with your negotiations, we typically help save up to 5% on your new home. With over 450 homeowners helped since 2016, get in touch to find out how we can help you sell smarter.

1. What do you love most about your home?
I love having a spacious bedroom; there's plenty of room for everything to fit comfortably plus some floor space for yoga. I also love the dining area; from the window you get a good view of the large tree outside changing colour with the seasons.

2. Why are you moving?
i'm moving in with my partner and we're looking for somewhere in the middle of our workplaces. However, in the future, Crystal Palace / Anerley will be somewhere I consider again for easy rail links to both the centre of the City and out to the countryside.

3. What do you love about the area?
I love the parks! Betts Park is a weekday favourite whilst working from home. I also love to walk up to Crystal Palace Park, get a coffee and a croissant from one of the cafes on the Triangle and sit by the Victorian dinosaur statues. For a bit of wilderness, I walk down to South Norwood Park and if i'm feeling adventurous, Beckenham Place Park is a bus away for woods and swimming ponds.

This stunning apartment is situated in the stately award winning Grade II listed building, Hampton Grange. Offering over 1,356 sq. Ft. Of exceptional living space, this property really does offer any purchasers luxury living within a sought after and desirable location.

The layout of this apartment flows beautifully and comprises of a welcoming and spacious hallway with storage facilities. A truly impressive open plan living, dining, kitchen area which is flooded with natural light. The feature of this room has to be the curved bay with large windows affording views over 10.5 acres of beautiful private grounds.

The modern kitchen is fully fitted with bespoke wall and base units, granite worktops and integral appliances, in addition to this there is a large walk-in larder.

Both bedrooms are generously spacious with fitted wardrobes, the master bedroom has an en suite shower room and the family bathroom completes the accommodation.

Further benefits include high ceilings, engineered wood flooring, underfloor heating to the family bathroom and the en suite shower room, bespoke fixtures and fittings, secure video entry phone system, two allocated parking spaces and residents only private grounds.

Hampton Grange is perfectly located for Sundridge Park, Bromley North and Bromley South stations offering services into central London. Bromley town centre is also within close proximity and offers a range of shopping and socialising facilities including The Glades Shopping Centre, Churchill Theatre and various well known restaurants and coffee shops.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
In an absolutely outstanding location is this ground floor one bedroom garden flat. The flat has its own private entrance and is light and airy with ample storage. Perfectly located for the convenience of both Kent House and Clock House stations giving flexible access into Central London. Close to all local amenities and open spaces, this is a wonderful opportunity to get on the property ladder or an ideal investment opportunity. Don't miss this chance to acquire this wonderful apartment.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.
The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
