Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.
Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.
Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
One of the most elegant and stylish homes we have seen, approached by a gated driveway with parking for several cars and entered through a grand doorway into the large welcoming hallway. Beautiful wood flooring throughout, high ceilings and feature fireplaces.

The conservatory is a most delightful room dressed with large comfy sofas and with views and doors opening onto the large patio, and then further to the very well stocked landscaped garden.

The kitchen breakfast room with central island is a delight with shaker style bespoke cabinetry and space for a range cooker. From here a door leads to the utility area and ground floor w.c.

To the first floor you find a well designed master bedroom with cosy fireplace and the two further double bedrooms to the rear of the property also have feature fireplace's.

The French Chateau style bathroom with free standing claw bath and corner shower cubicle, is just lovely.

Elmstead Woods Station for commuters is 1.0 mile and Chislehurst High Street is 0.3 of a mile, surrounded by good schools and amenities this is such a great home.

Viewing is an absolute must to get the essence of this home.

The property consists of 2 sizeable double bedrooms, kitchen/diner and living room with original features and sash windows, great for entertaining friends and family. detailedDescription:

Set over three floors, this charming semi-detached cottage (converted from the original detached house) is tastefully decorated throughout, and viewing comes highly recommended. The well presented accommodation includes, to the ground floor: A lounge, and kitchen which opens directly onto an attractive conservatory. To the first floor, there are two bedrooms, and family bathroom. On the second floor, there is the third bedroom which benefits from an en-suite shower room. Outside, there is a terraced and gravelled/pebbled courtyard style garden (approx. 40'), and this leads directly to the parking area. Ideally situated, the property is within walking distance of all amenities including the sought-after Darrick Wood schools, shops and eateries at Locks Bottom, the Princess Royal University Hospital, bus routes, plus allotments, parkland, outdoor gym, children's play area, and tennis courts at Tugmutton Common.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
High Westings was one of four adjacent houses built in the late 1950s and early 1960s by the architect Roy Hickman. Three of the houses, which were built in the grounds of Hill House remain and High Westings occupies an elevated plot offering delightful views over Keston. Fox Lane is in the heart of Keston Village with its village primary school, popular green, two local pubs, local shops and benefiting from a tranquil setting close to many local woodland walks. Hayes schools, train station and High Street are within easy reach as are Ravenswood school and Locksbottom village with its array of popular restaurants and shops. There is also access to Bromley High Street and Bromley South Station with fast trains to London Victoria.

The property is set over two floors with the ground floor providing a dining room with large window and courtesy door overlooking the front, kitchen with a dual aspect, utility room, shower room, cellar and garage.

To the first floor is a beautiful lounge enjoying uninterrupted views via the large window to the front, bedroom one with a dual aspect, bedroom two with courtesy doors leading to the side, bedroom three with courtesy doors to the rear and bedroom four with courtesy door to the side. To the centre of the first floor is the family bathroom with skylight. The landing also leads to the garden room which provides access to the roof terrace; a magnificent spot to enjoy both the views and the evening sun.

The gardens surround the property with many delightful spots to enjoy a book in the tranquil setting. A shared path gives access to Heathfield Road and there is off street parking via Fox Lane.

Jdm highly recommend an internal inspection of this characterful, individual family home.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to present this five-bedroom semi-detached house in the desirable location of Manor Road in West Wickham. The property spread over three floors consists of five bedrooms, open plan reception room, two bathrooms, a detached garage and further potential to extend subject to obtaining the relevant planning permission.The property is within a short walk from West Wickham High Street and the West Wickham Station. Manor Road is within close proximity of the reputable Langley Secondary Schools & Oak Lodge Primary School. The property is offered chain free to the market.



Black + Blanc Virtual walkthrough 3D tour available for Manor Road, West Wickham

If you would like to take a virtual walk through this property, please click play on the virtual tour. If you have any further questions or would like to arrange an accompanied viewing, please contact the Black + Blanc sales team.

This wonderful family home is located in on a quiet and residential road of West Wickham, the property is well presented externally and has a landscaped front garden, to the right of the house is a communal/shared driveway with access to the detached garage.
The ground floor of the property does not lack space as it measures over approx. 550 square ft.There is a private porch that has been double glazed providing access to a spacious hallway, this leads you to the main reception room which is open plan and spacious. This room is further complimented by large double glazed bay windows which allow plenty of sunlight and the space is light and airy. The room is integrated with solid oak flooring and offers plenty of storage. This is the main living/family room and dining area with the added benefit of views of the landscaped garden. The ground floor is completed with a good size kitchen, fully integrated with essential appliances, there is further potential to extend the property on the ground floor (STPP).

As you head upstairs to the first floor (556 Sq. Ft.), you are presented with three bedrooms and a family bathroom/separate WC. There are two substantial double bedrooms with plenty of storage and currently the third bedroom is used as a work from home office (that’s essential nowadays).

The second floor of the property is the loft conversion which was carried out by the current homeowners, which provides a further two double bedrooms and a modern family bathroom.
The property offers a large private and secluded garden which is approximately 125 ft. In depth, a portion of the garden is paved and perfect for a BBQ.The properties on this side of the road benefit from larger gardens.

The property is fully alarmed throughout and is also integrated with cat 5 wiring, ideally networked.

Manor Road is situated just off West Wickham High Street, close by schools of good repute, the station and local bus routes to Shirley, Croydon, Beckenham and Bromley. Viewing recommended.

detailedDescription:
*Virtual Tour Available / Guide Price £575,000 - £600,000*

Located in a quiet and secluded cul-de-sac in Orpington is this generous sized three / four bedroom semi-detached family home.

The property benefits from a single storey extension to the side and two storey extension to the rear creating spacious rooms within.

The ground floor comprises two considerable sized reception rooms, one with French doors leading to the garden and another which could also be used as a fourth double bedroom. The spacious kitchen / diner includes white shaker style units offering plenty of storage space and benefits an integrated oven / hob. This floor also consists of a family room / play room with double doors directly onto one of the reception rooms and a downstairs WC and shower.

On the first floor there are three bright double bedrooms all benefitting from built in wardrobes and a family bathroom including a bath and walk in shower.

To the rear of the property is a well looked after garden with a patio area allowing for outdoor seating, paths lead up past the lawn to a second patio area and two generous sized storage outbuildings.

The property also benefits from off street parking for two cars and solar panels on the roof.

Nearby there are some wonderful open spaces such as Goddington Park (0.7 mile), High Elms (2.9 mile) and Lullingstone Country Park (3 mile)*.

The property is well connected for the M25 and Orpington Station is just 1.5 miles away with trains into London Bridge from 15 minutes and out the other direction into Kent.

Orpington is home to some outstanding schools including the ever popular super selective Grammar schools; St Olaves and Newstead Woods.

*Distances measured in straight line.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered for sale, is this elegant three bedroom family home in popular SE20.

The property briefly comprises of a good sized reception room to the ground floor, well presented kitchen/dining room with large fridge freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. There is also an integrated oven, gas hob and extractor fan. And immaculate family bathroom with freestanding bath and newly installed shower. The beautifully stylish bathroom is on the ground floor but with ample room in the main bedroom to add a small en-suite or small bathroom should you wish.

Upstairs has, unusually, three good sized, beautifully presented double bedrooms, with one currently set up as a home office.

Accessed from the lounge and dining / kitchen area is the private, desirable South-West facing rear garden. Mainly laid to lawn with shrubbery and plants, there is a stunning porcelain dining patio which is an ideal entertaining space with added clothes airer. To the rear of the garden is a generously sized storage shed.

Externally there is a brick paved, large private driveway with parking for 3-4 cars and easy further parking on the road for visitors.

To the front of the property is an enclosed porch adding extra storage and security.

As an added bonus, the loft is fully boarded offering additional storage space with potential to add a spacious conversion.

The property is well located with excellent transport links and Crystal Palace, Beckenham village, East Dulwich village on the doorstep as well as 5-6 train and tram stations.

Within easy reach is Box Hill, Surrey (40 mins by car), Victoria (train from Kent House approx. 23 mins), Waterloo East (train from Elmers End approx. 29mins), Shoreditch (train from Anerley approx. 29 mins), Wimbledon (tram from Birbeck approx. 1 hour) and Gatwick airport (train from Anerley approx. 30 - 45 mins).

With lovely detailing throughout, viewings are highly recommended for this lovely home!

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning seven bedroom detached Victorian is set in a most prestigious and wide, tree lined road on the outskirts of the bustling Bromley town centre. Having gone through a period of extensive refurbishment around 8 years ago benefits you would find in a modern home but at the same time retains the charm and features of a period home.

The spacious accommodation of over 4,000 sq foot is presented to market in excellent decorative order. The first floor accommodation comprises an extremely spacious entrance hallway which spans the depth of the house and is well laid out to provide a natural access to all the other reception rooms. The hallway also houses a generous storage cupboard. To the front of property are two spacious reception rooms, both which benefit from attractive bay windows in keeping with the style of the period home. The contemporary kitchen with breakfasting area is located at the back of the house with a view over the rear garden. There is also a useful utility room directly off the kitchen. A further reception room, study and WC complete the accommodation on the ground floor.

The lower ground floor houses additional storage rooms one of which the current owners use to accommodate gymnasium equipment.

To the first floor are four generously sized bedrooms, three of which have en-suite bath/shower ooms and a family bathroom. To the second floor are three further bedrooms and a'Jack and Jill' bathroom accessed from two of the bedrooms.

The proportions of the rooms are exceptionally large and the accommodation is incredibly flexible and could be tailored to suit the needs of many modern families.

Of particular note throughout, is the standard of finish together with the high ceilings, sheer proportions, period details and the double glazed a-rated sliding sash cord windows.

Externally the property is accessed via an electric gate and a large amount of off street parking. To the rear the landscaped, rear garden is laid partly to lawn and also comprises a patio area immediately proximate to the house.

12 Edward Road is set in a premier road within the Sundridge Park, area which provides local amenities, excellent schools and links to London. Sundridge Park is an oasis of attractive roads with substantial houses, a local village with restaurants and great facilities. Sundridge Park Championship Golf Course is 0.3 miles, the Lawn Tennis & Squash Club 0.4 miles and the train station 0.3 miles. The largest of London's borough towns, Bromley, is within 1 mile and offers a shopping centre, 9 screen cinema, regular market and vast array of eateries, bars and local leisure facilities.

Viewing comes highly recommended in order to fully appreciate the quality and wealth of accommodation on offer.

detailedDescription:
Retirement Home - 1 bedroom apartment - situated close to Hayes old village and High Street - excellent transport links to Bromley, Beckenham, Croydon and London - close to doctors' surgery - warden assisted -walking distance to local parks and mainline Hayes station - chain free

Hayes is a modern suburban area nestled between Bromley, West Wickham and Coney Hall with excellent transport links into Central London from Hayes Station. Station Approach is a bustling haven of coffee shops, mini supermarkets, restaurants, as well as a post office, with further smaller shops in Old Hayes; the old village area on Hayes Street. title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Camden Wood is a graceful mansion reputedly built for the Chancellor to the Prince Imperial, Napoleon III who lived in exile at the nearby Camden Place. Camden Wood was converted into apartments about 40 years ago with the property we are offering forming part of the ground floor.

Retaining many of the original features the large and graceful rooms absorb substantial Victorian furniture with ease. The lounge itself is a very special room with large feature windows over looking the south facing communal gardens, original marble open fireplace and ornate plasterwork.

There are two double bedrooms, the main one having an ensuite bathroom. A large family bathroom has a shower and roll top bath. The kitchen is well proportioned and fitted with a range of modern wall and base units.

Exclusive access to this apartment is via an original front door and there are two parking spaces at the front.

The house is accessed via a long driveway off Yester Road giving the property an air of tranquillity rarely found in our busy suburban world. Early viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment.

Council Tax:- London Borough of Bromley, Band E, £2,067.41

Both the kitchen and living room benefit from the addition of hardwood flooring while the kitchen has been fitted with modern units allowing space for a range of appliances.

Upstairs are three bedrooms, two of which are generous double rooms and a single bedroom. All are serviced by a recently upgraded family bathroom.

The rear garden is accessed via the conservatory along with a gated side entrance and is mostly laid to lawn with mature shrubbery, a decking area and patio for outside dining and entertaining. The front provides paved parking for two cars.

The property is ideally located for all amenities within this popular village including pubs, shops and good schools with the catchment including Farnborough Primary School and Darrick Wood School. title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

address: Baston Manor Road, Hayes, Bromley BR2
detailedDescription:
Coach House is a charming property set in beautiful grounds of the private Hast Hill Estate, on the edge of Keston Village. This wonderful, terraced property combines, light, spacious and well-balanced accommodation, featuring landscaped gardens and stunning countryside views.
As you approach the property you are greeted by a timber field gate and a paved front landscaped garden which in the summertime is draped in sun all day and great for alfresco dining.

The inviting entrance with tasteful décor, engineered wood flooring leading onto the double aspect lounge with dining area, there’s an open fireplace enhancing the character and charm of the property. French doors lead onto the landscaped back garden. The delightful kitchen breakfast room enjoys an outlook to the front garden. It is fitted with a comprehensive range of bespoke handcrafted kitchen units which have been cleverly modelled to accommodate a variety of high end integrated appliances, (including Bosch dishwasher, Bosch fridge freezer, and Neff microwave) There is also a beautiful white Britannia Range cooker with a traditional custom designed, cooker hood, made to match the wall and base cabinets which are complemented with contemporary white work surfaces and upstands, blended with rustic terracotta floor tiles and double glazed windows to front.

The downstairs cloakroom has an Oxford traditional wash hand basin and Wc, put together with mosaic tiled flooring. This space (subject to planning permission) could be knocked through to an outside storage room to make a fabulous utility room.
Stairs turning to the first floor the upstairs accommodation is just as impressive.

A good size master bedroom featuring beautiful countryside views and benefiting from beautiful wood flooring, built in wardrobes and window shutters. On the landing you will find additional storage boasting two large eves cupboards. There is a further bedroom to the first floor which includes fitted wardrobes and its own private en-suite bathroom.

The top floor provides additional accommodation featuring a glass atrium allowing plenty of natural light. It is presently arranged as a snug TV area and a double bedroom, each with skylight windows, but could perfectly accommodate a study area, ideal for working from home. The landscaped rear garden includes a patio with steps leading to tiered herbaceous beds.A large secure storeroom and a garden shed.

In addition to its own private gardens, Coach House is set within the approximate 11 acre Estate which includes communal landscaped gardens, an Astro Turf tennis court and an outdoor gazebo. If you’re looking to live in a countryside setting without being too far from the Big City, then look no further. Keston is home to picturesque parks and ponds, much loved by the residents and beyond.

From the bustling city of London to country life in under 40 minutes, with an Idyllic setting like no other. Enjoy outstanding far-reaching views from this exceptional home. Once you discover this property you will know you have found your forever home. Imagine waking up every morning to stunning countryside views. Sheep cows and horses pasturing in the paddock and fields beyond. Yet with only a short walk to the station, you can catch fast trains into London in just under 40 minutes, or from Bromley South in 16 minutes. Bromley town centre also offers a fast array of shops, restaurants, sports facilities, two cinemas, a theatre the central library, gardens and parks. Local schools are Keston Primary, Wickham Common Primary, Ravens Wood and Hayes, secondary plus St Olave's and Newstead Wood Grammar Schools.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered with a Share of Freehold and set within a handsome period conversion with an attractive outlook over Betts Park to the rear, is this spacious and well presented one double bedroom flat.

The property boasts stripped wood flooring, high ceilings and large windows providing a bright and airy space which is coupled with attractive fireplaces and restored coving and ceiling roses. There is also a built in cupboard in the bedroom and shelving installed in the lounge.

Other features include a traditionally tiled bathroom and a fitted kitchen. Externally there is a very generous rear communal garden with great potential.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

Location

Ideally located within a walkable distance to Penge, Crystal Palace, Beckenham and Norwood Junction and just a short drive to Bromley or Croydon.

Many bus routes outside, including to Crystal Palace, Lewisham and Croydon.

Many train links to choose from - overground, national rail and Croydon tramlink (to Wimbledon) from Anerley, Penge, Birkbeck, Norwood Junction and other stations.

There is an excellent selection of shops nearby including the Co-op, Aldi and Tesco Express (less than 5 mins walk) and a Tesco superstore (about 15 minutes away).

Finally the flat backs onto Betts Park, ideal for morning walks.

Lease Information

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Lease Length: 994 years remaining
Other costs: Approx £500 a year for insurance, other costs are agreed with all freeholders

Please note information has been provided by the seller. Any incoming purchaser must have this information checked and verified by their solicitor.

detailedDescription:
A superb, character ground floor Conversion Apartment featuring direct garden access and forming part of this imposing detached Victorian residence located within a highly popular and convenient road, just a short walk from Bromley town centre.

This impressive property, which is beautifully presented throughout, provides bright and spacious accommodation with large and well proportioned rooms benefiting from high ceilings and large windows. The flat is approached via the main front doorway, via a communal lobby, which leads into a large and welcoming entrance hall.

Internally, the accommodation comprises: A spacious living room with south facing bay window to the side and painted feature panelled walls; a large kitchen/breakfast room with modern and integrated units; there is a useful utility room to the side which provides access to mature communal gardens. There are two bedrooms on the ground floor, plus a superb and luxuriously appointed bathroom with freestanding bath and over-sized shower cubicle.

Downstairs, the spacious basement area, which was professionally converted in 2008, provides a useful lobby leading to an impressive 15x13' master bedroom which also features a fitted dressing room plus further storage room. There is also a useful study room in the basement area.

Freelands Road is a highly convenient residential street, predominantly lined with period properties providing an attractive setting. Mature trees and shrubs provide an attractive leafy setting, yet the town centre can be easily reached on foot in just minutes. Nearby stations are at Sundridge Park, Bromley North and Bromley South - the latter with fast and frequent train services to London Victoria in just 17 minutes.

detailedDescription:
This deceptively spacious detached family house occupies a quiet cul-de-sac aspect within easy walking distance of reputable nearby schools (Darrick Wood, Warren Road, Tubbenden Lane, plus Grammar schools Newstead Woods and St Olaves), Orpington Mainline station, the town centre for a great selection of shops and larger stores, Green Street Green local Waitrose and community shops plus good transport links. The property comprises four well proportioned bedrooms on the first floor, a spacious lounge/ diner to rear aspect, separate home office/ TV snug, breakfast kitchen, cloakroom off the entrance hall, storm porch and upstairs family bathroom. Outside you will find a delightful front garden with mature shrubs and trees, rear garden with patio and private driveway ahead of the single garage via Lichlade Close. Additional features include: Double glazed windows, gas central heating, good standard of décor throughout and airy rooms. To fully appreciate the bright and well planned family accommodation on offer, interior viewing comes highly recommended by the Sellers Sole Agent proctors.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A spacious three bedroom maisonette with good sized living accommodation plus a bonus loft room.

Situated above a parade of shops the property is accessed via the rear of the parade. Steps lead to a communal balcony serving to provide access to the property. There is a welcoming entrance hallway which leads to a good sized kitchen fitted with a range of white base and eye level units with an integrated oven & hob and additional space for other appliances.

The living/dining room is a spacious L shaped double aspect room with access to a private balcony. A change of flooring denotes the designated living areas and there is also a fireplace in the dining area.

To the upper floor there are three well-proportioned bedrooms with the master also benefitting from being double aspect. There is a modern family bathroom fitted with a bath with shower over, WC and washbasin.

From the landing is the loft access with a pull down ladder. The loft is currently used as a bonus room providing an attractive extra space with plentiful eaves storage.

The property is ideally located for local schools as well as local shops, parks and recreational areas as well as Bromley town centre with its range of restaurants, high street shops and the Glades Shopping centre.

address: St. Pauls Cray Road, Chislehurst BR7
detailedDescription:
A much sought after two bedroom, two bathroom, first floor apartment with a southerly outlook over the landacaped grounds within this beautifully presented 'Retirement Living' development speciffically designed for the over 60's. Located within easy reach of transport links and local amenities.

Summary

Faulkner Court was built by McCarthy & Stone purpose built for retirement living. The development consists of one and two-bedroom retirement apartments for the over 60s. There is a House Manager on site and a 24-hour emergency call system provided via a personal pendant alarm and with call points in the bathroom.
The apartment features a fully fitted kitchen, two spacious bedrooms, two shower rooms and lounge. The development includes a Homeowners' lounge and landscaped gardens. There is a guest suite for visitors who wish to stay (additional charges apply). A car parking – permit scheme applies, check with the House Manager for availability.

The dedicated House Manager is on site during working hours to take care of things and make you feel at home. There's no need to worry about the burden of maintenance costs as the service charge covers the cost of all external maintenance, gardening and landscaping, external window cleaning, buildings insurance, water rates and security systems. All energy costs of the laundry room, homeowners lounge and other communal areas are also covered in the service charge. For your peace of mind the development has camera door entry and 24-hour emergency call systems, should you require assistance. The Homeowners' lounge provides a great space to socialise with friends and family. If your guests have travelled from afar, they can extend their stay by booking into the development Guest Suite (fee applies - subject to availability). It is a condition of purchase that residents must meet the age requirement of 60 years or over.

Entrance Hall

Large entrance hall with walk-in storage/airing cupboard. Illuminated light switches, apartment security door entry system and intercom. Emergency pull cord

Living Room

A bright and spacious living/dining room benefitting from having a southerly aspect, a glazed patio door with windows to side opening to a juliet balcony with stunning views over the tranquil landscaped gardens. TV and BT points. Fitted carpets, raised electric power sockets. Underfloor heating with individual thermostats.

Kitchen

Modern fitted kitchen with a range of low and eye level units and drawers with co-ordinated work surfaces. Electrically operated UPVC double glazed windows with a Southerly aspect. Stainless steel sink with mono lever tap and drainer. Waist level oven, ceramic hob, cooker hood and integral fridge freezer and dishwasher, under pelmet lighting.

Bedroom One With En-Suite Bathroom

Spacious double bedroom with large walk-in wardrobe. Underfloor heating, raised power points. TV and BT points. Window overlooking the landscaped gardens. Door to en-suite bathroom

En-Suite Bathroom

Part tiled, panel enclosed bath with mixer taps and wall mounted shower attachment. Underfloor heating and grab rails. WC and vanity unit with sink mirror and light above. Emergency pull cord. Electric ladder style towel heater.

Bedroom Two

Second double bedroom of ample proportions with window overlooking gardens, raised power points, underfloor heating.

Shower Room

Part tiled fitted with suite comprising of level access walk-in shower, WC, vanity unit with sink and mirror above. Underfloor heating

Service Charge (Breakdown)

• Cleaning of communal windows
• Water rates for communal areas and apartments
• Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas
• 24-hour emergency call system
• Upkeep of gardens and grounds
• Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas
• Contingency fund including internal and external redecoration of communal areas
• Buildings insurance
The service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your House Manager, your water rates, the 24-hour emergency call system, the heating and maintenance of all communal areas, exterior property maintenance and gardening. Find out more about service charges please contact your Property Consultant or House Manager.

Leasehold

Leasehold 125 Years From 2015
Ground Rent £595. Pa.

Car Parking

Car Parking (Permit Scheme) subject to availability
Parking is by allocated space subject to availability. The fee is usually £250 per annum, but may vary by development. Permits are available on a first come, first served basis. Please check with the House Manager on site for availability.

address: Manor Park Road, Chislehurst, Kent BR7
detailedDescription:
A nearly new two bedroom retirement apartment, situated on the ground floor with an allocated parking space included. The excellent communal facilities include a homeowners lounge, function room, hair salon, bistro/restaurant and landscaped gardens.

Summary

Shepheard's House is a Retirement Living Plus development built by McCarthy & Stone, designed specifically for the over 70s, for those who wish to enjoy independent living but may need some extra care and support. There is an Estate Manager who leads the team and oversees the development. Each apartment has a fully fitted kitchen, underfloor heating, fitted and tiled shower room with level access shower and a 24 hour emergency call system.

Communal facilities include a homeowners lounge where social events and activities take place, a function room and landscaped gardens. There is a fully equipped laundry room a hair salon and bistro/restaurant which is table service and serves freshly prepared meals daily. If your guests wish to stay, there is guest suite accommodation which can be booked (fees apply). There is a 24 hour emergency call system provided by a personal pendant and call points in your bedroom and bathroom as well as onsite management 24 hours a day.

One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge at Shepheard's House with additional services including care and support available at an extra charge. However, this can be from as little as 15 minutes per session which can be increased or decreased to suit your needs.
The complex enjoys a desirable location, with the nearest amenities on Royal Parade, just 0.3 miles from the site. Here, you’ll find a selection of independent retailers, a clothing boutique, florist and gastro pub.
The Chislehurst train station is 1.2 miles away with direct connections to London Charing Cross, Sevenoaks and Orpington. For those who prefer the bus, there is a stop a few hundred yards from the development, with services following the 61 and 273 routes. Chislehurst high street, Royal Parade and Lewisham and Bromley are a few minutes by bus, while the sheltered bus stop at Chislehurst War Memorial offers wider routes to take you further afield.

Entrance Hall

Front door with spy hole leads to the large entrance hall - the 24-hour Tunstall emergency response pull cord system is situated in the hall. From the hallway there is a door to a walk-in storage cupboard/airing cupboard housing a bosch washer/dryer and Vent-Axia system. Illuminated light switches, smoke detector, apartment security door entry system with intercom and emergency pull cord located in the hall. Doors lead to the bedrooms, living room and shower room and WC.

Living/Dining Room

A well-proportioned living room with glazed patio door and window to side providing plenty of natural light and access out to a covered patio area and gardens beyond. TV and telephone points, Sky/Sky+ connection point. Two ceiling lights. Fitted carpets, raised electric power sockets. Partially glazed door leads onto a separate kitchen.

Kitchen

A modern fitted kitchen with a range of base and eye level units and drawers with grey stone worktops. Electrically operated UPVC double glazed window. Stainless steel sink with mono lever tap and drainer. Waist level oven, microwave oven, ceramic hob, cooker hood, dish washer and integral fridge freezer.

Bedroom 1.

A large double bedroom with patio door and window to side opening onto a small paved patio area. Walk-in wardrobe housing rails and shelving. Ceiling lights, TV and phone point.

Bedroom 2.

Double bedroom. Ceiling lights, TV and phone point.

Shower Room

Modern white suite comprising of; close-coupled WC, vanity wash-hand basin with fitted storage below, fitted mirror, shaver point and down lights over, walk-in level access shower with thermostatically controlled shower. Fully tiled walls and wet room flooring, electric heated towel rail, emergency pull cord and ceiling spot light.

Wc

Part tiled walls and floor, WC, wash basin with vanity unit below and mirror above.

Service Charge (Breakdown)

• 24-Hour on-site staffing
• 1 hours domestic assistance per week
• Cleaning of communal windows
• Water rates for communal areas and apartments
• Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas
• 24 hour emergency call system

• Running of the on-site restaurant
• Buildings insurance

The Service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV licence. To find out more about the service charges please please contact your Property Consultant or Estate Manager.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautiful four double bedroom end of terrace town house, located in Beckenham within the prestigious Langley Waterside gated development.

This modern property comprises a welcoming hallway and a good-sized fully fitted kitchen/breakfast room with double doors leading out to the bright, sun filled conservatory with direct access to private rear garden. The downstairs accommodation completes with a useful WC. And understair storage.

To the first floor you will find a further bright and spacious reception room with two double patio doors to a south facing balcony and a large double bedroom with built-in storage and a three piece en-suite shower room. The third floor comprises a modern three piece family bathroom and a further three bedrooms; one of which features built-in wardrobes and large en suite shower room.

The Langley Waterside Development is a private development that has a 24 hour guard at the entrance for additional security. Transport links are plentiful with Beckenham Junction providing frequent services into Victoria and the City at peak times plus a tram link to Croydon and Wimbledon. Eden Park station is also close by offering direct links to Lewisham where you can change for the DLR or to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street. Local schools include Langley Park for Girls and Boys, Clare House and Unicorn Primary.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

address: Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, London SE19
detailedDescription:
This stunning first-floor flat is set within a handsome period conversion and greets you with stairs rising to the second floor landing, this leads into the bright reception room with a beautiful feature cast iron fireplace and ample space for relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with space for free-standing furniture, and a modern bathroom with white suite and tiled walls. The property is enviably located close to excellent transport links, with Anerley, Crystal Palace, and Birkbeck stations all within easy reach, as well as numerous regular bus routes linking the surrounding area. There are a variety of shops and amenities nearby, with the fashionable Crystal Palace Triangle also within a short distance for a variety of cafes, bars, restaurants and shopping facilities. The famous site of Crystal Palace Park is also just a short distance away, with lake, childrens' zoo and dinosaur trail. Ideal as a first-time or investment purchase, viewings of this property are highly recommended.

What do you love most about your home?
The flat is incredibly light and seeing the sunrise from the kitchen and the sunset from the lounge never fails to disappoint. Being on the top floor is not only secure but adds extra space both with the internal staircase and the fantastic storage in the lofts. Good-sized rooms.

Why are you moving?
After living here for 7 years I have outgrown the flat and also don't like staying in one place for too long!

What do you love about the area?
​Everything is on the doorstep, literally. Next door to one side is a lovely coffee shop/cafe and on the other side, a great independent wine retailer! Across the road you will find the friendly dry cleaner, a post office, Tesco, an Italian restaurant and much more (and that's not including the Triangle at the top of the hill). And of course, just around the corner is the famous Crystal Palace Park and the train station which is a mere 90 seconds walk away.

detailedDescription:

Book a Viewing by visiting our website or calling us.

We are delighted to offer for sale this spacious four- bedroom detached house just five minutes walk from Orpington Station looking for new owners to appreciate its easy access to Orpington High Street and excellent schools as well as spacious living areas and attractive woodland walks.

The pitched-roof property boasts an enclosed porch with a built in coat rail, two bright and spacious reception rooms (both of which comfortably seat up to ten people), a compact, custom designed kitchen, three large double bedrooms and one smaller double, two family bathrooms (one on each floor) and large storage capacity throughout.

The garage holds one vehicle and provides additional storage space and the driveway will accommodate up to three cars.

The private garden to the rear is easily maintained and is planted with a variety of mature flowering shrubs. It includes a patio area for outside dining as well as a handy garden shed. The front garden is laid to lawn.

Due to the design of the house and the size of the plot, there is also considerable potential to extend and remodel the property.

detailedDescription:

The property comprises a entrance hallway leading to a thru lounge/dining room and next to this a fitted kitchen. title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Waymour and Parr are proud to present this stunning 6 bedroom, 3 bathroom family home with gorgeous views overlooking Millwall Training Ground.

This unique house is separated split into a large 4 double bedroom house spread over approximately 1,500 square foot (140 square metres) and a separate annex approximately 700 square foot (65 square metres)

The main house benefits from 2 reception rooms, a separate office/beauty room, downstairs WC, large open plan Kitchen with utility area, family bathroom with en-suite. The mature garden is well established and being situated on a side plot provides rear access for parking, or delivery of the bouncy castle for those well missed family gatherings.

Location is fantastic here with a choice of stations all within close proximity including Ravensbourne, Shortlands, Bromley North and Bromley South.
For comprehensive shopping there is The Glades, Bromley with its array of shops and restaurants.

For those seeking a more active lifestyle there are many attractions locally including Beckenham Place Park which should fulfill most needs with its nature trails, open space, water sports, play equipment and street food markets to name a few.

The property itself offers three generous bedrooms, a lovely modern bathroom, living room with juliette balcony to maximise the enjoyment of the warmer weather that is coming, a good size kitchen and a utility room which also gives access to the garden.

We have been told the garden is a 'sun trap', and being South West facing I can well believe this. The garage is integral and can be accessed both from the hallway and externally from the driveway making this prime for conversion if the need arises.

These homes are fantastic for flexible living and offers those wishing to extend and increase the size and or, the number of bedrooms, the opportunity to do so. Some have extended to the rear and converted the garage to make a super size, open plan kitchen diner with living room to the rear of the house overlooking the garden. Then four bedrooms and two bathrooms over the next two floors.

All in all we believe this will make a wonderful family home as it is, but should your needs require more then the opportunity is here so take a look at the video tour and then call us to view in person.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Nestled just off of Elmers End road is this one bedroom Victorian conversion flat which is truly special with an amazing private garden space. The entire flat and outside space has been modernised extensively with no expense spared.

You are instantly greeted by a private entrance, the striking chrome door furniture is complimented by subtle exterior lighting. The hallway has underfloor heating with stylish victorian tiles. The period features continue further inside the property with high ceilings, column radiators, decorative cornicing and large ceiling roses.
The open plan lounge and kitchen has plenty of space for all the necessary furniture with high quality engineered flooring and white walls. The huge windows flood the room with natural light with the lower panels being frosted for extra privacy. Extra storage space has been created in the kitchen with full height cupboards. The kitchen features integrated washing machine, fridge freezer and dishwasher with a durable quartz worktop.
To the bathroom the brick has been exposed and is really setting this flat apart from the rest. The victorian freestanding bath has fixed rainfall shower head and a detachable hose. Underfloor heating and a natural stone tile to the floor are further benefits.
The bedroom is well proportioned with high quality underlay and carpets, frosted glass panels and chrome switches and sockets.
Onto the garden space which is accessed via the side and can only be described as generous. The current owner has continued the attention to detail outside with astroturf to the middle, boarded by decorative stones and flower beds. A barked area is currently used as table space, this is really a garden that will be loved and enjoyed by friends and family all year round.
The flat benefits from off street parking with the block set back from the road. Birkbeck Station is 0.3 Miles away with Anerley Station 0.5 miles away. Local convenient shops, a tesco superstore at the bottom of the Road with further amenities in the Crystal Palace Triangle & Penge High Street close by.
With all the above mentioned, we are sure this will generate immediate interest. Call now for your viewing.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £1,000,000 - £1,100,000

Situated in an extremely popular private road, found at the end of the road in a delightfully secluded spot is this four/five bedroom detached house. The location offers access to both Petts Wood and Chislehurst villages, vast National Trust woodlands, as well as mainline stations serving an array of London termini.

The accommodation comprises spacious entrance hall, shower room, three/four reception rooms and the breakfasting kitchen. The reception rooms offer flexible accommodation, some being used as dining rooms, lounges, study or bedroom. To the first floor is the family bathroom and four generously proportioned double bedrooms, two of which with fitted wardrobe space. The sizable master bedroom is accessed via bedroom two but subject to permissions and regulations, could potentially have it's own access via the landing cupboard. Measuring over 26ft long, the room has potential to be the master suite with dressing area and ensuite or potentially even converted into two bedrooms.

To the front of the property is ample off street parking via a paved driveway which provides access to a substantial garage. The superb garden provides a secluded space which measures over 90ft long by 80ft wide, with ample lawn and patio area as well as a delightful array of mature plants and shrubbery.

Internal viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate all that this family home has to offer

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £675,000 - £700,000 / Virtual Viewing Available*

A stunning four bedroom, two bathroom extended 1930s semi-detached family home with 100 ft garden, off road parking and access to excellent schools and local amenities.

On the ground floor the property comprises a generous sized reception room which is open plan to the stunning kitchen / diner that is finished off to an incredibly high standard, boasting under floor heating, a bespoke fitted kitchen with sparkling water tap, quartz work surfaces, Amtico flooring and a unique custom built hidden bar. This kitchen area benefits from a large roof lantern and bi-folding doors allowing light to flood in and connecting the living space to the beautifully finished 100ft south facing rear garden which also offers a part completed summer house / garden room. A spacious utility / store room which is plumbed for a washing machine completes the ground floor accommodation and could easily be converted to a downstairs shower room or large WC.

On the first floor there are three bedrooms, two of which are doubles and a fully tiled family bathroom. The property has been extended into the loft to create an impressive master suite which includes two Velux windows and French doors leading onto a Juliet balcony. A modern en-suite bathroom with a walk in shower completes the loft conversion.

Other benefits include off street parking to the front and side access to the rear garden.

Nearby are highly regarded schools including Perry Hall Primary and Poverest Primary. There are also some super selective high achieving grammar schools within proximity including St Olave’s Grammar School for boys and Newstead Woods Grammar School for girls.

Orpington Town Centre is just 0.2 mile away offering a good selection of shops and restaurants. Orpington Train Station (0.8 mile) offers fast and frequent service to a range of central London destinations including London Bridge from 15 minutes.

detailedDescription:
This split level ground floor maisonette is situated conveniently close to the local shops of St. Mary Cray High Street and is within 0.6 miles of the train station.
Forming part of a purpose built block, these apartments rarely come to the market and this one comes with the benefit of no chain.

The accommodation includes two double bedrooms (on the first floor) and there is a good size reception room and kitchen/breakfast room downstairs.

One of the major benefits of this property is the private garden that comes with it, accessed directly from the living room and providing a safe and secure outside space where children could play. A secure entry phone system also allows access to the building.

The property is fully double glazed and has gas fired central heating via a boiler that is approximately 4 years old. There is plenty of free parking available outside in a bay that is off the road.

Orpington is a thriving suburban town within the M25 and therefore ideally situated for access to the motorway network and the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. The closest, St. Mary Cray (0.6 miles), has a direct line into London (Victoria). The Town Centre has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. You will also find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.<br /><br />

Bourne Road is a popular residential road situated within easy reach of the town centre offering an array of shops, restaurants and a new nine screen cinema complex. Local schools include the outstanding Raglan Primary School and Bullers Wood and Ravensbourne for secondary.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A very well presented and extended five bedroom, semi-detached family home which has been finished to a very high specification by the current owners. The property benefits from a good-sized reception room, utility room, downstairs w/c, garage and a large open plan modern fitted kitchen and dining room which leads to the patio and mainly laid to lawn rear garden. There is also a small covered barbecue area. Furthermore, the first floor offers two good sized double bedrooms, and two single bedroom and a main family bathroom which is made up of a modern three-piece suite. The loft conversion has created a fantastic master bedroom with en-suite shower room and a walk-in wardrobe.
This property offers plenty of space and provides the opportunity for a growing family to transform the property into a perfect family home.
This property boasts plenty of internal living space and will make a superb home for a growing family. The property is situated on Sidcup Road which offers an easy walk to New Eltham rail station, plenty of local amenities and good schools close by.

Location:
New Eltham is a sought after suburb of South East London, located within the Royal Borough of Greenwich. The property is located conveniently adjacent for Eltham and Chislehurst High Streets. Eltham High Street contains many nationwide brands such as Marks & Spencer, Costa Coffee as well as a fine range of restaurants of varied cuisine, pubs and a popular, and newly developed six-screen cinema complex with a Nando's, Pizza Express and a sky bar within.

For the commuters, there is a direct train line from either of Eltham (which is approximately 10 minutes walk away), New Eltham or Mottingham Station, serving Lewisham (for DLR), London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street, Waterloo East and Victoria. Buses connect to all neighbouring towns with Woolwich Arsenal and Lewisham both benefitting from DLR services and Woolwich soon to include Crossrail (2018). For roads in and out of London you have the South Circular, A2/A102 (Blackwell Tunnel Approach), A20 and Rochester Way.

The Royal borough of Greenwich is renowned for being one of the greenest in London, offering a range of open parkland and recreational activities for the whole family to enjoy. Eltham Park South with its tennis courts, play park and tea hut is almost opposite whilst further along Glenesk Road is Eltham Park North, with a duck pond flanked by the ancient Oxleas Wood. The Well Hall Pleasance is a park within the former grounds of the Tudor Barn, now a pub/restaurant with the grounds doubling up as an open-air cinema in the summer months. Eltham Palace is adjacent to the High Street, once the childhood home to Henry VIII and the family home to the Courtaulds, now a national heritage site and one of the country's finest Art Deco homes often used as a backdrop in period dramas. Neighbouring is Eltham Warren Golf Course, one of two in the wider area, The Royal Blackheath being the oldest golf club in England.

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available A beautifully presented three bedroom semi detached property, located on a sought after residential road within the catchment area for a number of excellent local schools. Constructed in the 1930's the property offers spacious accommodation arranged over two floors.

The ground floor opens to an entrance hallway which provides access to a downstairs cloakroom, large reception room with bay window and electric stove, this is a comfortable living space with high ceiling. To the rear of the ground floor is a kitchen/dining room featuring modern units, integrated appliances and laminate flooring. The dining area in turn opens to a conservatory which overlooks the rear garden. Upstairs are three bedrooms, two of which are large double rooms. All are serviced by a family bathroom.

To the rear of the property is a patio and garden which is mostly laid to lawn with mature trees and border shrubbery. Additionally there is detached garage which has been lined and could be converted into space for a home office or gym. To the front is a paved driveway providing off street parking.

The location is served well with local shopping facilities, Public Houses and restaurants available in the neighbouring villages of Keston, Locksbottom and Bromley Common. Bromley Town centre also offers a wider selection available. Situated within close proximity are Orpington, Hayes and Bromley South mainline train stations which all boast excellent services into London within 18 minutes.

'Keston House'

Well if this property does not make your heart skip then i'm not sure what will. I'm sure the Nuvo music system throughout the house may help though.
'Keston House' is set back towards the middle of the plot behind private electric gates and surrounded by mature trees offering great privacy. There are 33 cameras using the Hik-Connect system and Banham alarm for the homes protection.

The ground floor is 5550 sq ft with a striking entrance hall setting the tone for the lifestyle nicely. The principle receptions can all be accessed from here. The bespoke Chamber kitchen has a beautiful semi circular breakfast bar, a second kitchen area adjacent and a large bay window to allow the natural light to flood in and enjoy the view over the patio terrace and garden. The appliances are Gaggenau and include sub zero refrigerators. The sitting room is a very comfortable space with bay window and two double doors to the garden. The leisure complex is also on this level offering swimming pool with shower and changing room, gym and coffee room to start your day in the right way or maybe wind you down at the end.

The first floor which is 5267 sq ft, offers five bedrooms, all with ensuite bathrooms and the principle suite benefiting from dressing area and walk-in wardrobe. There is also a self contained one bedroom apartment on this level and a games room for family entertainment.

The second floor which is 1037 sq ft has another bedroom suite with bathroom, walk in wardrobe and a relaxation reception.

The lower ground level which is 1835 sq ft is designed for maximum entertainment with a cinema room with Bose cinema surround system, a fabulous bar and lounge area for before and after the screening and of course a wine cellar as you can never have too many luxuries.

Outside the grounds include a patio area with outdoor kitchen to enjoy some 'al fresco' dining, a sunken hot tub, a further patio on a lower tier to enjoy some relaxation time, a recently re-surfaced multi sports court and the remainder laid to lawn. There is a triple garage and ample parking for your vehicles and guests.

Forest Ridge is situated within Keston Park which is located close to Locksbottom village with its local shopping facilities including a Sainsbury's superstore, restaurants and public houses including the popular Chapter One restaurant.

Comprehensive Shopping: The Glades in Bromley, Orpington High Street and Bluewater Shopping Centre.

Mainline Rail Services: Services direct to London
Orpington (2.7 miles) to London Bridge, Charing Cross, London Victoria, Cannon Street, Blackfriars . Bromley South (3 miles) to London Victoria.

Primary Schools: Keston C of E, Crofton, Darrick Wood and Farnborough.
Secondary Schools: Ravenswood, St. Olaves, Newstead Wood (selective) and Darrick Wood schools.
Private Schools: Bromley High School for Girls, Bickley Park Boys' School, Eltham College, Farringtons and Babington House.

Motorway Links: The A21 Hastings Road leads to Junction 4 of the M25 giving access to Gatwick and Heathrow Airports, Channel Tunnel Terminus, Ebbsfleet International, the South Coast and Bluewater shopping centre.

address: Wickham Court Road, West Wickham, Kent BR4
detailedDescription:
Stunning and spacious three bedroom semi-detached property


FastMove are proud to present this wonderful three Bedroom family home.

The property is situated in a popular residential location. However, it is still close to a number of local amenities including a comprehensive range of shops, eateries and Supermarkets.

Furthermore, this wonderful home is close to a number of reputable schools to suit all ages including Hawes Down Primary and Langley Secondary schools, making this the ideal spot for any young/growing family.

The property is well served as West Wickham station is within walking distance, ideal for the commuter.

The property briefly comprises of a Porch, Entrance Hallway, Lounge, Dining Room, Kitchen, Conservatory, Three Bedrooms and Family Bathroom.

Through an external door leads you too the
Entrance porch

The perfect place to take off those muddy boots and damp coats.
A further doorway leads into the
Entrance hallway

The property boasts a welcoming Hallway, which sets the scene for the rest of the property in terms of space and quality presentation. The Hallway benefits from a wall mounted radiator useful under-stair storage cupboard. A staircase rises to the first floor, an internal door leads to the Lounge and open entrance take you through to the Kitchen.
Lounge

The property boasts a bright and airy reception room with plenty of space for a number of pieces of furniture, the perfect place to sit back and relax. To the front aspect is a large D/G bay window which allows excellent levels of light. The Lounge also benefits from an attractive coal effect gas fire with marble hearth and surround giving the room a focal point and cosy feel. There is also a wall mounted radiator and stylish coving to the ceiling. A set of double doors lead to the
Dining room

Another generous sized reception room which is incredibly versatile. The room does offer plenty of space for a Dining Table and Chairs, perfect to entertain family and friends. However, the room could also be used for more informal purposes, i.e. A second Lounge/Snug. The room also benefits from a wall mounted radiator. A set of sliding patio doors lead to the
Conservatory

The Conservatory runs nearly the full width of the property and is mainly built of glass, the perfect place to relax in the Summer months. Benefiting from a wall mounted radiator and plenty of space for more furniture. The Conservatory is decorated with tiles to the floor and a set of patio doors lead to the rear garden.
Kitchen

The Kitchen is complimented by an array of modern and stylish wall and base units with complementary granite work-surfaces. Benefiting from a fitted electric Oven, four ring gas Hob and overhead Extractor, integrated Dishwasher, single ceramic Sink and Drainer, Washing Machine and American style Fridge/Freezer. A set of D/G patio doors lead to the Conservatory and the Kitchen is decorated with tiles to the walls and floor.
First floor landing

The room benefits from a rare and spacious landing and internal doors lead to all three Bedrooms and the Family Bathroom.
Principal bedroom

A great sized principal bedroom which benefits from fitted mirrored wardrobes down one aspect. However, the Bedroom still offers plenty of space for a double bed and free-standing furniture. Benefiting from a large D/G bay window to the front aspect adding to the excellent levels of natural light the property offers and a wall mounted radiator.
Bedroom two

A generous sized second bedroom, with plenty of space for a double bed, and a number of pieces of free-standing furniture. Benefiting from a D/G window and wall mounted radiator.
Bedroom three

A spacious third Bedroom with plenty of space for a bed and free-standing furniture. Benefiting from a D/G window and wall mounted radiator. The loft is also gained from the third Bedroom which is accessed via a drop-down ladder. The loft has power and light and is a great space for storage.
Family bathroom

A spacious Family Bathroom which comprises of a four-piece suite including a panelled bath, spacious shower cubicle with wall mounted shower head, low flush WC, and wash hand basin. The Bathroom benefits from a heated towel rail, useful storage cupboard and the room is decorated with tiles to the walls and floor.
Exterior

To the front of the property is a generous sized garden which is surrounded by a low standing wall and mature shrubbery and trees. A private pathway leads to the front door.
To the rear of the property is a spacious and private garden surrounded by mature shrubbery and plantation. The rear garden is mainly laid to lawn, however there is a pebbled path leading to the bottom of the garden. At the bottom of the garden is also off-road parking. The rear of the property is also complimented by an outside tap and outside lighting.

Cash buyers only. Offered to the market chain free is this delightful two bedroom second floor apartment in good decorative order. The property comprises of bright and airy lounge, generous sized kitchen, bathroom, andtwo double bedrooms.
The property is ideally located for Beckenham High Street, local parks, and mainline stations including Elmers End, Clock House, and Beckenham Junction. Lease 61 years remaining. Cash buyers Only. Investment opportunity, tenant in situ.

Location:
Beckenham has long been a popular suburban town, and is highly popular with both families and commuters who are spoilt for choice with numerous Train stations including Beckenham Junction, New Beckenham, Beckenham Hill, Clock House and Ravensbourne Stations with services into Central London. The popular Tramlink run frequently into both Croydon through to Wimbledon Village and numerous bus services that provide connections into Bromley, Crystal Palace and beyond. Beckenham is a vibrant area with a host of independent and chain restaurants, boutique shops and niche coffee. Beckenham is a great place to live and work, with excellent local amenities including the Spa leisure centre, David Lloyd, Crease Park, Kelsey Park with its wonderful ornamental lake and Croydon recreation ground. Sought after schools locally include Balgowan, Marian Vian and the ever popular Langley Park boys and Girls schools.

Outside, there a single garage plus allocated parking space. There are extensive and well kept gardens surrounding the property and also parking for visitors.

Shortlands Grove is a highly popular residential road, just half a mile form Shortlands station which provides direct and frequent train services to London Victoria and Blackfriars. Both Beckenham and Bromley town centres are also easily accessible.

detailedDescription:
Within Belgrave House, a charming Grade ii-listed Country House that has been carefully designed to create eight luxurious apartments, sits this wonderful two-bedroom, two-bathroom first-floor luxurious apartment. This triple-aspect apartment must be viewed to be truly appreciated and the property is positioned in a gated development on the sought-after and leafy West Common Road, in Hayes.

Virtual walkthrough 3D tour available for West Common Road, Hayes

If you would like to take a virtual walk through this property, please click play on the virtual tour. If you have any further questions or would like to arrange an accompanied viewing please contact the listing agent Kunal Trehan.

The gated development is nestled within the ancient woods of Hayes Common. It is surrounded by two acres of lawn, shrubs and mature trees, and offers the perfect combination of being a private, secluded and tranquil location yet with the convenience of being within walking distance for reliable transport via Hayes into London. This property, due to its size and location, is perfect for buyers such as families, parties looking to downsize and yet stay in the borough of Bromley, and regular commuters into London. The property was completed by the reputable London Square. The apartment offers expansive and spacious living space, complimented by high ceilings, and is extremely light and airy due to the original large Georgian-style windows that complement the listed building and its picturesque exterior.

As you enter the property you shall not be disappointed because the open hallway leads you into the heart of the home, the main reception room. This room is currently presented as an open- plan living/dining/kitchen area, complimented by solid oak herringbone flooring, high ceilings and five grand Georgian windows. The views from the main reception room overlook the landscaped communal lawns of the development.
The modern integrated kitchen comes with a wide variety of Siemens appliances; the units are of a premium gloss finish, and they are complemented with Corian worktops.

The large kitchen island, a comfortable place to enjoy your breakfast, lunch or dinner, is where the Siemens induction hob sits, and the kitchen, like the island itself, provides ample storage.
There are two wonderful double bedrooms and neither disappoints: Both bedrooms offer fantastic square footage, more than ample integrated storage and both benefit from elegant en-suite bathrooms.

The property further benefits from features such as a cloakroom, a large integrated storage cupboard, underfloor heating, a state-of-the art air exchange and filtration system, a bike store and two allocated parking spaces.

What’s the area like?

Belgrave House is approximately eight minutes’ walk to Hayes High Street and Hayes Station, which has excellent links to central London. Parents will appreciate the excellent provision of local schools, including the much sought-after Hayes Secondary School and Pickhurst Primary School. Bromley South Station is located 1.1 miles away, providing excellent services into London Victoria (approx.17 minutes).

The kitchen is open to a large reception room which is used by the current owners as a sitting room. This room has double doors out to the rear garden.

To the first floor, there is a good sized double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room. There is another room on this floor which could be used as either a sitting room or further bedroom. This room benefits from a Juliet balcony overlooking the rear garden.

To the second floor are a further three double bedrooms, two with fitted cupboards, family bathroom and utility cupboard.

The rear garden is laid to patio which is ideal for outdoor entertaining. The property benefits from allocated parking

This immaculate property is ideally located for multiple stations with fast connections to the City. Also nearby are bus links taking you to Bromley, Orpington, Chislehurst, Catford and Bexleyheath. Local Primary schools include St Georges, Bickley and La Fontaine Academy.

detailedDescription:
A meticulously designed and finished house, upon entering you are struck by the abundance of natural light that flows into all of the rooms, every detail has been carefully considered in order to make Venner the perfect family home. What isn't apparent from the front of the property is the loft conversion that now boasts an extra two bedrooms and second bathroom.

The ground floor, boasts a through lounge with dual aspect windows, a feature fireplace which is focal point of the room and wood block flooring which has been lovingly restored to its formal glory. The kitchen is newly appointed and has many integrated appliances that will stay.

The first floor comprises of three bedrooms, one being the principal room, boasting a large bay window allowing lots of light to flood into the room. The bathroom is modern and fresh and the other two bedrooms are both of double standard. The third floor benefits from a further two bedrooms and another family bathroom.

The South West garden is haven to relax in after a long day at work and enjoy alfresco dining, the grassed area has lots of space to erect a trampoline and swing of your choice to let the little ones play. To the front of this beautiful home is a driveway with dropped kerb, allowing off street parking.

You will never be late for the train to work, as the property is situated within minutes walk of Penge East station which has excellent links to London Victoria, weekday trains depart four times an hour, with fastest journey times of 18 minutes. Local schools and nurseries are of an abundance plus the ever popular Crystal Place park South entrance is a few minutes walk away. Alexandra recreation ground, is one of the seven Penge parks, like Penge recreation ground it answers the late Victorian social ideal of recreation and good health.

Penge has become an area which is attracting, young professionals, investors and first time buyers, with an ever growing high street, great schools, great train links and fast commutes.
