detailedDescription:
This imaginative three-bedroom house on Hayfield Road was designed by architects hwk in 2015. It has a richly planted garden with a studio room / home office and notable eco-credentials. Originally conceived as part of the 1930s garden suburb expansion in Orpington, the house has been carefully rebuilt by hwk and the current owners, who have sensitively worked within the parameters of the original design to create a series of clever, contemporary spaces.

The Tour

The house is set behind a paved hardstanding and is concealed from the road by a vibrant bush of bamboo. The exterior retains its original form with sympathetic clay tile cladding, while inside, a thoroughly contemporary approach is revealed. Entry is to a neat lobby area, which opens onto the kitchen on the right. Appliances are neatly arranged under hardwood worktops to one side of the room, and there is a breakfast bar and bespoke shelving. This intelligent use of space allows for a large family dining area, set against a picture window with an inbuilt seat.

There are no load-bearing walls on the ground floor plan, allowing for the creation of flexible and open spaces. At the rear, an impressive set of wrap-around, full-height sliding doors open from the living room to a patio and the garden beyond. Architectural slights of hand feature throughout the house; the centre of the ground floor plan is flooded with light via a skylight to the staircase above, and there is a concealed shower room. Buff-coloured engineered oak floorboards run underfoot.

On the first floor are three bedrooms and a family bathroom. The bedrooms all have double-height ceilings, and the largest has an en suite shower room adjacent. The top floor is accessed via a spiral staircase; this is an innovative space with a bespoke ridge-glazed window across the apex of the house, which draws light in. It is currently well-used as a home office.

The house has been finished to an extremely high standard, with energy efficiency at the forefront of the design. There are solar roof panels; a heat recovery system throughout; triple glazing on all of the Danish windows; plus the house has been super-insulated to reduce heat loss. The Huntingdon wood-burning stove in the living room is gas-powered and underfloor heating features throughout the rest of the house. There is also cat-6 wiring throughout. The house has a 10-year building guarantee ending in 2028.

Outdoor Space

The garden is a peaceful haven, where steps lead up from the sunken seating area to the verdant lawn. Borders planted with brightly coloured tulips and flowering shrubs ensure a prevailing sense of privacy and frame the space. At the end of the garden is a studio room/home office which is fully insulated and connected to the internet.

The Area

Orpington is well placed for fast connections into central London, as well as access to the rolling Kent countryside. There are local amenities on Cray Avenue and at Nugent Shopping Park. Both Petts Wood and Orpington have pretty town centres with locally-loved independent shops and restaurants. The National Trust’s Hawkswood Forest is a mile away and local parks, including Riverside Gardens in St Mary Cray, are close at hand.

Hayfield Road is a nine-minute walk from St Mary Cray station which runs services to London Victoria in 22 minutes. A little further afield, Petts Wood station runs services to London Bridge in just under half an hour. There is easy access to the M25 via the A21, while trains run internationally from Ebbsfleet International station which is within half an hours’ drive.
title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available

Available for the first time in over 45 years, this much loved family home offers spacious accommodation arranged over two floors.

The ground floor opens to a large entrance hallway which provides access to the principal reception rooms including a formal living room, dining room and kitchen/breakfast room. Additionally on the ground floor is a study and utility room. Upstairs are five bedrooms, four of which are double rooms and serviced by a family bathroom. The master bedroom includes an en-suite bathroom. The loft room is fully fitted out with electricity and heating and it has two windows to the front, it is accessible by a loft ladder.

Outside to the rear of the property there is a large patio and a beautifully maintained garden with two areas of lawn and a swimming pool. The garden is bordered by mature trees and shrubbery and is totally private. To the front is a carriage driveway, providing parking for several cars and access to a double garage. The garage in turn opens to the side of the house and on the first floor there is office space or further bedroom with en-suite bathroom.

Keston Park was the brainchild of property developer Frederick Rogers who acquired the land in 1923 from the Earl of Derby. His travels had taken him to America where he had been inspired by houses in beautiful parkland settings so he set about recreating this with Keston Park. It remains one of the most exclusive private estates in the South East and is privately gated at all entrances.

Locksbottom is within a few minutes walk and has an array of excellent restaurants, traditional public houses, independent and national retailers, coffee shops and two major supermarket chains. Within close proximity are extensive shopping centres including The Glades in Bromley, Orpington High Street and Bluewater slightly further afield.

Keston Park has excellent transport links nearby with Orpington Station (1.7 miles), Bickley Station (2.9 miles) and Bromley South Station (3.2 miles) all providing direct services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Victoria and Blackfriars. There is a fast service from Orpington to London Bridge in 15 minutes, and Bromley South to London Victoria in 17 minutes. By car the M25 is easily accessible (4.4 miles), A21 (1.6 miles), Biggin Hill Airport (4.1 miles) and Gatwick Airport is within 40 minutes.

There are high performing schools both state and private in good supply within the local area -

Keston primary school co-education
Crofton primary school co-education
Farnborough primary school co-education
Ravens Wood secondary school for boys
Darrick Wood both primary and secondary co-education schools

St Olaves and St Saviour's grammar school for boys and Newstead Wood for girls are highly rated selective schools. Local children also travel daily by train to Sevenoaks School and Tonbridge School.

Bromley High School for girls
Bickley Park boys school
Babington House co-education to 11 years and girls senior
Radnor House co-education
Royal Russell co-education

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

A light and bright one bedroom period conversion positioned on a sought after road nearby Crystal Palace station.

detailedDescription:
Beautiful two double bedroom and two bathroom second floor flat. Key benefits to the flat include: Lift access, ample storage, garage, both bedrooms have fitted wardrobes and there is also additional storage in the hallway. The large reception room leads out onto a private balcony overlooking the communal garden to the rear of the block and the flat also benefits from off street parking. The property boasts a fitted kitchen with fitted appliances, as well as two modern bathrooms, one bathroom being an en-suite off the master bedroom.

Sara Court is within walking distance to Beckenham Junction rail station and Shortlands station, both offering regular and frequent services into London Victoria and London Blackfriars. The Tramlink at Beckenham Junction also gives easy access to East Croydon, with its 15-minute service to Gatwick Airport. Beckenham High Street is a short distance away with its vibrant atmosphere and array of shops, bars and restaurants as is the popular Beckenham Place Park.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
An immaculate two/three bedroom Victorian terrace house within close proximity to Chislehurst Station.

Arranged over three floors, the property comprises reception room with feature fireplace, fitted kitchen with wooden work surfaces and stone flooring, neutrally tiled three piece bathroom suite, two double bedrooms of which one benefits from an additional dressing room.

This property boasts a wealth of original features such as sash windows and exposed wooden flooring and external masonry work.

Other notable features include a private courtyard, plantation shutters on the majority of the windows, external storage cupboard, spacious cellar and allocated off street parking.

Located 0.4 miles from Chislehurst Station, the property is also within close proximity to local amenities, Chislehurst High Street and the Royal Parade.

This property is offered chain free.

This location is ideal for a park stroll or daily exercise with 200 acres nearby. There are also a wealth of transport options including Anerley, Penge East / West and Crystal Palace stations, and plenty of shopping and leisure facilities at the Crystal Palace Triangle.

This unique semi detached three bedroom freehold house with ground floor and basement commercial unit is offered in a popular location in Orpington.

The house is accessed from the side of the building and comprises of a welcoming reception room, a large kitchen, three good sized bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is also a lovely courtyard leading to a detached garage and a rear garden as well as off street parking space.

The vacant commercial space is set over the ground floor and basement, providing excellent space in a popular area.

Situated on Rushmore Hill with good access to both Knockholt and Chelsfield train stations and also has easy access to the M25 at Junction 4. Local amenities can be found in Pratts Bottom and popular village pubs are within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £500,000 - £600,000 / Virtual Viewing Available*

Offered chain free and occupying a wide plot is this unique and charming detached three / four bedroom family home, bursting with character.

A driveway to the rear offers parking to the back of the garden for numerous vehicles and a car port.

The ground floor offers a spacious entrance hallway boasting beamed ceilings and enough space to house a piano, cloakroom with guest WC and fourth bedroom which could also be used as a study or play room if required.

Two bright reception rooms offer ample entertaining space; one of which has a vaulted ceilings and more exposed beams. The kitchen completes the ground floor accommodation and although a fair size, could be extended to provide impressive open plan living to meet the expectations of the current discerning home buyer.

The secluded rear garden slightly narrows to the rear and comprises a courtyard and lawn area.

Upstairs the property consists of a family bathroom and three further bedrooms, two with fitted wardrobes. There is potential to extend above one of the reception rooms to provide additional upstairs bedrooms (subject to relevant consents)

Located close to local amenities including Nugent Retail Park and Orpington High Street both offering a good selection of shops and restaurants and situated just 0.3 miles from St Mary Cray train station which offers rail services around London and Kent.

Energy Efficiency Rating: E

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A truly remarkable family home. This attractive semi-detached home has been very intelligently and sympathetically extended to provide spacious accommodation for a growing family. The range and sizes of all rooms are impressive, with well proportioned rooms and is offered in excellent condition throughout. Situated in a most convenient location, well set back from the road and is within easy walking distance of the High Street, br railway station and excellent schools in the vicinity. The ground floor provides a very spacious lounge, an excellent bright sitting room, a very good sized kitchen/breakfasting room and a very well proportioned dining room room off the kitchen and a guest cloakroom. The first floor is equally impressive with 4 excellently sized bedrooms and a family bathroom. The loft extension is truly glorious with a very spacious master bedroom and a luxury fitted en-suite bathroom. The rear garden is south facing and is well maintained and to the front of the house there is ample parking on the driveway in front of the integral garage. The property is offered onto the market in exquisite condition throughout and benefits from gas central heating and double glazing. A home of this size, accommodation, location and condition is rarely available and we therefore recommend your earliest attention.

Porch: Enclosed porch.

Entrance hall: Wide and welcoming entrance hall, period oak wood flooring.

Lounge: 11'8" max x 13'9" (3.55m max x 4.18m), Excellent sized and well-proportioned room with bay window, period oak wood flooring.

Sitting room/family room: 17'9" x 11'9" (5.42m x 3.57m), Magnificent sitting room with patio doors opening onto a south facing garden, period oak wood flooring.

Kitchen/Breakfast Room: 13'4" x 16'2" (4.07m x 4.92m), Spacious room, well fitted kitchen opening onto a family/sitting room, underfloor heating. Door to cloakroom which leads to the garage. Steps down to the dining room.

Dining room: 19'5" x 11'9" (5.91m x 3.59m), Well-proportioned room off the kitchen with a window to the front, underfloor heating.

Cloakroom: Modern fitted cloakroom. Door to Garage.

Bedroom 2: 11'12" max x 11'9" (3.65m max x 3.59m), Excellent sized room with a bay window to front.

Bedroom 3: 13'4" x 11'9" (4.07m x 3.57m), Yet another excellent sized room overlooking the garden, with doors opening onto a balcony.

Bedroom 4: 12'7" x 10'0" (3.84m x 3.05m), Well-proportioned room with lots of light.

Bedroom 5 / study: 7'8" x 8'1" (2.33m x 2.46m), Good sized bedroom which can be used as a study if required.

Family Bathroom: 9'5" x 8'3" (2.87m x 2.51m), Modern fitted full bathroom, heated towel rail, underfloor heating.

Master Bedroom: 20'6" x 13'9" (6.24m x 4.20m), Stunning room with window to the rear and two velux windows to the front.

En-Suite bathroom: Luxury fitted bathroom with a bath and a corner shower, immaculately fitted and decorated, large eaves cupboard, heated towel rail, underfloor heating.

Rear garden: South facing garden with a traditional lawn, ideal family sized rear garden. Optional: High quality cabin at the rear of the garden with electricity which can be used as a gym or an office. Indian sandstone patio area, water tap.

Garage: 13'12" x 11'10" (4.26m x 3.60m), Integral garage which provides excellent storage space for bikes, golf clubs and more. Power sockets.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price:£650,000-£675,000

Stunning three bedroom garden maisonette offering over 1350 sq ft of sensational accommodation. This truly outstanding period garden maisonette comprising of the whole ground and lower ground floors of this substantial end of terrace property is offered to the market with share of freehold and no onward chain. It would be an ideal home for families, professionals or sharers and is ideally located within the heart of buzzing Crystal Palace.
The accommodation boasts original charm with its wealth of period features, high ceilings and spacious well proportioned rooms which briefly consists of it's own entrance hallway, a generous through lounge with bay window interconnecting with a second large reception room set up as a dining room, leading into an attractive garden room conservatory with direct access into the stunning garden / outside space. Also on this floor is a fitted kitchen.
Downstairs are three double bedrooms, one with a store room which would be ideal for development into an en suite in the future if desired. Also on this floor are the bathroom and a separate w.c. The smaller bedroom would also make an ideal study/ office with its direct access into a private courtyard with steps up to the delightful south facing garden. The mature enclosed garden is well stocked and mainly laid to York stone paving with a separate raised deck making for a beautiful space for entertaining and alfresco dining.
This really is a superb period conversion which cannot fail to impress - viewings are highly recommended.

Location

Waldegrave Road is a picturesque residential street in one of South East London’s most prestigious postcodes. Transport links are second to none, with the property being only a short walk from Crystal Palace Station, offering direct links to London Bridge, London Victoria and the Overground line to New Cross Gate, Canada Water & Shoreditch. Crystal Palace Park, with the National Athletics Stadium and leisure centre, is even closer. The famous Crystal Palace Triangle is also just on your doorstep and hosts a wide range of boutique bars, restaurants and coffee shops.

Lease Information

Tenure: Share Of Freehold
Lease Length: Tbc Years Remaining
Service Charge: £Ad Hoc shared equally with upper floor flat

Please note information has been provided by the seller. Any incoming purchaser must have this information checked and verified by their solicitor.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

This 2 double bedroom first floor flat was converted 8 years ago to a high standard and has been well maintained and recently finished.

The lounge benefits from the first floor position so it is filled with natural light and the views are great. The roomy kitchen is open to the lounge with ample work & storage space. A high specification kitchen features a wooden effect worktop and built in appliances.

The master bedroom is well proportioned with ample room for wardrobes and the master also provides pleasant views over the rear garden. The second bedroom is also a double which would equally suit a spare room or home office.

The apartment has a light and airy feel to it with large windows overlooking the communal gardens. The property is accessed via a communal entrance hall with stairs leading to the first floor. The large open plan lounge/kitchen is modern with a range of wall, base and drawer units. The bedroom gives access to the bathroom with a four piece white suite.

Additional advantageous features of the property are a substantial loft storage area with easy access via a pull down ladder in the lounge area, a designated parking space and attractive communal gardens.

The Old School forms part of the original Farnborough Primary School which opened in 1873 and retains much character.

The property is conveniently situated for local bus routes to Bromley and Orpington, Darrick Wood Schools and the pru Hospital. Local shops and supermarkets are half a mile away in Locksbottom and there are a host of restaurants, cafés and pubs close by. High Elms Country Park and beautiful Greenbelt countryside are also within striking distance.

We strongly recommend an internal viewing for this property to be fully appreciated.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Approached by electric gates, this beautifully appointed five bedroom detached house is located between the pretty villages of Keston and Downe.

This spacious home boasts a grand 2,682 Sqft of internal accommodation (including annex). Split across two floors, the downstairs consists of a large and inviting entrance hall, downstairs cloakroom. The reception room which offers an ornate fireplace and surround, radiator covers and coved ceilings as well as double doors which lead through to the conservatory. The dining room is open plan to the kitchen/breakfast room which has a full range of bespoke kitchen units with granite work tops, fitted Bosch appliances and fitted utility room. The utility area leads to part of the house that could be separate as an annex and is already set up this way with a beautifully bright dining room, fully fitted functional kitchen, a good size reception room, modern family bathroom and a separate staircase to a 17ft bedroom with the added benefit of a walk-in wardrobe.

To continue this versatile living space upstairs to the main house is a master bedroom with fully fitted wardrobes and a modern en-suite shower room, further three bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes, to complete the upstairs is a modern family bathroom.

To the front of the property is a great size driveway with off street parking for multiple cars. To the side and rear of this property is a fantastic outside entertaining space in the form of a beautifully landscaped mature garden alongside a large and inviting swimming pool.

Leaves Green Road is located in between the picturesque villages of Downe and Keston. Keston Village has a selection of shops, two public houses and a restaurant all located 1.2 miles away. Hayes also offers a variety of shops, cafes and a train station, all situated a mere 2.7 miles away.

Bromley High Street which hosts a larger array of retailers from The Glades Shopping Centre and Bromley South Station is about 4 miles away. Bus services pass along Leaves Green Road and Westerham Road connecting you to the local villages and larger towns. Local schools include Keston and Downe Primary and Ravenswood and Hayes Secondary.

Energy Efficiency Rating C.

detailedDescription:
For sale by Modern Method of Auction: Starting Bid Price £175,000 plus Reservation Fee. This property is for sale by The Great North Property Auction powered by Iam-sold.
This top floor purpose built flat presents an opportunity as a good first time or investment purchase. Featuring an allocated parking space and communal gardens, this one bedroom flat is well well placed for amenities and transport links.
This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance. The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3%
of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the
purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A
sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.
The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.
Referral Arrangements
The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted. Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive.

Situation
Herron Court is located on Westmoreland Road. There are good shops, including a Tesco Express, at the corner of Pickhurst Lane and Westmoreland Road, which is about half a mile away. Bromley South Station and town centre are just under a mile away. Bus services pass along Westmoreland Road with routes to the centre of Bromley and Beckenham, both with an array of shops, supermarkets, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities.

detailedDescription:
Looks are certainly deceptive! This stunning house has been thoughtfully designed and extended so the accommodation flows to create a fabulous family home.

A feature worthy of note is the lower ground floor which provides a cavernous cinema room, lounge and wine store. This area could easily be adapted to provide a children's play and/or office area for those who work from home. Upon entering the house you are greeted by a large and welcoming entrance hall which provides access to the cosy lounge which has a wood burner and a small orangery style extension.

A huge kitchen/diner runs from the front to the back of the house and is fitted with a range of quality wall and base units making this area the heart of the home.

The first floor boasts four double bedrooms and a single along with ensuite bathrooms and a dressing room. The top floor contains the master suite with a large double bedroom, ensuite bathroom and two walk in wardrobes, plus eaves storage.

Outside to rear there is a pleasant garden which is mainly laid to lawn with flower borders and patio area. Plenty of off street parking is available on the gated driveway at the front and access to the garage.

The location is excellent being close to the Bullers Wood Schools, half a mile from Bickley station, 0.9 miles to Chislehurst station and a mile from Bromley town centre.

All in all, a fabulous family home which will not disappoint. Chain free

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

An extremely well presented three bedroom, semi-detached family home which has been finished to a very high specification by the current owners. The property benefits from two good sized reception rooms and a stunning modern fitted kitchen. This property boasts plenty of internal living space and will make a superb home for a growing family. The property is situated on Sidcup Road which offers an easy walk to New Eltham rail station, plenty of local amenities and good schools close by.
The ground floor comprises a hallway, two spacious reception room, a large modern fitted kitchen, and a landscaped rear garden with a large patio area which is accessible through the kitchen via and/or the reception room. The ground floor also benefits a downstairs bath room.
Furthermore, the first floor offers two good sized double bedrooms. Internally this property offers plenty of space and provides the opportunity for a growing family to transform the property into a perfect family home. There is also the potential to extend STPP.

Location:
New Eltham is a sought after suburb of South East London, located within the Royal Borough of Greenwich. The property is located conveniently adjacent for Eltham and Chislehurst High Streets. Eltham High Street contains many nationwide brands such as Marks & Spencer, Costa Coffee as well as a fine range of restaurants of varied cuisine, pubs and a popular, and newly developed six-screen cinema complex with a Nando's, Pizza Express and a sky bar within.

For the commuters, there is a direct train line from either of Eltham (which is approximately 10 minutes walk away), New Eltham or Mottingham Station, serving Lewisham (for DLR), London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street, Waterloo East and Victoria. Buses connect to all neighbouring towns with Woolwich Arsenal and Lewisham both benefitting from DLR services and Woolwich soon to include Crossrail (2018). For roads in and out of London you have the South Circular, A2/A102 (Blackwell Tunnel Approach), A20 and Rochester Way.

The Royal borough of Greenwich is renowned for being one of the greenest in London, offering a range of open parkland and recreational activities for the whole family to enjoy. Eltham Park South with its tennis courts, play park and tea hut is almost opposite whilst further along Glenesk Road is Eltham Park North, with a duck pond flanked by the ancient Oxleas Wood. The Well Hall Pleasance is a park within the former grounds of the Tudor Barn, now a pub/restaurant with the grounds doubling up as an open-air cinema in the summer months. Eltham Palace is adjacent to the High Street, once the childhood home to Henry VIII and the family home to the Courtaulds, now a national heritage site and one of the country's finest Art Deco homes often used as a backdrop in period dramas. Neighbouring is Eltham Warren Golf Course, one of two in the wider area, The Royal Blackheath being the oldest golf club in England.

address: Brookbury House, 2 Blackbrook Lane, Bromley BR2
detailedDescription:
No chain

jdm are delighted to offer to the market this stunningly presented two double bedroom, two bathroom modern apartment. This first floor property is offered within a purpose built block of six which was completed in 2018. The property is well located being on the borders of Petts Wood and Bickley, with the local shops at The Fairway. Access to Jubilee park is almost opposite the property and local bus routes providing access to Petts Wood, Bickley, Chislehurst and Bromley mainline stations can also be found locally.

Offering luxury throughout the accommodation comprises two double bedrooms both offering built in wardrobes, the master also offering an en-suite bathroom. There is a family bathroom accessed from the welcoming entrance hall way. The rest of the property is made up by the kitchen/dining/living room which is completely open plan and also offers a Juliet balcony. There is also a media wall built in providing ample storage.

Externally there is dedicated off street parking for each apartment and a spacious outside space which houses six sheds one for each apartment.

Tenure: Leasehold, 122 years remaining.

Internal viewings are highly recommended.

Virtual tour available upon request.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*Virtual Viewing Available*

Located in the town centre of Orpington is this spacious two bedroom apartment presented in immaculate condition. Situated on the second floor of Atkins Lodge which is a modern development of apartments available to those over the age of 60.

This property comprises a welcoming entrance hallway with two large storage cupboards, two bright double bedrooms, the master with built in wardrobe. The lounge has double doors leading on to a private balcony offering views into Priory Gardens, which is a beautifully landscaped public garden and ponds.

The kitchen is located directly off the lounge and is fitted with a built in oven, hob, fridge and freezer. A shower room off the hall consists of a large walk-in corner shower, hand basin and WC.

Other benefits include; lift access, a 24 hour emergency call system, a door system allowing residents to speak to whoever is visiting before allowing them in to the building, communal lounge for social gatherings, communal laundry room and a communal garden area.

Orpington High Street is on the doorstep with an excellent selection of shops and restaurants and offers transport links through buses or there is Orpington Train Station which is 0.7 miles away, providing excellent services all around London and Kent.

Tenure: Leasehold / Years Remaining: Tbc / Service Charges: £3232.72 / Annum / Ground Rent: £750.00 / Annum
Energy Efficiency Rating: B

The Ridge is a much in demand road located within close proximity of local schools including Darrick Wood junior and seniors, Crofton primary, plus the selective schools of St. Olave's and Newstead Woods. The property is approximately half a mile from Orpington mainline station with a Charing Cross and Victoria line plus situated close to local amenities including Sparrows Wood and Tugmutton Common in Locksbottom. The property also sits relatively equidistant from Locksbottom Village, Petts Wood and Orpington High Street.
The property itself is a 1930 built three/ four bedroom semi-detached house with spacious accommodation. The ground floor comprises of a living room to front, dining room with attractive garden aspect, kitchen, cloakroom and study/ bedroom four. In our opinion all three bedrooms to the first floor are of a relatively good size, with all featuring built-in cupboards plus being served by a family bathroom suite. There is an attractive garden to rear with a patio area, 27ft long garage with utility area which perhaps could be converted to additional space subject to planning consents and substantial off-street parking to front.<br /><br />

address: Little Thrift, Petts Wood, Orpington BR5
detailedDescription:
Doorsteps are delighted to offer this 4 Bedroom Detached Family Home with a large Garden, Off Road Parking and Garage in a Prestigious Cul De Sac, near Petts Wood Station, reputable Schools, National Trust protected Green Spaces, and with the Great Restaurants & Cafes of vibrant Petts Wood Village.

Excellent transport links make it ideal for commuters with London Bridge only 22 minutes by train, and with Victoria, Cannon Street and Charing Cross all less than 40 minutes away, further benefitting from easy access to the M25 and the M20 motorways. Families will be drawn to the numerous nearby schools with Ofsted rating of “Good” to “outstanding”, as well as the tranquility and semi-rural environment of Petts Wood National Trust managed woodland. Thriving Petts Wood village is home to a number of excellent restaurants and cafes serving some of the finest food.

Brought to the market for the first time in more than 60 years, the property is in need of some modernisation, and is a rare opportunity to acquire a beautiful house and garden offering the discerning family the chance to make this your forever home.

Entrance Hall

Welcoming Entrance Hall leading Sitting Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, downstairs WC and Stairs to First Floor

Sitting Room

Spacious Sitting Room with plenty of light from large bay window overlooking front Garden, further benefitting from a feature Fireplace.

Dining Room

Spacious and bright Dining Room, with Sliding Doors leading out to the Patio and Rear Garden.

Downstairs WC

Modern WC and wash basin.

Kitchen

Fitted Kitchen with a range of base and wall mounted units with complimentary work surfaces. Door leading to Rear Garden and:

Storage Room

Walk-in Larder/Storage Room

Stairs to First Floor

Master Bedroom

Large Double Bedroom with large bay window to front, wash basin.

Bedroom 2

Good size Double Bedroom with window to rear overlooking Garden, built-in Cupboards, original electric feature Fireplace.

Bedroom 3

Good size Double Bedroom with double aspect windows to front and side, hand basin and built-in Wardrobe.

Bedroom 4

Bedroom with window to rear overlooking Garden.

Bathroom

Modern Family Bathroom, with Wash basin and Bath with shower over.
WC


WC with part tiles walls and window to side aspect.

Garage and workshop

Good sized Garage, with Workshop/workbench area.

Outside

Front

Part laid to lawn area and with Driveway with access to Garage, with Off Road Parking for two/three Vehicles, with useful side access to the rear Garden on both sides of property.

Rear

A large and very pretty fully enclosed Family Garden with Patio area closest to House, perfect for BBQs, eating al fresco and entertaining, a Greenhouse, and with the main area laid to Lawn surrounded with mature trees, bushes, shrubs.

A narrow wooded area to the rear of the garden (outlined in green on map picture No.20) has been leased and used by the current owners since the 1950's and it's anticipated, but not guaranteed that this arrangement may be transferrable to the next owner. (The rent payable for 2019/20 was £69.97 per annum).

This spacious, 3 bedroom chalet style semi detached is very conveniently located for local bus routes, Orpington Station and several highly regarded schools including Darrick Wood, Tubbenden, Warren Road and Newstead Wood.

The accommodation comprises living room with feature fireplace and dining room with double doors to the garden. Bedroom three is situated on the ground floor and also to the ground floor is a bathroom with white suite and separate cloakroom.

To the first floor, there are two generous double bedrooms and from the master bedroom there is access to a small nursery/study.

Outside, the rear garden has an area of decking and the remainder is laid to lawn. There is a single garage in the rear garden for storage purposes only and there is off road parking for one car.

detailedDescription:
Steeped in local history dating back to 1886, the St Augustines Mission Hall became St Augustines Church in 1910 and was converted into housing in 1978, giving rise to arguably the most uniquely appealing dwellings ever seen in Beckenham.

Set within this highly sought after development is this simply stunning 3 Bedroomed property, offering a fantastic opportunity to acquire a truly outstanding and awe inspiring residence with the original arch serving as a captivating focal point.

The accommodation occupies 4 floors of this magnificent building and in our opinion will appeal to an extensive range of buyers, such is the unparalleled charm and character featured throughout each floor.

For those with a need to commute the property is just a short walk from Clockhouse, Birkbeck and Elmers End Railway Stations with regular services to Central London and The West End via Charing Cross and The City via London Bridge and Cannon Street. Kent House Station is approximately 10 minutes walking distance and offers regular, direct services to London Victoria.

Avenue Road tramstop is similarly located with connections to East Croydon providing links to Gatwick Airport and the South Coast. The property is also within a short walk of the 194 / 227 / 358 and N3 bus routes. Beckenham Town Centre and Bromley Glades are within easy reach offering a comprehensive range of shopping, dining and recreational facilities including Churchfields Recreational Ground.

Locally, Beckenham Road offers a number of amenities including The Spa Leisure Centre, Tesco Metro and Sainsburys superstore whilst the Tesco superstore and South Norwood Country Park are just a short drive away offering a delightful greenspace of some 116 acres. The property is within the catchment area for Churchfields Primary School.

Externally, the property features a car park for residents accessed via a gated entrance with allocated parking, additionally with a pedestrian security gate. This property is westerly facing and offers a courtyard garden leading to the entrance lobby of the property, which features a Cloakroom with WC and space for a washing machine.

Internally, this property comes into its own as you enter into the hugely impressive and arched Living Area with beautiful hardwood floorboards and spiral staircase leading to the remaining floors. The ground floor also incorporates a well equipped Kitchen with a range of wall and base units plus storage area above accessed via pull down ladder. The first floor features a single bedroom with leaded windows to front and an in built wardrobe together with modern Bathroom incorporating a wall mounted shower unit, close coupled WC and wall mounted wash hand basin.

The second floor is occupied by the Master Bedroom featuring Velux double glazed window, the character laden eaves of the third floor feature a further Bedroom similarly with Velux double glazing.

The property also benefits from a Share of the Freehold, gas central heating and a security entry phone.

West Park is a popular spot and super close to Mottingham Station which is just 17 minutes into London Bridge. The green space of The Tarn, Eltham High St and Mottingham Village are also within a short walk.

detailedDescription:
Virtual tour available

Presented to the market is this truly impeccable example of a three bedroom terraced house on the sought after Hillcrest Road Bromley!

Internal space comprises of; Welcoming entrance hall leading into the sprawling open plan reception room complemented by a sleek bay window offering an abundance of natural light, the home is laid out in an open plan, yet practical style, with the 9’11 by 9’10 reception flowing through into the homes full width 16’5 by 7’8 dining room which offers direct access via French doors to the 60’ east facing garden. The kitchen has been extended to the rear adding more space and a new unique layout, the kitchen also offers access to the mature garden.

Heading upstairs you will find what was three well-proportioned bedrooms now merged into two to create and large walk in wardrobe for the master bedroom, but with very little work can be turned back into a third room, the master has wardrobes running the full way across the rear maximizing the space available, the second bedroom also measures in at a respectable 10’6 by 9’11, on this floor you will also find the modern family bathroom.

Further benefits include, double glazing, gas central heating, potential to extend to the loft and to the rear (subject to necessary planning consents) and a large 18’ by 9’6 detached garage that is also accessible from a through round leading to the back of the property.

Hillcrest Road is a picturesque and highly desirable street, extremely popular with families and city bound professionals due to the proximity to the station. It’s just 0.9 of a mile from Grove Park station (London Zone 4), which offers high speed direct trains into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Cannon Street & Charing Cross in as little as 13 minutes.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
This is a rare opportunity for you to purchase a unique 3 bedroom detached house in a semi-rural setting. Set in Scadbury Park with over 300 acres of beautiful countryside to explore, the location is tranquil and the house affords far reaching views of woodland and meadow.

The property has now been extended and refurbished to a high standard. The ground floor accommodation comprises a cosy lounge with log burner and a fabulous open plan kitchen/diner which is fitted with a range of modern wall and base units. There is also a cloakroom and utility room.

To the first floor there are three bedrooms, two with fitted wardrobes and an attractive family bathroom.

The plot is very large and gives a growing family plenty of space for out recreation. There are two large areas laid to lawn and ample off street parking.

In summary, a fabulous chain free home and your early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Greys Park Close is one of the most desirable roads within Keston Village. The property is located towards the end of the cul-de-sac and occupies a large corner position. A short walk away are the local post office, plus village shops and also the popular coffee shops of Daisy Grey and Heathfields plus Greyhound public house overlooking the village green at Commonside. The village offers many local semi-rural walks through the Three Commons and Nash and Greys Park is very close to the local ponds.
This is a very rare opportunity to purchase a substantial and very well presented three bedroom detached bungalow offering generous sized family accommodation including a 17ft x 12ft living room, large conservatory, kitchen/ breakfast room leading to utility and cloakroom. There is a master bedroom featuring a walk-in dressing room and en suite shower room. The two further bedrooms are served by a family bathroom suite. The property features a wide garden with driveway and detached garage to front. In our opinion the property offers substantial scope to extend and the vendors have planning permission to create two further bedrooms with en suites leading off. Viewing highly recommended.<br /><br />

This beautiful semi-detached house benefits from three bedrooms, a spacious living room opening to a well maintained, sunny back garden, a separate kitchen with integrated appliances, a family bathroom, a downstairs WC, and a driveway. It also benefits from solar panels.

title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered Chain Free is this spacious and well designed 1930's semi which is ideally located within the highly sought after Palace Estate, only a five minute walk from Bromley South station.

This fabulous family home offers generous proportions throughout and the scope to extend in the future if desired stp.

This well presented accommodation comprises of an entrance vestibule, hallway, cloakroom, a generous dining room with opening to a separate lounge and a kitchen/diner newly remodelled and refitted in 2018 with an excellent range of fitted units. Access into the garage is from the kitchen/diner.

Upstairs there are three double bedrooms and a modern bathroom refitted in 2016. There is off street parking for several cars to the front and to the rear is a very good sized garden.

The property is conveniently located for Bromley Town Centre. Amenities include Bromley South Station with services into London Victoria Station, the Glades Shopping centre (a three minute walk), a new cinema complex and new restaurants at St Marks Square, High Street shops and restaurants and a range of primary and secondary schools. Additionally, Bromley North Station is a ten minute walk away.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. Offering 1056 sq ft of living space the house is finished to high standard and has a modern feel to it throughout.

Upon entry there is an inviting hallway with a nice size living room to the front of the property. There is a second reception that is set up as a dining room to the rear as well as a modern fitted separate kitchen.

The rear garden is very well kept and is approximately 60 ft long and also has a private garage with rear access.

Back inside and upstairs you’ll find 2 double bedrooms and a single as well as a modern fitted bathroom.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This three double bedroom detached house sitting in a very sought after quiet cul de sac location, is offered to the market and is a superb opportunity to own a family home with lots of potential to extend. The house is located just 0.6 of a mile from Royal Parade and only a short walk from National Trust woodlands and backs onto open playing fields which provides a wonderful outlook.

Although the property needs some modernisation it is offered in a very well cared for and loved condition having been a very happy family home for a long time.

Entering into a lovely hallway there are doors to the through 'L' shaped lounge/dining room with a door to the kitchen/breakfast room, a study and then a downstairs cloakroom complete the ground floor accommodation.

To the first floor there are three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The master bedroom runs from front to back so the double aspect windows let in loads of light and also provides space to build an ensuite should you require it. Outside there is a detached tandem garage with a personal door to the kitchen via a covered area. A driveway to the front offers parking for several cars and there is also a large front garden and as well as a lovely large and private garden to the rear.

The time has now come for another family to appreciate the location and the potential for extension. Other properties in the road have already extended, so a precedent has already been set. Viewing is essential to appreciate the essence of this house.

London Borough of Bromley - Council Tax Band G - £2,819.20

detailedDescription:
An attractive four bedroom terraced house arranged over three floors offering spacious and modern accommodation. The property has been refurbished by the current owners to provide a stylish home in a popular location between Bromley North and Sundridge Park.

The property has a light and spacious open plan living/dining room featuring wood floors and a woodburner and double doors to the rear garden. Off the hallway with a continuation of the wood flooring, is a downstairs WC.

To the rear of the property is an extended kitchen that provides a fully fitted kitchen with a breakfast bar and a further seating area currently used as a family/garden room perfectly situated to enjoy the large garden beyond. The kitchen itself is fitted with a full range of modern grey gloss units with integrated appliances complimented by highly polished floor tiles.

To the first floor is a generous sized bathroom fitted with a free standing bath, large washbasin with drawer storage below, WC and a separate walk in shower.

The master bedroom spans the full width of this floor providing a luxurious space as a master bedroom. Bedroom four which is also a double room is also on this floor.

To the top floor are a further two spacious double bedrooms providing ample family or guest bedroom accommodation.

To the rear of the property is a large well maintained garden with lawn and seating areas and planting borders. There is also a shed for storage.

The property is conveniently located for both Bromley North Village and Sundridge Park Village and is in close proximity to Bromley High Street as well as being convenient for both Bromley North & Bromley South Stations with fast services into London. Sundridge Park Village offers a range of local boutique shops and restaurants with access of a number of highly regarded schools as well as Sundridge Park Golf Club and Sundridge Park Tennis and Squash Club.

detailedDescription:

Forming part of this highly regarded age-restricted retirement development, we are delighted to offer for sale this attractive and beautifully presented top floor one double bedroom retirement apartment, which benefits from being at the rear of the block and with a private balcony overlooking the landscaped communal gardens.

The property comprises an entrance hall, a spacious fitted wood kitchen suite, a generous living room with a double glazed sliding patio door opening to the balcony, a double bedroom with large built-in wardrobes, and a modern bathroom with a walk-in shower enclosure.

The property is tastefully decorated in cream emulsion and with neutral cream coloured carpets throughout.

Other benefits include the communal facilities, such as large communal gardens, residents communal areas, etc.

Challoner Court is conveniently located for ease of access into Bromley and Beckenham town centres, and Shortland station is just a short walk from the development with rail services to Victoria and City. There are also good public transport facilities close by.

The vendors are in the process of extending the lease to 155 years.

Entrance Hall

White painted front door, cream carpet, cream emulsion painted walls, heating programmer and heating thermostat, airing/storage cupboard, ceiling light fitting, loft hatch, coving to ceiling.

Tiled floor, metal and glass railing, overlooking attractive rear communal gardens.

White painted panelled door, cream carpet, cream emulsion painted walls, picture rail and coving, built in wardrobes with mirrored doors and hanging and shelving storage, double glazed window, radiator, ceiling light fitting.

White painted panelled door, vinyl floor covering, part tiled walls, white vanity unit with integrated wash basin and concealed cistern WC, towel rail radiator, wall mirror, walk-in shower enclosure with wall integrated shower mixer, ceiling light fitting, extractor fan.

Current Length of Lease - 99 years from September 1986 (65 years remaining). The vendor is in the process of extending a further 90 years onto the existing lease to make it 155 years.

Detailed Description

Attractive double bay fronted detached bungalow with exquisite panaramic views. This remarkable home is situated in a semi-rural location, yet lies within a very few minutes' drive of shops and leisure facilities in Green Street Green and Orpington High Streets. Local golf clubs, equestrian clubs and local and National transport links are also close by. The property has been extended to the rear and into the garage to provide spacious accommodation which will impress any descending buyer. The property provides an L shaped lounge dining room with truly amazing views, with a door opening onto a study which can also be utilised as a fourth bedroom, 3 double bedrooms, a very spacious fitted kitchen and a decent size fitted bathroom. The rear garden is a paradise with views of Kentish Countryside from an extensive decking area and a traditional lawn a few steps down. To the front of the property there is an attractive garden and extensive off street parking. The property is double glazed and centrally heated and is offered onto the market in good condition throughout. The size and location of this stunning bungalow deserves your urgent attention.

Master Bedroom: 16'4" into bay x 10'10" (4.98m into bay x 3.30m), Double glazed bay window to front, curved radiator into bay window, laminated wood flooring.

Study/Bedroom 4: 10'10" x 7'2" (3.29m x 2.19m), Double glazed window to rear, double glazed doors to rear.

In our opinion this is a superb property and should be viewed at your earliest convenience.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are proud to present this beautiful three bedroom terraced house on a quiet residential road which falls within the catchment of excellent local schools.

The property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway, living room through lounge onto a spacious dining room and a downstairs wc. To the rear, there is a modern and fully fitted kitchen leading onto a rear dining area and direct access to the low maintenance rear garden. Upstairs, there are three good sized rooms and a large family sized bathroom. There is access to the loft which provides the potential to extend (STPP). The property is beaming with light and airiness and contains off street parking.

The property benefits from a south-facing garden and three large double bedrooms.

The property is conveniently located within walking distance to Bromley South Station as well as Bickley Station. There are also excellent schools nearby and a vast array of local amenities with Bromley Town Centre a short walk away.

address: Avenue Court, Avenue Road, Penge SE20
detailedDescription:
Perfectly located for the convenience of both Kent House and Clock House stations giving flexible access into Central London is this superb bright and airy two double bedroom third-floor apartment.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
** guide price £415,000-£430,000 ** virtual tour available

Unveiled to the market is the truly stunning and one of a kind two bedroom, two bathroom ground floor modern build flat with two sets of private outside space!

Sure to garner some serious attraction is this truly unique and spectacular apartment located on a quiet leafy road in Bromley with five train stations all located within less than 1 mile, Ravensbourne (0.3 Miles), Shortlands and Beckenham Hill (0.7 Miles), Bromley North station and Sundridge Park (0.9 Miles).

Internal space comprises; airy entrance hall with two sets of storage adding a dash of practicality, leading round to the rear of the property you will find the homes open plan style kitchen/reception room measuring in at 17’5 by 15’3, the kitchen has integrated appliances and follows the trend through the whole property of a slick light matte grey colour scheme. To the front of the reception room you have the first of two private patio areas, to the rear of the property you have the master bedroom measuring in at 16’ by 9’7 which benefits from built in wardrobes and a modern shower en suite, the master bedroom also offers access to the easterly facing 27’ by 13’1 private terrace which also offers access to the rear communal grounds, the second bedroom measuring in at 11’2 by 9’10 and also benefiting direct access to the rear terrace. Finally at the beginning of the entrance hall you will find the homes bespoke and ultra-modern four piece family sized bathroom with a free standing bath.

Further benefits include allocated parking, two private outside spaces and communal grounds, double glazing, gas central heating.

Located within 0.3miles from Ravensbourne and 0.7 Miles Shortlands stations providing excellent links directly into central London and within catchment for the highly regarded Parish C of E primary school. The property is also located within walking distance to Beckenham Place Park.

Lease 121 Years | Ground Rent £300 Per Annum | Service Charge £1500 Per Annum | Energy Efficiency Rating B.

detailedDescription:
Positioned in a quiet cul de sac in one of Chislehurst's premier locations is this beautifully presented five bedroom detached house.

Internally the property has been kept to a high standard by the current owners and the spacious and versatile accommodation comprises large entrance hall with WC, stunning 32' reception room with gas fire and parquet flooring, dining room, snug/study, 15'6 kitchen/breakfast room with integrated appliances, utility room and access to the double garage.

To the first floor there is a master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and an en-suite bathroom, further two double bedrooms, two large single/small double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Bedrooms two, three and four all benefit from built in storage.

Externally there is a well-kept rear garden with a large patio area perfect for summer BBQs, laid to lawn area and borders with mature shrubs and plants. To the front there is off street parking for two cars and access to the garage.

Further benefits include plenty of windows allowing ample light, electric car charger, gas central heating and double glazing.

The location is quite simply superb. Pickwick Way can be found just off Kemnal Road which features many fine and substantial homes. Chislehurst train station is easily accessible and offers regular services into Lewisham (for DLR), Central London and The City. Chislehurst High Street is just a short walk away via a footpath off Kemnal Road and many of the area's finest state and private schools are nearby including Farringtons, Bullers Wood, Coopers, Mead Road and St Nicholas.

In our opinion this truly is a fine property and should be viewed at your earliest opportunity.

detailedDescription:
Key features:

Main Description
Beautiful refurbished Grade II listed home, sympathetically updated yet retaining character features including exposed beams, fireplaces and stained glass leaded light windows. Larger room proportions than you might expect from a property which dates back in part to the 15th Century, there is an impressive through living room having quaint bay overlooking the rear garden, kitchen/breakfast room with integrated appliances and stable door to private courtyard, plus snug/study with feature Inglenook having original bread oven. Four generous double bedrooms to the first floor with shower room off the landing and superb en suite bathroom. Gated access to allocated parking space.

Location
Conveniently located for the popular shops on Wickham Road providing a chemist, newsagent, French delicatessen, coffee shop, wine merchant with post office, convenience store and bakers. Before the shops is an entrance to Kelsey Park providing an attractive walk to Beckenham High Street, about three quarters of a mile away. From Beckenham Junction there are trains to London Victoria and, at peak times, The City as well as trams to Croydon and Wimbledon. Bus route 162 runs along Wickham Road for Beckenham and Bromley.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
**project** **cash buyers only**

Take a look at this great sized two bedroom semi detached home ready and waiting for you to put your own stamp on.

To the ground floor this home has a lounge/dining room and kitchen. To the first floor you have two great sized double bedrooms with the main one having its own en-suite shower room and there is also a separate family bathroom. Externally this home offers off street parking to the front and a garden to the rear.

Orpington has a thriving town centre less than a mile away and therefore ideally situated for access to the motorway network and the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. The nearest station, St. Mary Cray, with a direct line to London Victoria is just two thirds of a mile away. The town centre has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. You will find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way under half a mile away. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.

title: 2 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market a five bedroom home of substantial size with versatile living accommodation.

This home is set on a popular road within 0.8 of a mile of Elmstead Woods Station and just 0.7 of a mile in the other direction to Chislehurst High Street, being close to amenities makes this house great for a growing family. Good schools are close by including the popular Babington School and Bullers Wood, if you are a golfer you are blessed with not just one but two golf courses.

Entering into a bright welcoming hallway with galleried landing above you turn right into the kitchen breakfast room, which is beautifully presented with lots of wall and base units and a central island. This in turn opens to a family room with vaulted ceiling, perfect for the family to be close by whilst you are in the kitchen.
If you are working from home the study is a good size and overlooking the front garden making a pleasant space for all your Zoom meetings.

The dining room has a double height ceiling and French doors opening into the garden, steps up lead into the lounge.
In the lounge is a feature brick built fireplace making this room have a cosy feel. You find from here a small hallway with a door to an annexe, this space can be used as a continuation of the main house or used as a separate one/two bed to accommodate guests or as a rental as it has a kitchen, bathroom and its own front door.

To the first floor of the main house you will find four double bedrooms all with ensuite bathrooms.

Outside there is a driveway with parking for several cars leading to a double garage and there is a landscaped front garden. To the rear the garden is tiered and has a great patio area, it is a sunny spot, there are steps down to an area that can be used as further parking if needed.

Viewing is essential to understand the essence of this house.

detailedDescription:
Superbly located for Chislehurst High Street and popular local schools is this well presented and extended four bedroom semi-detached house.

Internally the property is beautifully presented throughout and accommodation comprises entrance hall with W.C, lounge with bay window and fireplace, extended modern kitchen diner with integrated appliances and a further 'bonus room' which could easily be used as a playroom, study or gym. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms, single bedroom and a well fitted family bathroom and on the second floor is a wonderful main bedroom with en-suite shower room and access to eaves storage.

Externally there is a well maintained 84' rear garden with a large patio which is perfect for summer BBQs and a large laid to lawn area. To the front there is off street parking.

The location is quite simply outstanding with Chislehurst Street and it's many boutique shops, restaurants, coffee bars and the beautiful Chislehurst Commons and ponds just a short walk away. Many of the area's finest schools are also nearby including Red Hill, Mead Road and Edgebury as well the Chislehurst Recreation Ground which is just at the end of the road. Elmstead Woods br is within easy reach and offers regular services into Lewisham (for DLR), Central London and The City. In our opinion this is a superb family home and should be viewed at your earliest convenience.

A generous three bedroom split-level maisonette located in a quiet corner of St. Mary's Green, Biggin Hill, TN16. The property which is centrally located in the town benefits from two double bedrooms, a further sizable single bedroom, a large reception room with access onto the private patio and onto the communal garden, a fitted kitchen, family bathroom, on road parking and a garage en-bloc. Call us now for more information, we are *Open 8am - 8pm 7 Days a Week*

Situation

The property is situated on St. Mary's Green, Biggin Hill and is within walking distance to local shops, restaurants and amenities. There are a variety of bus routes locally and the motorway network can accessed nearby at junctions 5 & 6 of the M25, a ten minute drive away. The rail network can be accessed nearby at either Hayes or Bromley Railway Stations. The town of Oxted lies a short drive away as do the larger town centres of Bromley & Sevenoaks

Entrance Hall

Entered through UPVC front door with tiled flooring, a radiator, a large under stair cupboard, access to the kitchen, living room and first floor via a carpeted staircase

Kitchen (9'11" x 9'11", 3.02m x 3.02m)

The kitchen with tiled floor, a range of wall and base units, tiled splash-backs, roll edge worktops, a four ring gas hob with overhead extractor, an electric oven, a deep stainless steel sink, an integrated fridge/freezer, space for under counter white goods and two double glazed windows

Sitting/Dining Room (21'8" x 14'8", 6.6m x 4.47m)

A sizeable room with carpeted flooring, two radiators, coving to the ceiling, a rear facing double glazed windows, space for a dining set and French doors opening onto the rear garden

Bedroom One (11'1" x 11'1", 3.38m x 3.38m)

Primary double bedroom with a large rear facing double glazed window, a radiator and carpeted flooring

Bedroom Two (11'0" x 10'6", 3.35m x 3.2m)

Second double bedroom with a large rear facing double glazed window, a radiator and carpeted flooring

Bathroom

Family bathroom with lino flooring, an encased bathtub with shower extension, half tiling, a hand basin with mixer taps & vanity unit below and a radiator

Cloakroom

Separate cloakroom with frosted double glazed window, dado rails, a low level flush, W/C and lino flooring

Garage (17'0" x 8'4", 5.18m x 2.54m)

Garage en-bloc with an up-and-over door and a newly installed felt roof

Outside

The property is approached via a paved pathway with sweeps through the communal front lawn area which is lead from the parking area/garages.

To the rear is a private garden with bricked border and a gate providing side access. There is also a communal raised garden

Leasehold.

Mains services

Council tax band: C

Ground rent : £120 p/a approximately

The current vendors are in the process of extending their current lease. The property will be sold with a new lease with 99 years remaining

detailedDescription:
A well presented two double bedroom ground floor purpose built apartment, conveniently situated only 0.3 miles from Shortlands train station and less than one mile from Beckenham Junction station & Tram stop.

This bright & spacious property benefits from a share of freehold, direct access onto the large communal lawns, a private garage en-bloc, an allocated parking bay and forms one of only four apartments in this well kept development.

The accommodation comprises master bedroom with built in floor to ceiling wardrobe, second double bedroom, a stylish four piece bathroom suite with separate shower cubicle, a recently fitted contemporary kitchen and a large lounge/dining room with double doors opening onto the communal lawns.

Furthermore, this property is favorably positioned between both Bromley and Beckenham town centres which offer a wide variety of small cafes, coffee shops and boutiques, through to the large retail stores. In our opinion this property would make an ideal first time buy, or for those down sizing from a larger home.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located in a sought after position just off Royal Parade and offering beautiful views over the common is this stunning three bedroom period cottage.

The property has been cleverly extended and undergone an extensive program of refurbishment over recent years and the current owners have spared no expense in creating this truly magnificent home. Accommodation comprises stunning 50' open plan kitchen/reception room with high spec kitchen with fitted appliances and bi fold doors leading to the courtyard and a downstairs WC/utility room. To the first floor there is a master bedroom with en-suite shower room, further two double bedrooms and a family bathroom.

To the front there is a charming secluded courtyard garden which is perfect for summer BBQs and enjoying a glass of wine (or two!) whilst enjoying the views over the common.
Further benefits include hardwood flooring throughout the ground floor, shutters to most windows and gas central heating.

The location is quite simply superb and you really do get the feel of village lifestyle with Royal Parade just around the corner and offering a vast array of popular restaurants, boutique shops and the Bulls Head pub. Chislehurst station is one mile away and offers regular services into Lewisham (for DLR), Central London and The City.

In our opinion this is a lovely home and should be viewed to be fully appreciated.

The flat has under floor heating throughout and has high end finishes such as wooden herringbone flooring and solid wooden doors.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented detached house spanning over an impressive 3548 sq ft with Elmstead Woods br and Chislehurst High Street just a short walk away.

This lovely home offers fantastic kerb appeal and is set back nicely from the road behind electric gates. Internally the spacious and versatile accommodation is perfect for those who love to entertain and comprises large entrance hall with WC, large dining room, 34'4 reception room and a stunning kitchen with integrated appliances.

To the first floor the master bedroom has a real wow factor and benefits from fitted wardrobes and a stunning en suite bathroom with walk in shower, his and her sinks and a stand-alone bath. Bedroom two also has the use of a well fitted en-suite whilst the family bathroom services the remaining three double bedrooms.

The annexe comprises of a 21'8 reception room, study (both centrally heated) and utility room. This is a fantastic space and, whilst it is currently being used as a play room, could easily be converted into a gym, self-contained studio or an office. The south facing garden measures approximately 100ft and is well kept. Whilst being mainly laid to lawn there are also two patios which are ideal for BBQs.

The property is ideally located being only 0.7 miles to Elmstead Woods br and only 0.6 miles to Chislehurst High Street. Many of the areas finest schools are also nearby, including the popular Bullers Wood School for girls, making this an ideal family home.

title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

Situated in a quiet residential road is this spacious, three bedroom mid terraced house presented in very good condition throughout and is located just a short distance from Mottingham Train Station and plenty of local amenities. Internally the property briefly comprises of a spacious lounge with feature fireplace, modern bathroom, a modern fitted kitchen. To the first floor are three spacious bedrooms, the master having the added benefit of a built in wardrobe and the third can be either a single room or a study for those that work from home. Additional bonus of a spacious landscaped garden which is mainly laid to lawn. The front has the potential for off street parking

Located close to various local amenities as well as a number of bus links towards Bromley, Greenwich, Woolwich and Catford. Mottingham Station is approximately 0.6m away and offers frequent trains into London Charing Cross and Cannon Street via Lewisham, London Bridge. detailedDescription:
Jdm are delighted to offer to the market this beautiful one double bedroom apartment comprising an open plan living/kitchen/dining area with bespoke shaker style units, stone worktops and a range of integrated Siemens appliances. The stylish bathroom offers both bath and shower facilities with sanitaryware from Villeroy & Boch. The flooring is a mix of engineered oak to the living area, luxurious tufted cut pile carpets to the bedrooms and porcelain tiles to the bathroom.

This apartment has been meticulously restored and designed, providing sophisticated and luxurious interiors, perfectly complementing the outstanding grounds surrounding them.

Further benefits include; underfloor heating, intruder alarm, BT television, underground parking and double glazed windows with fitted white shutters in keeping with the original design.

The Grade II listed Cottage at Sundridge Park is set within a sweeping landscape of sculptured gardens and woodland walks setting of almost 300 acres. A proportion of the acreage is occupied by the acclaimed 36-hole Sundridge Park Golf Club. Established in 1901, the club boasts two championship-quality courses hosting many open competitions including the prestigious Waterford Trophy. The East, par 71 course provides for a testing but fair game, whilst the par 69 West course has its own unique character and offers a more challenging experience. The traditional clubhouse commands panoramic views of some of London's best known landmarks.

Located close to Sundridge Park and Elmstead Woods stations providing services to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Canon Street. Canary Wharf is less than 10 miles away and Junction 5 of the M25 is accessed via the A21.

Ground Rent: £250 per annum
