detailedDescription:
Located in core Beckenham only moments from the High street and within close reach of Beckenham Junction and Clock House train and tram stations is this beautiful, imposing detached family home.

This immaculate and spacious home offers over 1560sq ft of accommodation which briefly comprises of an entrance porch, impressive reception hallway, refitted cloakroom/w.c., there is a very generous lounge through diner with bay window to front and doors leading to a refurbished conservatory.
Additionally on this floor you have a good size breakfast room and a fully refitted kitchen with an excellent range of units and integrated appliances. There there is an integrated garage which doubles as a utility room with dishwasher, plumbing for washing machine plus additional storage space and the new Combi boiler is also located here.
Upstairs you will be welcomed by a generous landing and access to three double bedrooms and finally a luxurious bathroom with luxury spa shower and bath.
The property has been fully renovated and recently redecorated both inside and out and briefly incudes an adt alarm and CCTV system, a new water softener system, new plumbing, boiler and upgraded electrics. There is also double glazing throughout.

Externally to the front is a lovely garden and driveway for upto four cars. To the rear is an attractive well stocked garden with lawn and patio, there is outdoor electrics, water and storage and a shed.

Beckenham is a great town, which especially appeals to young families and professionals who appreciate the boutique shops, cafes, green spaces and parks which are all in abundance. Transport links direct into London Bridge, Victoria and Croydon also make this an excellent commuting location and there are some of the most highly sought after schools in close proximity.

Viewings are considered essential in order to fully appreciate the accommodation on offer, view now to avoid disappointment.

detailedDescription:
A brilliant three double bedroom purpose-built apartment with its own balcony and communal gardens. The property is offered to the market in good condition and benefits from having a residents communal car park. Situated just a 5-minute walk from Anerley train station and a stone's throw from Betts Park. (Estimated walking times supplied by Google Maps)

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic two double bedroom modern apartment with its own balcony and allocated parking space. The property has a contemporary open plan fitted kitchen/reception room, two stylish bathroom suites, beautiful views of the communal grounds from the top floor and maintains a bright and airy feel throughout. This is an ideal first-time buy or investment.

This property is superbly located for Anerley High Street as well being a stones throw away from the ever so popular Crystal Palace triangle with an array of shops, restaurants and bars. For commuters, being a 0.3 mile walk from Anerley station and a 0.7 mile walk from Crystal Palace station gives flexible access into Central London (Distances estimated by Google Maps).

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.
The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.
Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.
Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Yopa Online Auction Starting Bids from £750,000. Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Yopa Online Auctions for more information.

Yopa Online Auctions is a new, innovative and pioneering platform for buying and selling property. Open to both cash and mortgage buyers. It provides all the benefits synonymous with traditional auctions, including: Speed and certainty of sale, transparency and zero risk of gazumping or double-selling but with the added advantage of being able to bid pressure-free from the comfort of your own home or office via desktop, tablet or mobile phone. Yopa also offer a Buy-it-Now feature which allows you to place an offer and purchase before the Auction end date.

If you request a viewing of this property or make an offer, then you agree that your personal information (name and contact details) will be shared with goto Auctions (Yopa’s Online Auction partner) to enable them to ensure that you understand the auction process.

To book a viewing visit Yopa.

EPC band: D

This outstanding five bedroom double fronted Victorian property with potential to modernisation however, it has retained much of the original character of its era, so when complete it will become a sensational family home. Boasting 2181 sqft of spacious accommodation, high skirting boards, and ceilings, tall windows, French doors leading to the garden, three floors, a basement and loft you can stand up in, great for storage or redevelopment. This home has an expanse of space. This typical Victorian property has three large reception rooms, ideal for a growing family and entertaining. The hallway is the first place a person to see, this space encaptures the stunning interior of this home, the grand staircase takes you to the first and second floor which benefits from four double bedrooms, a large laundry room, and a family bathroom, plus a separate w.c. Well-established front and back garden Due to the size of the property, It can be converted into individual flats subject to (STPP). Across the road from the ever-popular Betts Park, 10 min walks to Anerley station and Birkbeck tram, short distance to Norwood Junction, Penge East, and West Stations. This home has everything to offer in location as well as sought after schools for all ages. Offered without a forward chain allowing the potential buyer to move swiftly.

Auctioneer's Comments:

This property is for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract are issued by the seller’s solicitor. By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, means normal residential finance can be sort.

The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on

this must be sought from your legal representative. The buyer will be required to sign a Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Info Pack which can be downloaded for free from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyers Premium of £9,000 including VAT plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £9,354. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Hayes is a modern suburban area nestled between Bromley, West Wickham and Coney Hall with excellent transport links into Central London from Hayes Station. Station Approach is a bustling haven of coffee shops, mini supermarkets, restaurants, as well as a post office, with further smaller shops in Old Hayes; the old village area on Hayes Street. There are several green spaces to enjoy and the town boasts a number of ofsted highly rated primary and secondary schools.

detailedDescription:
Edelweiss is an imposing family residence of some 7782 Sq Ft, set within an idyllic semi rural location on the outskirts of south east Orpington in the sought after Chelsfield Park, just a short distance from the A21 Sevenoaks Road giving access to the M25 Junction 4, within a couple of miles.

For those seeking privacy, Edelweiss is a perfect choice, set within a secluded position on Chelsfield Hill but equally located for amenities including Chelsfield Lakes golf course and local transport links. Chelsfield and Knockholt Railway Stations serve the area with rail services to Central London via Charing Cross and The City via London Bridge. Chelsfield Park, has a wide variety of local shops along Windsor Drive with Bluewater and Bromley Town Centre a short drive away offering a comprehensive range of shopping.

Edelweiss, with a private gated entrance offers all of the trappings of a contemporary lifestyle with an integral 42’ x 22’ Poolhouse, extensive garden to the rear with floodlit Tennis Court, Gymnasium and Cinema Room and is ideally suited to the growing family or for those who regularly entertain family and friends.This delightful Detached residence offers 6/7 Bedroom Suites and is set over 3 floors with access to a suntrapped terrace overlooking the rear garden from the Master Suite on the first floor.

This floor also incorporates a 31’ x 18’ Games Room. The 21’ x 19’ Cinema Room is located on the 2nd floor adjacent to a Bedroom / Art or work studio.The extensive ground floor is accessed via a beautifully tiled Reception Hall with oak stairwell and features 2 delightful Reception Rooms to the rear with direct access to the rear garden together with a spacious Dining Room to the front of the property. An Office / Study is also located on this floor together with a Stoneham fitted Kitchen with Breakfast area.

Aside from the integral Double Garage, Utility and Plant room, the Poolhouse with separate Changing Room, serves as a relaxing and luxurious focal point, leading to the Gymnasium featuring an extensive range of exercise and fitness machines. With an extensive timber decked patio across the rear of the property, panoramic views can be enjoyed of the lawn and greenspace beyond. To the front of the property there is ample space for a number of vehicles.

It is strongly recommended that all genuine purchasers take advantage of our pledge to offer you a personal guided tour of this exceptional family home in order to highlight all of the features included in the sale price.

detailedDescription:

The accommodation on offer comprises: Entrance hallway, dual aspect lounge/dining room, large kitchen/breakfast room perfect for entertaining, utility room and a WC to the ground floor. To the first floor there is a landing providing access to three bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. Externally there is a very well kept low maintenance rear garden with a decked area perfect for alfresco dining, garage (storage only) and off street parking to the front. Homesdale Road is well located for easy access to Petts Wood stations, bus routes, local shops and local schools. Please call Thomas Brown Estate Agents in Orpington to arrange a viewing to fully appreciate the location and specification on offer.

Four bedroom detached house in a very convenient location for schools and just 0.4 of a mile from Elmstead Woods station. Scotts Park Primary is 0.7 of a mile and Bullers Wood Secondary school for girls half a mile. The new boys school is 0.8 of a mile.

A stunning two double bedroom garden maisonette period conversion with wonderful large private landscaped garden, enviably situated in a sought after Chislehurst location. Langford Russell are delighted to offer to the market, this two bedroom split level apartment.

The ground floor comprises of an entrance hall with front door and stairs leading to first floor landing, the accommodation comprises; a spacious reception room, bedroom, fully fitted kitchen with extractor, gas hob and oven. This floor is completed with a three piece family bathroom.

On the second floor you will find the master bedroom which benefits from an en-suite shower room and ample eaves storage.

Birkbeck Road is a popular tree lined road located on the Clock House side of Beckenham. The property is well positioned for several good train stations including Clock House, offering connections to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street and also Kent House with regular services to Victoria. The property is also within the catchment for several good schools including Alexandra and Stewart Fleming Primary schools making this house the perfect family home.

Ground Rent: £75.00 pa

detailedDescription:
Offering over 1300 sq ft of stunning accommodation and located within easy reach of several highly regarded schools is this superb four bedroom family home.

The extended accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hallway, lounge with feature cast iron fireplace, a dining room with bifold doors leading to the decked garden area, and a refitted kitchen was completed in June 2020 completes the ground floor space.
On the first floor are three bedrooms and a modern bathroom and the loft conversion which creates a master bedroom and en suite which was completed in November 2019 on the top floor.

Externally to the front is an off street parking area and to the rear, the garden including artficial lawn (installed July 2020) has a decked alfresco dining area and there is a paved patio and BBQ at the top of the garden. There is also a brick built outhouse.

Located in an exceptionally quiet, friendly and supportive neighbourhood, close to Bromley Glades mall and plenty of nearby shops and amenities. Easily accessible to Transport Links including a great bus service and Bromley North and South stations as well as Bickley and Elmstead Woods being within easy reach.

detailedDescription:

Full walkthrough video viewing available - please ring to request the link - nb This is not the brief slide show clip shown on the web.

Situated at the rear of the block this property has a southerly aspect overlooking the communal gardens but even better it has it's own door opening out to the rear from the open plan living room/ kitchen. There is a bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a shower room, walk in storage cupboard to the hall, double glazing, electric heaters and a garage en bloc. This would make an ideal purchase for a First Time Buyer or possibly a downsizer wanting to have access to a garden without the responsibility for looking after it.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £900,000 - £925,000

Beautifully presented and significantly extended five bedroom detached family home with off street parking, garage and delightful large private garden with extending awning over patio. Offering extensive, bright and spacious accommodation with modern interiors throughout, the property enjoys excellent family living space, including a superb kitchen/family room with bi-folding doors onto the garden as well as a large L-shaped formal reception room. Further features include a useful separate utility room, two modern first floor bath/shower rooms, ground floor WC, gas central heating, double glazing, ample inbuilt storage and quality floor coverings.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with wood flooring (evident throughout the ground floor), access to guest WC and stairs rising to the first floor, leading into the bright and spacious front aspect reception room with attractive bay window and wonderful space for relaxing and entertaining. To the rear of the property, the beautiful open plan kitchen/family room is flooded with natural light from skylight windows and bi-folding doors onto the mature private garden. The kitchen area itself comprises a high quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and central island/breakfast bar incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances. A separate utility room offers door to the garden and further appliance/work space. To the first floor, there are five well proportioned bedrooms, plus a family bathroom with bath and separate shower unit, and a further separate modern shower room.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Chelsfield station providing good connections into Central London and to the surrounding area. There are a selection of local shops and amenities nearby, as well as access to lovely surrounding open spaces and excellent local schools. The nearby A21/M25 also provides excellent vehicular access. Just a short distance away, Orpington provides further rail links, as well as an array of shops, cafes, bars, restaurants and amenities including an Odeon cinema, leisure centre and useful supermarkets.

address: Wood Way, Farnborough Park, Kent BR6
detailedDescription:
Positioned in a popular turning on the ever popular gated private estate Farnborough Park, we are delighted to offer for sale Brambles a five bedroom 1930s built house completely rebuilt and remodelled by the current owners to a high specification throughout.

With accommodation of just under 5,000 sq ft., the finish exudes quality with bespoke joinery found to nearly all rooms.

A magnificent entrance hall provides direct access to four principle reception rooms and a bespoke Maple with granite kitchen breakfast room that features a central island unit with matching breakfast table, atrium and access to a relaxing sun room on the side.

The first floor offers six beautifully appointed bedrooms four with quality fitted furniture in either walnut or Maple. The bathrooms of which there are four again are of the highest standard with high quality sanitaryware and furniture.

The property has character elevations, Oak framed glazing and is positioned at the end of this popular road Brambles sits on a good sized plot with South aspect rear garden and heated Pool.

Wood Way is situated within minutes’ walk of Locksbottom Village with its excellent amenities that include some first class restaurants and access to Orpington and Bromley mainline stations. The property also falls within the popular Darrick Wood School catchment area.<br /><br />

address: Bowden Court, 3 Whitehorse Hill, Chislehurst BR7
detailedDescription:
Overview

Hunters are delighted to offer to the market this stunning two bedroom second floor apartment built in 2017 with 10 year crl warranty. Bowden Court is situated above the Co-op shop (built in 2018) and ideally located 0.3 miles from Chislehurst high street with it's shops, restaurants, bars, commons and pond. There are bus routes outside the apartment with Elmstead Woods station (zone 4) 1.3 miles away and New Eltham station (zone 4) 1.5 miles away.

Bowden Court is accessed by a communal entrance with stairs leading to the second floor. The apartment has an entrance hall with doors leading to all rooms. There is a storage cupboard in the entrance hall. The kitchen is fitted with a range of modern wall and base high gloss units, four ring gas hob with extractor hood over, built in oven and in-fridge/ freezer, washing machine and dishwasher, stainless steel sink drainer with mixer tap and cupboard housing the boiler. The lounge is dual aspect with wood laminate flooring. There are two bedrooms and bedroom one has built-in wardrobes. The bathroom has Porcelanosa wall and floor tiles, white suite bath, hand wash basin and low level w.c. And chrome heated towel rail. Outside there is a private gated car park to the rear of Bowden Court with one allocated parking space. The property benefits from an intercom security system. EPC Rating B.

detailedDescription:
** guide price £300,000-£325,000 ** virtual tour available

An incredibly sought after third floor three bedroom apartment with allocated parking. Benefiting with space throughout and Juliet balcony as well as lift access, this gorgeous apartment would be ideal for any buyers looking for a ‘move in & feet up’ purchase. Immaculately maintained, it would be perfect as a buy-to-let investment or for a couple/city worker looking to take advantage of the various local conveniences & speedy commute.

The spacious layout of the apartment has been well planned and all rooms come off a spacious hallway. The lounge/dining room has wall to ceiling windows and a full width Juliet balcony. There are two double bedrooms, the third is a generous single sized room all with pleasant views and a fantastic family sized bathroom.

Internally the habitable rooms are extremely generous and all come off a long entrance hall. Two of the three bedrooms are doubles, the third perfect for a single bedroom or alternatively office space, opposite you will find the bathroom suite which is well proportioned, the modern kitchen is extremely well maintained and opens onto the lounge which is larger than the average with a broad Juliet balcony to the side of the building.

Other benefits include gas central heating, double-glazing throughout, allocated parking & ample storage.

On Burnt Ash Lane itself, the property is well served for amenities, boasts numerous buses, good local schools, is only 0.8 of a mile from the highly convenient Zone 4 Grove Park station, just 0.2 of a mile from Kings Meadows Playing Fields and the excellent parade of independent local business’ – including an excellent family butchers and various convenience stores. Grove Park Railway station is one of the most versatile this side of the borough, with direct links into London Bridge, Charing Cross, Waterloo East & Cannon Street in as little as 14 minutes. Experienced golfers or enthusiastic beginners will be pleased to know you’d also be moments from the luxury Sundridge Park Golf Club boasting over 110 years history and two first class championship courses.

detailedDescription:
The original part of ‘The Stables’ dates back to the 1800’s and has plenty of characterful features. You enter via a large lobby into the spacious main reception room. This room has impressive leaded windows and French doors out to the patio with views down the garden. To the right is a further reception room with an original fireplace, wood flooring that runs through from the main reception and French doors out to the patio. A door in the corner takes you through to the large double length integral garage and to a staircase that brings you up to two double bedroom, both with en-suites and built in wardrobes.

The stylish kitchen is found on the other side of the house and also has access to the patio. The bespoke Smallbone kitchen is made up of wooden units with a granite work surface and fully integrated Miele & Gagganeau appliances. There is a breakfast bar and space for a further seating area. From here, a few steps down take you to the dining room with a lovely stone floor and French doors out to a sunny courtyard. Off the kitchen is a modern shower room with Villeroy and Bosch sanitary ware and a contemporary staircase that takes you up to the fifth bedroom with a vaulted ceiling, feature window and plenty of built in wardrobes. This same staircase winds down to a basement where you find a great music room, a shower rooms, handy utility and a wine cellar. The main staircase from the living room takes you up to the impressive principle suite with a double aspect bedroom, a fully fitted dressing room and a modern tiled wet room with a porthole window. Across the hall is the final double bedroom and a further bathroom with a freestanding bath and separate shower cubicle. The stunning landscaped garden is nearly 200ft in length and has been sectioned into three areas.

The main patio is accessed from all main reception rooms and is a wonderful entertaining space. There are built in lights, speakers and heaters making it perfect for al-fresco dining. The patio opens onto a large lawn and then through an arched hedge to another private lawn. The whole garden is surrounded by attractive plants and trees making it a private oasis. To the front, there is off street parking for a number of vehicles.

The house is situated on a private road within 0.5 mile from the Royal Parade and a very short walk to The Hawkwood Estate where you will find acres of beautiful National Trust land.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £550,000 to £575,000
Anthony Martin are delighted to bring to the market this extended 3 bedroom semi-detached property. The property is within the Darrick Wood Catchment area, walking distance to local amenities, and with great transport links this property will appeal to many. The property benefits from parking for two cars, a garage to the side and potential to extend further STPP.

The porch opens into a delightful square entrance hall. To the front of the property is a bright lounge with bay window allowing the natural light to flood in. To the rear of the property the open plan space features a spacious dining room, great for entertaining. The dining area flows into the kitchen which overlooks the garden and comprises a range of white base and wall units with a breakfast bar and skylight. There is also a guest cloakroom on the ground floor.

To the first floor there are three good sized bedrooms, all with built in storage. The family bathroom is fully tiled with a white 3 piece suite and shower over bath .

The easily-maintained garden is mainly laid to lawn with side access to the garage and back door. The summer house has power and heat and could be removed if further garden space is required. The front of the property is partly laid to lawn with a driveway which can accommodate two cars as well as a detached garage to the side of the property.

address: Scotts Terrace, Dorset Road, London SE9
detailedDescription:
Guide price £475,000 - £500,000

We’re delighted to present this large three double bedroom terraced Victorian home just 0.5 miles from Mottingham station!

The home has been kept extremely well by the current owners and internal accommodation comprises; a large living room, a big dining room which leads in to the homes kitchen & out on to garden which features a patio which is perfect for entertaining in the summer months as well as a large area laid to lawn all to the ground floor with a shed to the rear of the garden.

To the first floor you will find two double bedrooms and the family bathroom. The master bedroom is situated on the second floor boasting measurements of 22’5 ft x 10’10 ft which could also be a great guest room as there is also a toilet and room for a shower!

The property is located just 0.5 miles from Mottingham Station which offers fast and frequent direct services into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Cannon Street & Charing Cross. Local shops are at the end of the road including cafes and a post office.

Eltham High Street can be found a short distance away and offers comprehensive shopping, bars, restaurants and the recently built Vue cinema. Chislehurst High Street is also within reasonable distance with an abundance of independent retailers, restaurants & coffee shops!

If Schools are a priority then this really isn’t one to miss out on as there is a selection of primary & secondary schools available within the immediate area including the Ofsted Outstanding St Vincent’s Catholic Primary School and Eltham College.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Nearing completion, a stunning newly converted and extremely spacious, two double bedroom first floor victorian duplex apartment situated in a popular location a short walk from Anerley over ground station with great links to the city, London Bridge and Canada water. Kent House station is a 15 minute walk with access to central London. With over 800 sqft this stunning property boasts a large bright bay fronted open plan lounge /fully fitted kitchen with solid granite worktops and integrated fridge/freezer and washing machine, LED spotlights and grey laminate flooring benefiting from an acoustic sub floor. There is a generous sized double bedroom on the first floor with exposed painted brickwork and original cast Iron fire surround and the larger master bedroom can be found on the second floor which features storage space and a dressing area. The large bathroom with rain shower over the bath and beautiful ceramic tiles is also located on this floor. The property has been completely modernised to a high standard throughout and benefits from a smart electric heating system. Additional features include polished chrome fixtures and fittings, acoustic subflooring on the first floor and new double glazed energy efficient slide and tilt and turn sash windows with new floor coverings to be provided throughout.

The property is chain free and benefits from a new 999 year lease. We would highly recommend an early viewing as these properties rarely remain available on the market for any length of time.

Situated in a popular residential road within a few minutes walk of Birkbeck Station and Tramlink. Local shops and bus services are located close by in Elmers End Road and Croydon Road. Anerley & Penge West Stations can take you to London Bridge and Charing Cross or to East Croydon. The East London Line; trains from Anerley take you directly to the area of Whitechapel, Shoreditch and Rotherhithe. The High Street shops and social facilities of Beckenham are about two miles away with Spa Leisure Centre, library, cinema, restaurants and pubs.

detailedDescription:
Three bedroom detached house in a quiet cul de sac location, perfect for families and just 0.8 of a mile from Elmstead Wood Station and 0.6 of a mile from Chislehurst High Street. Close to Sundridge Golf course and good schools, including Babington School and Bullers Wood Schools.

A really light house with through lounge, doors to a conservatory overlooking the large garden. A wide galley kitchen fully fitted with wall and base units, and concealed appliances. A downstairs w c completes the accommodation to the ground floor.

To the first floor there are three good size bedrooms, the master having a bay window and fitted wardrobes. The second double bedroom has 'Slider robes' fitted, giving a modern light feel to the room, a good size double, the third room is of a good size and overlooks the garden as does the second bedroom. There is a separate w.c to the family bathroom, which is contemporary in design and has a P shaped bath with shower and a curved glass screen. Tiling to walls and floor and of a good size with lots of storage.

Outside the private landscaped garden is a great space for entertaining when the good weather permits and has a large patio area laid with grey paving, there are steps down to the larger lawned area.

To the front there is a driveway leading to the garage with parking for several cars.

This is a quiet cul de sac and is so well placed for amenities, shops, schools station and more. Viewings are essential to appreciate all this home has to offer.

There are also plans for an extension, the consented application can be viewed on the London Borough of Bromley planning portal under reference: 19/01990/FULL6 | Demolition of existing garage, proposed single/two storey rear extension with rear juliet balcony and side and rear lanterns. | 11 Grove Vale Chislehurst BR7 5DS

Council Tax:- London Borough of Bromley, Band F, £2,443.31

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Galloways are delighted to present to the market this immaculately presented two double bedroom flat on Mayfair Close. The property is beautifully presented throughout and is situated in a fantastic location for all of the local amenities and restaurants on Beckenham High Street. This includes being only a 6 minute walk away from Beckenham junction train station, giving commuters easy access across London. Viewings are highly recommended!

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991

Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.

You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
Ideally placed for Orpington Mainline station, and also the High Street with it's shops, restaurants and bars, this modern two bedroom balcony apartment benefits from private, secure parking. Offered to the market "chain-free".

Viewing comes highly recommended on this modern balcony apartment situated in the heart of Orpington town centre. Located above the flagship Tesco superstore, the flat is ideally placed for the mainline station with it's renowned fast service to London, it is also just a short walk from the High Street with it's array of shops, cinema, bars, and restaurants. Comprising:- a lounge with open plan kitchen area with built-in appliances, and balcony, two double bedrooms and spacious bathroom, there is also secure allocated parking, and a lockable community bike store. Offered to the market "chain-free".

Hall Video/entry phone system. Single panel radiator. Cupboard housing heating system and tank. Additional storage cupboard housing fuse board.

balcony Overlooking car park.

Colour co-ordinated work tops and up ends. Under cupboard lighting. Ceramic tiled floor. Integrated ceramic hob with oven under. Extractor with stainless steel splash back. Built-in dishwasher, washing machine and fridge freezer.

Bedroom 1 19' 5" x 9' 1" (5.92m x 2.77m) Double glazed full height window. Single panel radiator. Range of fitted wardrobes to one wall.

Bedroom 2 13' 9" x 6' 5" (4.19m x 1.96m) Double glazed full height window. Single panel radiator.

Bathroom Fitted with a white suite comprising; panelled bath with shower attachment, inset vanity wash hand basin with adjacent WC with concealed cistern. Partly tiled walls with decorative border. Heated towel rail. Down lighting.

Tye lane is well located for all of Farnborough's amenities with good local transport links, excellent schools, open parkland, plus shops, bars and restaurants, all in all a fine family home.

Both Orpington & St Mary Cray stations are within easy reach and it is also only a short drive of Junction 4 of the M25. Local schools include St Philomena's Primary school and The Harris Academy Primary and Secondary schools.

Location

Well-presented one bedroom apartment situated within this quiet cul-de-sac just off the ever so popular Anerley Road. With features to include own front door, private garden, open plan lounge and kitchen, master bedroom and shower room. Perfectly located within easy reach of the famous Crystal Palace Park and sports centre and Anerley rail and over ground which makes it easy for commuters into London or The City.
Further benefits include allocated parking space and garden.
Directions

Also located close by are grounds of Crystal Palace Park and National Sports Centre.

detailedDescription:
Three bedroom semi detached set on a quiet popular street in Hayes - potential to extend STPP - catchment for local Hayes schools and Pickhurst Primary - walking distance to Hayes station and High Street - off street parking and garage - fitted kitchen with double oven - three piece bathroom suite - beautiful landscaped rear garden with patio area, the garden is one of the largest on the street - close to Pickhurst Green and lots of walking facilities - EPC - E

Hayes is a modern suburban area nestled between Bromley, West Wickham and Coney Hall with excellent transport links into Central London from Hayes Station. Station Approach is a bustling haven of coffee shops, mini supermarkets, restaurants, as well as a post office, with further smaller shops in Old Hayes; the old village area on Hayes Street. There are several green spaces to enjoy and the town boasts a number of ofsted highly rated primary and secondary schools.

detailedDescription:
Thomas Brown Estates are delighted to offer this spacious (2130 sqft), immaculately presented five bedroom four bathroom detached family home situated in the ever popular Maples development in South Orpington, providing easy access to Orpington High Street, Station, Warren Road and St Olaves schools with the added benefit of being offered to the market with no forward chain. The accommodation on offer comprises; entrance hall, dual aspect lounge, dining room, modern fitted luxury kitchen, utility area and a WC to the ground floor. To the first floor are three bedrooms, including two double bedrooms with en-suites and a family bathroom. To the second floor are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Externally, there is a landscaped rear garden mainly laid to lawn, a drive to the front and parking for four vehicles in front of the double garage. Points to note are the bathrooms and kitchen have been replaced by the current owner from the original specification when built in the early 2000s and also boasts one of the larger gardens we have seen on the development. Internal viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the size and standard of accommodation on offer.

address: Knoll Court, 18 Station Road, Orpington BR6
detailedDescription:
Virtual tour available - please call for details and view from the comfort of your own home or office!

This beautiful building with gated entrance is a complex of apartments built exclusively for the over 55's and situated just a few hundred metres from Orpington town centre.
On offer is a ground floor flat to the rear of the building which benefits from having its own French doors opening to the glorious landscaped communal gardens.
Residents parking is found to the front of the building and from here an immaculately kept communal hall with security entry phone system gives you access inside.
A short walk along the hallway takes you to this ground floor apartment and a wooden front door gives access to the entrance hall.
The carpeted reception room has a delightful bay window with French doors overlooking and opening to the gardens beyond and the kitchen has separate access from the hallway. The kitchen has wall and base units and comes complete with an integrated oven and hob with extractor over, integrated fridge/freezer and washing machine.
The property has two double bedrooms; bedroom one has its own en suite shower room and fitted cupboards and bedroom two also has fitted wardrobes and delightful views over the gardens.
There is another bathroom off the hall with a three piece suite comprising panelled bath, WC and pedestal wash hand basin.

Orpington is a thriving suburban town within the M25 and therefore ideally situated for access to the motorway network and the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. Orpington station is less than quarter of a mile away. The town centre, also under quarter of a mile away, has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. You will also find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.<br /><br />

Two double bedrooms one with en-suite and a contemporary bathroom with Porcelanosa wall tiles, stylish white sanitary ware and chrome heated towel rails.

New Beckenham station is close by offering direct trains to London Bridge from, Charing Cross and Cannon St. Beckenham town centre is just a few minutes away offering a range of shops and facilities including Waitrose and Marks & Spencer food halls and a wide selection of chain and individual shops.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £650,000 - £675,000:

Fantastic opportunity to purchase this deceptively spacious four bedroom 'Georgian' style link-detached family home. The property is conveniently located for both Chislehurst and Petts Wood with its array of shops, bars, restaurants and boutiques.

The property has been extended to the ground floor and boasts an entrance porch that gives access to a welcoming entrance hall, fitted kitchen with bay fronted window, large L-shaped lounge/dining room that opens into the extended reception room that overlooks the lovely rear garden and a shower room.

The first floor benefits from four bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Outside enjoys a secluded rear garden that is mainly laid to lawn, there is also a driveway to the front that leads to a garage.

Other important features to note; Double glazing that is in keeping with the era of the property and was installed by the current vendor, gas central heating, potential to extend further (subject to the usual planning consents), a number of high regarded schools located nearby, along with two mainline stations.

Viewing essential.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Beckenham Place Park is a prestigious estate that totals 237 acres and is set on the London / Kent borders with access to a range of amenities including shops, restaurants, sports facilities and transport links.

The Park is one of the first properties to be built in this scenic and sought after location and still retains many of the original Victorian features.

Set in a secluded position behind electric gates, there is ample off street parking and a double garage. In this enchanting and versatile home, it is currently set up with an inviting central entrance hall leading to three principal receptions, a music room and a kitchen breakfast room. There is also a separate utility and a swimming pool complex with changing rooms and a sauna and there is a cellar with ample storage space.

Upstairs are eight well proportioned bedrooms, six bathrooms and a giant games room / home office on the top floor.

The grounds cover approximately 0.68 acres are laid mainly to lawn with a tremendous amount of screening for seclusion. The kitchen breakfast room, drawing room and swimming pool complex all provide direct access on to the terrace; an ideal spot for alfresco dining.

This home offers a unique opportunity to own one of Beckenham's finest homes. Restored to its former glory, the owners have created a wonderful family home.

Beckenham has long been a popular suburban town, and is highly popular with both families and commuters who are spoilt for choice with numerous Train stations including Beckenham Junction (0.4 miles), New Beckenham, Clock House and Ravensbourne Station (0.5miles) with services into Central London. The popular Tramlink also run frequently into both Croydon through to Wimbledon Village.

The beautiful rear garden of this home backs Beckenham Place Park and its historic Grade II mansion which is open daily to the public as an arts, cultural and community centre. The Mansion now houses artist studio, a yoga/pilates/wellbeing centre, arts and crafts classes, a record shop and a café.

Beckenham is a vibrant area with a host of restaurants, boutique shops and excellent local amenities including the Spa leisure centre, David Lloyd and Kelsey Park. Sought after schools locally include Balgowan, Marian Vian and the ever popular Langley Park boys and Girls schools.

address: Starts Hill Road, Farnborough, Orpington BR6
detailedDescription:
Starts Hill Road is a much sought after position close to local schools including Darrick Wood junior and seniors as well as Farnborough Village primary. The property is approximately a mile from local shops, restaurants and coffee shops in Locksbottom, plus close to Farnborough Village, High Elms Park and Tugmutton Common, home to a local tennis and cricket club.
The property itself has undergone significant improvement and investment from its existing owners, it now offers in excess of 3000 sq ft. Of space and is offered to the market in beautiful condition. A large entrance hallway opens to ground floor accommodation including a 19ft bay fronted living room, large open plan kitchen/ breakfast room, separate dining room, study, utility and cloakroom. The first floor features five bedrooms with a master bedroom featuring an en suite and dressing room, bedroom two featuring an en suite and with three other large bedrooms being served by a family bathroom.
The property sits in a large garden with paved driveway, double garage and garden mainly laid to lawn with mature shrubs and herbaceous borders. We strongly recommend an early viewing.<br /><br />
title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Quite simply, a large and well presented 2 Bedroomed purpose built ground floor apartment located on Shortlands Road with access to private terrace and wonderful views over communal gardens.

The property has been maintained to a good standard by the current owners and needs to be viewed internally to fully appreciate the overall quality and size of accommodation on offer. In our opinion this property is ideally suited to the second time buyer, or to those who may be downsizing.

This property will appeal to the commuter with Shortlands train station just a short 7 minute stroll away offering regular services to Central London and the West End via London Victoria and The City via London Blackfriars. Directly outside the property you can get the 358 bus to Beckenham, Crystal Palace, Bromley and Orpington. There is also a bus stop a few yards down located on Shortlands Road which you can get the 367 bus to Bromley North, Beckenham and Croydon.

Similarly, local shops are within easy reach in Shortlands Village and both Bromley and Beckenham Town Centres are within a 10 minute drive. With well over 400 retail units to choose from, Bromley is one of the most extensive shopping centres in the region. The Glades Shopping Centre boasts over 130 stores alone. Bromley South is currently part of a regeneration programme at St Marks Square offering a new brand of leisure and dining units including a new cinema complex.

Located on the ground floor the property features a spacious entrance hall with two storage cupboards that flows superbly throughout and leads to an impressive 17’3 x 15’11 Reception / Dining Room with feature fireplace and patio door opening onto private terrace with views over landscaped communal gardens and outside tap.

Both bedrooms are genuine large doubles, the main bedroom benefiting walk in wardrobe and en suite shower room, the family bathroom is fully tiled and incorporates a bath with shower attachment.

The superbly equipped modern Kitchen features a range of matching wall and base units together with a host of integrated appliances including fridge / freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, oven, hob with extractor hood and vinyl flooring.

Further features include, double glazing, gas central heating and two garages.

In our opinion, this outstanding example is likely to attract immediate and significant interest and all prospective purchasers are strongly advised to view immediately to avoid disappointment.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
If you are looking for a spacious, quality apartment then this amazing three bedroom example certainly fits the bill. Located on the first floor of an exclusive gated development it was built as a three bedroom and as you will see from the floorplan, the current owners have divided the third bedroom to create a study as well. This can easily be converted back to its original layout. A further bonus is the step-free access, despite being first floor due to the passenger lift.

The main living space takes your breath away as it's a fantastic size room which leads onto a large covered balcony. Providing ultimate contemporary living, the reception room incorporates the kitchen, with integrated appliances, quartz work surfaces and peninsular breakfast bar.

The two larger bedrooms benefit from en-suite shower rooms and access to a second balcony with the master further boasting its own dressing room. A further large family bathroom, good size storage cupboard and utility room are all accessed from the hallway.
There are two allocated parking spaces to the front accessed via remote gates.

Both Bickley and Chislehurst stations are located under 1 mile away providing excellent direct services into a number of central London destinations including London Bridge, Cannon Street, Charing Cross and London Victoria. Bromley Town Centre is 1 mile away offering a host of shops, bars and restaurants.

All in all a wonderful apartment providing spacious living in a convenient location.

Internally the downstairs greets you with a spacious entrance hall which then leads onto a large front reception room. The second reception is a large open plan kitchen dining area and offers access through patio doors to the garden.

The kitchen is brand new with stylish handleless units, solid wood surface and modern metro tile splash back. The kitchen is well equipped to house all essential white goods and plenty of unit space.

To the first floor there are 3 bedrooms, 2 of which are double bedrooms and a smaller single/study. There is also a family bathroom which has been fully tiled with bath & rainfall shower.

The top floor offers a master suite overlooking the rear, measuring 17ft1 in length with fitted wardrobes and a modern ensuite bathroom.

The garden is easily maintained with it being paved, a perfect space for a family to enjoy the summer months. There is also access to the double garage at the rear which could easily be upgraded to a modern workshop/office space.

Anerley Hill train station is 0.2 miles away with Crystal Palace station just 0.8miles away.

Seymour Villas is conveniently located for both Penge high street & Crystal Palace. The Triangle is nearby with all its bars, restaurants and shopping facilities. A property not to be missed, Call iMove today!

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A superior top floor flat in the heart of chislehurst within this well-managed, gated estate. Excellent condition, with bright, spacious rooms providing quality accommodation. Garage and parking. In a beautiful leafy setting 2 minutes from the high street and all its shops. An absolute must see!

The location is excellent, just A short stroll to chislehurst high street with its multitude of coffee shops, great restaurants, and interesting independent shops.

The interior is bright and spacious providing a high quality, comfortable and private living space, with a pleasing outlook towards the woodland opposite.
Inside there is a larger than average kitchen and bathroom, both recently redecorated. The lounge and dining area extends to nearly 24 ft with a wide picture window allowing the light to flood in.
Outside there are well maintained large communal gardens with sweeping lawns bordered by trees, mature shrubs, and benches to sit on, ideal for summer relaxation.

The property is set back from a tree lined road which leads through a glorious part of old Chislehurst to the village centre.

Step outside and within minutes you can be walking through ancient woodland, sitting by Chislehurst ponds with a coffee or enjoying a picnic on the common.

Doctors and Dentist surgeries, bus stops, a post office and Sainsburys are close by. Chislehurst Station is less than a mile away with trains to London Bridge taking 25 minutes.

Bromley, with its Glades shopping centre is 11 minutes away by car.

The estate has benefited from extensive upgrades in recent years to improve security and to provide a safe high-quality environment. This includes new premium grade front doors, CCTV, electric entrance gates, new garage doors and rooves, block paving, new lighting and rewiring etc
A friendly community spirit is evident among the residents who appreciate their estate and love living there.

Lease Information

Leasehold. 999 years with 958 years remaining.
Share of Freehold.
Service Charge of £1200 p.a.

detailedDescription:
Take a look at this stunning, extended four bedroom detached family home finished to a high modern standard in a superb location.

This home comprises to the ground floor a beautiful open plan kitchen/dining area with sky lights and bi folding doors leading onto the garden to rear, separate lounge and also a further reception room which can be utilised as a TV room/Study/Play room. There is also a downstairs W.C. To the first floor you have three great sized bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. To the second floor is the main bedroom which gets bundles of light and benefits from having an en-suite shower room and access to a walk in wardrobe/additional bedroom too.

Externally this home offers a good size garden to the rear which has plenty of space for seating areas, perfect for entertaining. To the front you have off street parking for multiple vehicles.

The location of this stunning home is highly convenient for commuters as Orpington station with its fast direct service to London bridge in around 17 minutes, is just a short walk away. The area is also well served by reputable schools including the highly regarded St. Olaves Grammar School for Boys and Newstead Grammar School for Girls. Numerous primary schools can also be found within a mile radius.

The town centre has a comprehensive range of shops and restaurants including the Walnuts shopping Centre. Sports facilities are well catered for with the Walnuts Sports Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. A little way out of town you will find larger shops at the Nugent Retail Park as well as large diy stores. Major shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within a 10 miles drive or bus ride. The Orpington district has lots of green areas to enjoy including Priory Gardens, Goddington Park and the rolling Kent countryside which starts from the edge of town where you can find cosy country pubs in the surrounding villages.

Precista Court is a delightful complex of retirement apartments offering independent living for the over 55's and is situated in the heart of Orpington town centre. The High Street location means all the facilities of the town are close by as well as the Priory Gardens where you can enjoy walks around the ponds and historical buildings.
This apartment is situated on the second floor of the building with windows to the rear overlooking the communal gardens. Inside, you will find a double bedroom with built-in wardrobes, bathroom with bath and walk-in shower cubicle, WC and wash hand basin and a very large living/dining room. The kitchen is accessed from the reception room and is well fitted with built-in appliances and cupboards and has a window to the side.
The apartment also comes with the benefit of an allocated parking space behind remote controlled electric gates.
Communal facilities at Precista Court include a residents lounge, guest bedroom suite for visitors and a part time scheme manager.

Orpington is a thriving suburban town within the M25 and therefore ideally situated for access to the motorway network and the railway stations that can transport you into London in as little as 17 minutes. The town centre has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. You will also find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Virtual tour available - please call for details and view from the comfort of your own home or office!

'Forkways' is a most attractive Grade II listed building situated on the outskirts of the semi-rural village of Chelsfield and surrounded by glorious Kentish countryside. It sits on a plot of just over one third of an acre with well-tended gardens all around and parts are believed to date back to the 16th Century.
The rear gardens are south facing and there are delightful views over rolling pastures to both front and rear.

The accommodation is over two floors and begins with a pretty entrance vestibule that gives way to dining room with exposed brick fireplace, beamed ceiling and part timber panelled walls.
From here you can also access a double aspect reception room that makes an ideal study with stairs that lead you to the first floor landing.
A welcoming sitting room features another brick fireplace and exposed beams and two sets of double doors facing south and opening to the rear garden.
The kitchen is in the 'country' style and comprehensively fitted with a range of wall and base units with contrasting granite work surfaces, butler sink and a range cooker.
An opening from the kitchen leads you to a wonderful, heated dining conservatory that is ideally positioned to enjoy views over the garden and has tiled floors that run through from the kitchen. You will also find a combined utility room and downstairs WC off of a lobby that also provides another access point to the garden.
Upstairs, a spacious landing provides access to the four bedrooms and a family bathroom.
The double aspect master bedroom is of generous proportions and has its own en-suite shower room with WC. All four bedrooms have fitted wardrobes.
The family bathroom has a classic white suite including a claw foot freestanding bath, walk-in shower cubicle, wash hand basin and WC.

Outside, the pretty, manicured gardens are enclosed by a traditional white picket fence and the driveway to the garaging is to the right hand side as you look at the house.
The rear gardens enjoy the sunny southerly aspect and include areas of lawn, flower and shrub beds plus a block paved patio, paved terrace, heritage rose walk and a pergola.

The property also has a detached double garage with an internal store room accessed from Jubilee Road. Planning permission exists for the replacement of the existing garage and associated landscape works ref: DC/18/03188/FULL6.

The property occupies a prominent position between the charming semi-rural village of Chelsfield and the hamlet of Well Hill and the immediate area is surrounded by multiple footpaths and bridleways, ideal for those who enjoy walking, cycling or horse riding. Traditional country pubs such as the historic Five Bells and The Bo Peep can be found within a short walk. Lullingstone Country Park and golf course is under a mile away and Chelsfield village has a cricket ground, primary school and village hall.

The town of Orpington is within 2.5 miles and Sevenoaks is just 6 miles away. Railway stations can be found at Chelsfield (1.5 m), Knockholt (0.8 m) and Orpington (with its fast service into London Bridge within 20 minutes) is just 1.5 m away.

Reputable schools are also within the area such as St. Olaves Grammar School Fort Boys (2.0 miles) and Newstead Grammar School For Girls (3.0 miles).
Chelsfield Primary School in the village is within 0.75 miles.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Newly offered to the market is this immaculate, characterful two-bedroom end of terrace Edwardian home. Located perfectly on a picturesque road, the property has been loved and well maintained to a high specification by its current owners.

Downstairs comprises of a cosy living room with a country twist, an original fireplace fitted with wood-burning stove located in the centre of the room, presented as a real feature. Separate dining area, understairs W/C, the kitchen is positioned to the rear of the house and has been fully fitted with all appliances, leading out into the rear garden.

Upstairs benefits from two large double bedrooms, the master room boasts a stunning original fireplace. Both rooms have access to the Jack and Jill bathroom that has been decorated in stylish taste. The property can be extended to the rear and into the loft as several neighbours have done subject to the usual planning consent. The rear garden benefits from side access, has been lovingly maintained and includes an outhouse with power, heating and light. Approximate Garden dimensions: 72' (21.94) x 19'4 (5.89).

Bickley station is within walking distance and offers fast and frequent Southeastern services into London Victoria and Thameslink services into London Blackfriars. Bromley South is also a short bus journey or walk away. The property resides within several excellent school catchments including Bickley Primary, St Georges Bickley CofE Primary School, Raglan Primary, Ravensbourne and the ever-popular Bullers Wood School for Girls. Local shops are close by with Chatterton Road offering your everyday needs plus Bromley town centre is within walking distance offering a much wider range of shops, bar and restaurants.

Superb upper floor maisonette with its own garden and private entrance.

Outside is a fantastic private garden which is certainly going to be enjoyed this summer!

Located close to parks, leisure facilities and just over a mile to a choice of three different railway stations, this property ticks lots of boxes.

What The Seller Says

We have often taken full advantage of the 10-minute stroll to Chislehurst, which is a delightful village setting surrounded by plenty of wooded areas, green spaces, independent boutiques, coffee shops, bars & restaurants. Making it a perfect destination for a Sunday stroll or a summers evening walk. The monthly farmers market is a must visit if you are fond of local produce, we can certainly recommend the local honey and seasonal fruit and veg. For convenience the co-op on White Horse Hill is only a 5-minute walk away and has parking for those days that you’d rather use the car if you have one. We have always found it to be well stocked and is open until 11pm for those last-minute bits you may have forgotten. William Barefoot Drive is also well stocked for convenience and we regularly use the ‘Post Office’ and ‘Front Page News’ for their parcel collection, postage and return services. Both Walden rec and Chislehurst rec are easily within walking distance, perfect for young families and adults seeking to get away for some quick R&R.

Entering into the property you are immediately met with the fabulous hallway, complete with the original wood paneling, ornate picture rail and stunning parquet flooring. This area is flooded with natural light from the grand, feature stained glass window on the landing.

All of the rooms on the ground lead nicely off of the hallway and include the following :

Reception One : Dual aspect windows with the side with original stained style, feature fireplace and parquet flooring.

Reception Two : Dual aspect windows with the sides being original stained glass, french doors leading out onto the garden and veranda area. Attractive feature fireplace and parquet flooring.

Kitchen Dining Room : This spacious family room measures a generous 29ft and is also dual aspect. The kitchen includes plenty of cupboard space, a large centre island with inset sink, dishwasher and 5 ring double oven. The large area towards the rear of the room makes for an ideal dining space and then the room is complete with french doors leading out to the garden. The work surfaces are granite in the kitchen and the floor is stone with underfloor heating.

There is a handy utility room off of the kitchen which houses the modern boiler and plumbing for washing machine and dryer.

Study : The study faces the front of the property and is the perfect size for anyone working from home.

Downstairs WC : The cloakroom is also at the front of the property complete with wc and wash hand basin.

To the first floor there are four double bedrooms with the master boasting an en suite shower and WC and two of the double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes. Then of course the family bathroom with a period high level WC and a stylish marble vanity sink with underneath storage.

From the landing there is also access to the huge attic which is currently boarded and ideal for storage. However with the necessary planning consent could be extended creating more rooms of choice.

Externally this beautiful home has off street parking for plenty of cars and at the rear there is a spacious garden with a detached garage and parking bay also.

The location of this home is fantastic with easy access into London or Kent. Bickley and Chislehurst Stations are within walking distance, Bickley serves West London well whilst Chislehurst for Central and East London. There are also a variety of bus routes, green spaces and of course Bromley Town Centre within easy reach.

Popular Secondary Schools close by include Bromley High, Bullers Wood and Eltham Collage.

Rarely do charchtful detached homes become available in this area especially with scope to extend so please make contact to arrange your viewing.
