detailedDescription:
Guide price £725,000 to £750,000.

Virtual reality tour and full HD video walk through - like and subscribe to our youtube channel for property updates
The house


Please see our full HD video and 360 degree virtualy reality tour to get a full sense of what this house offers. You will see the horses roaming in the field opposite in the video. The house does look directly on this as its located opposite with very little obstruction of the view.

The house offers over 1500 sq ft of space. The detached garage is substantial and offer almost another 250 sq ft of space.

Given the size and width of the rear garden the house may suit buyers wishing to build a rear extension. This might be possible without the need for planning consent under permitted development right, however buyers are advised to carry out their own due diligence in this regard.

With three double bedrooms, three en-suites, two receptions rooms, a study, a utility room and a downstairs W/C, the main house offers lots of flexible accommodation perfect for a growing family.

The detached garage has power increasing its potential for different uses. It also offers potential for development subject to any permissions required.

The house is offered chain free and would appeal to families and investors alike.

The location, recreation and transport

Hayes is a desirable location in the London borough of Bromley (historic county of Kent) nestled between other desirable towns such as West Wickham, Park Langley and Keston. Although the house has a drive is large enough for a number of cars, Hayes station is located approximately 0.7 mile away (15 minute walk according to Google maps) should transport be a requirement.

Hayes station offers some of the following travel times to central London stations:

London Charing Cross in approximately 39 minutes

London Cannon Street in approximately 40 minutes

Station Approach (Hayes station) has a bustling atmosphere with an array of coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants and other independent businesses.

The old village is another particularly nice area to enjoy offering more restaurants and cafes to enjoy.

There are several great green spaces, cycles paths and walks to enjoy locally including Norman Park and Hayes common. You will also find football, ruby, cricket, golf, athletics to name but a few of the sporting activities locally.

Bus services run along Hayes Lane offering access to Bromley and highly acclaimed The Glades Shopping Centre as well as the newly developed St Marks Square.
Schools


The house will be especially appealing to buyers seeking good local schools. There are a selection of highly desirable schools locally including:

Ofsted rated “Outstanding” Hayes School
ofsted rated “Outstanding” Pickhurst Infant school and academy

There are many other highly acclaimed schools locally and buyers are advised to carry out their own due diligence in this regard.

The house is being sold exclusively through Hunters. Please contact us to arrange your viewing appointment.

The layout itself surpasses 643sqft/59.7sqm of internal floor space that is set on the top floor, all of which providing masses of natural light. The bedrooms have been cleverly designed, with the second bedroom benefitting from a walk-in-wardrobe, a modern yet well-proportioned bathroom, and stunning open plan kitchen/lounge, which is ideal for hosting guests; especially if you are a keen cook!

Just moments away from the vibrant Penge high street, less than 100 yards to be exact, this flat is sure to be very appealing to a professional commuter looking for superb transport links. Penge West Station has brilliant access into London Bridge and East London via The Overground Line calling in at stations such as Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington via Shoreditch High Street, with Penge East offering amazing connections into London Victoria.

With the recent success we have had on similar properties within the immediate area, we envisage this apartment being sold sooner rather than later, so be quick to enquire by calling our office now!

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £500,000 to £525,000**

Offered to the market in pristine condition is this spacious two bedroom apartment located in one of the finest period buildings in Bromley. Constructed in 1864 and converted in 1950, Farrants Court is situated on Bickley Park Road, minutes from two stations and a vibrant town centre.

Offering over 855 sq ft of space, the specification is both luxurious and contemporary and the accommodation has been excellently designed to provide superb living space. The bathroom has been modernised with new tiling and flooring, while the well maintained kitchen benefits from granite work tops, soft close units and integrated appliances. The second bedroom can easily accommodate a double bed while the master bedroom has built in wardrobes. Finally, the reception room benefits from wood burner and direct access to communal gardens.

Further benefits include allocated parking, garage and private basement providing ample storage for the apartment.

Farrants Court is located in an enviable position on Bickley Park Road. Bickley Station and Chislehurst Station are equidistant (approx. 10 minute walk) in opposite directions taking you into Victoria/Blackfriars and London Bridge/Charing Cross/Cannon Street. Bromley town centre is a short drive or bus journey away offering The Glades Shopping Centre and St Mark's Square Development, whilst Chislehurst High Street is a 20 minute walk with an array of shops, boutiques and restaurants.

Leasehold: 154 years remaining
Service Charge: £900 P/A
Ground Rent: £744 P/A (including building insurance)

detailedDescription:
For sale by Modern Method of Auction: Starting Bid Price £365,000 plus Reservation Fee. This property is for sale by The Great North Property Auction powered by iamsold.
This End of Terrace home in Bromley Village features a roof terrace, Off Road Parking and comprises of lounge/dining room, kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms. Well placed for local amenities, Bromley Town Centre and transport links, your viewing is highly recommended.

This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance. The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3%
of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the
purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A
sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.
The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.
Referral Arrangements
The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted. Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive.

Situation
The property is very well positioned being close to Bromley North and South mainline stations servicing Central London destinations, as well as an abundance of shops, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities. For those with children there are a number of schools within distance catering for all ages.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful opportunity to purchase a five bedroom detached house in Chislehurst's most desirable road. The house has 5,181 square foot (including garage and outbuildings) of accommodation so is well proportioned. There is also scope to extend subject to planning and the property has lots of potential to update and decorate to your own taste and specification.

On the ground floor are three reception rooms plus a snooker/games room with bar and a conservatory that overlooks the front garden. To the first floor the master bedroom has a large ensuite, with two of the other bedrooms having ensuites. The remaining two bedrooms are served by a family bathroom. Three of the front facing bedrooms all have access to a balcony that extends along most of the front of the house.

The rear garden is 88' X 70' and has an outdoor swimming pool and a summerhouse. The house is set back from the road so the driveway provides plenty of parking. With the house being elevated it adds to the properties sense of privacy.

A little history:- The Camden Park Estate with its manor house, Camden Place, gained notoriety when it became home in exile of Napoleon the Third, Emperor of the French, and the Imperial Family in 1870. The death of the Emperor in 1873 left the widowed Empress in residence until she moved to Hampshire. In 1890 the estate was put up for sale and the William Willetts, father and son, property developers purchased the estate. They had a vision for a much larger scale development originally, but there was local opposition and the compromise was for Camden Place to become Chislehurst Golf Club with Camden Park Road and Wilderness Road created to provide substantial homes. The first homes in Wilderness Road were occupied in 1906 and the remainder of the road was developed predominantly between then and the late 1930's. Today there are 31 properties in the road with the 32nd under construction.

Footnote by Richard Piddock, Partner at jdm. "I am fortunate to have had the privilege of visiting many of Chislehurst's finest homes in the most sought after roads, yet still now after 20 plus years of working in Chislehurst, on entering Wilderness Road it has the ability to surprise you as to just how wonderful a road it is. It is truly a hidden gem.''

London Borough of Bromley - Council Tax Band H - £3,383.04

detailedDescription:
Unveiled to the SE20 market is this ultra-lavish modern apartment with contemporary finishing, superb floor space, and situated in what we call 'Overspill Central', fast attracting clientele from areas such as Crystal Palace and Dulwich.

The accommodation occupies the first floor of this stunning brick façade residence, with the internal layout in excess of 450sqft. The layout consists of large master bedroom, well-proportioned bathroom, fully fitted kitchen finished off in white gloss, and separate bright and airy reception room flooded with natural light and offers you sense of space. Further benefits include a shared well-maintained garden, refurbished throughout, gas central heating and is offered chain free.

Anerley Station is your closest transport connection into London, which serves the Overground line & South-eastern trains. Betts Park, a large green open space is located just behind the development, with a number of attractions including part of the old Croydon Canal, a football pitch, an open air gym and a children's play area. Several supermarkets and Xpress shops are just a short walk away, along with Penge high street which provides a wide choice of shops, cafes and eateries.

With the recent success we have had on similar developments close by, we anticipate this property attracting a frenzy of interest so please call our Crystal Palace office now to register your interest.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented three bedroom modern family home forming part of a desirable exclusive gated development built by the highly regarded national house builder Laing homes in 2004. The property comes to the market in excellent condition and an internal viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate. Internally the layout comprises of entrance hall, guest wc, spacious lounge leading to the dining area, kitchen/breakfast room benefitting from modern style shaker units. To the first floor you will find two bedrooms with the master benefitting from a well appointed en-suite as well as a family bathroom, from the landing a further staircase leading to the second floor with a further spacious double bedroom. Outside you will find a pleasant rear garden mostly laid to lawn with decked area and to the front there is off street parking and a garage with additional parking. The location is ideal for all the family with Bickley station serving Central London approximately 0.6 of a mile away and also Chislehurst station, local schools including Bromley High, Bickley Park and St Georges C of E Primary all within a mile away, locally you can also find parkland. A fantastic opportunity presents itself to acquire this end of terraced house situated on Wiverton Road, SE26. detailedDescription:
This generously sized and well-presented two-bedroom apartment with impressive square footage is located in a premium residential area of Bromley, in a secure gated complex with a video entry system for the grounds and building itself.

The property comprises of two generously sized double bedrooms, both equipped with ample double fitted wardrobes. The extremely spacious and well structured master bedroom also features an en-suite bathroom and its own south facing balcony accessed by double French doors with stunning views across Bromley.

The generously sized family bathroom, finished in a modern white elegant interior décor, is along the hallway and across from the second bedroom.

The apartment also offers a bright and airy large reception area accessible from both kitchen and hallway, with French doors opening out onto another generously sized South-facing balcony.

The separate kitchen is fitted with a range of wall and base units for an impressive amount of storage and has space for a breakfast bar or additional cupboards to be added. The kitchen also includes integrated oven and gas hob, American-style fridge/freezer and dishwasher.

Further benefits include two large storage cupboards in the hallway, one with a washer-dryer and both with extensive shelving, gas central heating and double glazing.

The flat includes two stacked parking spaces in the secure indoor parking area beneath the building that offers both impressive security & protection from the elements.

The building is set back from the street behind a pleasant screen of trees within landscaped grounds maintained by a gardener, which also include a communal garden area behind the property.

The property is within easy reach of Bromley Town Centre, Bickley and Bromley North stations, offering great transport links to Central London and Kent.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Situated on this quiet residential tree-lined road, we are delighted to offer this spacious duplex apartment. detailedDescription:

The property comprises: Entrance porch and hall, living room, dining room, fitted kitchen, lean to extension, sun room and a WC to the ground floor. To the first floor there are three double bedrooms with the master benefitting from a particularly spacious en-suite, and a family bathroom. To the second floor are two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Externally the property boasts a cottage style rear garden, out house and a garage that STPP could be converted into additional living space. St. Mary Cray station, local shops and recreation grounds/local countryside are all within walking distance of this fantastic family home. detailedDescription:

Fantastic two bedroom/one bathroom apartment. Situated on the fourth floor of Brunswick House with views over the green and the rear car park, this spacious apartment benefits from a well-proportioned balcony and underground car parking space.

The apartment is 714 sq ft with an open plan living/dining/kitchen area giving access to the balcony. The master bedroom offers fitted wardrobes, as does the second bedroom, and there is also a well proportioned bathroom. The property also offers two storage/utility cupboards. Flooring is included throughout and is a mix of laminate wood effect, carpet and ceramic tiles.

Brunswick Square is a collection of 83 contemporary one and two bedroom apartments and is the centre piece of Orpington's impressive regeneration. In this landscaped public square, there is a seven screen Odeon cinema, Premier lnn, Pure Gym, restaurants and exciting new retail selection. For shopping further afield Bluewater, Europe's leading out of town retail and leisure facility is only 20 minutes by car. Orpington train station is within very easy reach with trains to London Bridge from 15 minutes and junction 4 of the M25 just under 4 miles away for travel to the Kent coast and further afield. There are excellent schools in the area including Newstead Wood, Darrick Wood and St Olave's, subject to catchment criteria.

detailedDescription:
Galloways are delighted to market this well presented studio apartment offered to the market with no chain.
Perfectly located for the buzz of Penge High Street with an array of local shops, restaurants, and leisure facilities as well as being 0.3 miles from Penge East Station, 0.4 miles from Penge West Station and 0.7 miles from Anerley Station, all giving commuters flexible access into Central London (distances estimated via Google Maps).

Boasting 447 sqft of accommodation and positioned on the ground floor, this property comprises of; entrance hall, open plan living area with built in storage cupboard, kitchen and bathroom with shower This property also benefits from having a lease of 125 years and a bike store. Viewing highly recommended.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

We are delighted to offer for sale this three bedroom mid terraced house built circa 1970 located in a highly desirable position within close proximity of Darrick Wood school and local shops in Locksbottom. The property which is well presented features an open plan reception room, lovely fitted kitchen with lighting and cloakroom. There are also three bedrooms plus bathroom to the first floor. Additionally there is a private garden to rear, single garage and further parking.
A very well presented family home offering comfortable family living. Viewing is highly recommended.

address: Resthaven Park, Berrys Green Road, Berrys Green TN16
detailedDescription:
A spacious detached park home with woodland country views, the home is located in a semi rural location on a family park about two miles from Biggin Hill.
The property has an allocated parking space, gas central heating and double glazed windows. There are no age restictions regarding occupation and a cat would be allowed.

Location

The Restavon Park is located about two miles from Biggin Hill where you will find a selection of shops, a Waitrose Supermarket, a Tesco Express, a library and leisure centre with swimming pool. There are schools, both state and private in the area and a variety of sporting and recreational facilities. Bromley and Orpington are both a short drive and provide a wider choice of shops and amenities. Stations to London from Hayes, Orpington and Bromley. M25 access at junctions 4 and 5.

Entrance Porch

With double glazed windows and door and internal double glazed door to the kitchen.

Kitchen

Fitted with base and wall units, single drainer single bowl stainless steel sink unit. Store cupboard, linen cupboard with hot water cylinder and shelving. Extractor fan, part tiled walls, radiator and doule glazed window. Door to the dining room.

Dining Room

With radiator, double glazed window and double glazed door to the garden. Timbered ceiling, fitted carpet and arch to the reception room.

Reception Room

A double glazed double aspect room with woodland views. Two radiators, fireplace with fuitted gas fire providing central heating and hot water. Timbered ceiling and fitted carpet.

Inner Hall

With laminate flooring and cupboard.

Bedroom 1

With radiator and double glazed window.

Bedroom2

With radiator, double glazed window, wardrobe cupboard and fitted chest of six drawers.

Bathroom

With enclosed bath with mixer tap, shower attachment and shower screen. W.C. And hand basin. Chrome ladder style towel rail, part tiled walls, laminate flooring and double glazed window.

Outside

Parking

The property has an allocated parking space (Number 55). There is also a visitors parking area.

Garden

There is a good size garden which wraps all around the property and includes a patio, lawns, a shed and a number of trees and shrubs. The garden provides an ideal area for outside dining and entertaining.

Park Home Estate Rules

A copy of the Park Home Estate Rules are availble from Ibbett Mosely.

Route To View

Leave Biggin Hill on the Main Road towards Bromly, pass the Black Horse Pub on the right turn right shortly after into Jail Lane. Continue down Jail Lane passing Charles Darwin School, the Cudham Primary School and the Old Jail Pub. Turn right shortly after the pub into Berrys Hill and then first right into Berrys Green Road. Restavon Park will be foound on the left.

detailedDescription:
Quite simply a stunning and immaculate example of a 2 double bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment located in the ever popular and highly sought after apartment block Lait House, overlooking the roof terrace and superb views over Beckenham Green.

Located on a sought after road the property is just minutes from the vibrant High Street and Beckenham Junction Railway Station offering excellent commuter links into Central London via Victoria and The City via London Blackfriars plus Tram services to East Croydon for trains servicing Gatwick airport and the South coast.

This property represents an excellent opportunity to acquire a corner positioned Apartment of high calibre and in our opinion is ideally suited to the first or second time buyer, those looking to downsize or the buy to let investor.

This immaculately presented and superbly maintained property is located on the 4th floor and is finished to an exceptionally high standard throughout and incorporates generously proportioned bedrooms with built in wardrobes and en suite fully tiled bathroom with shower over bath to the master bedroom.

The fully integrated Open Plan Kitchen and has been updated with new tiling and benefits a range of Bosh appliances with under cabinet lighting, the lounge with feature fireplace overlooks the communal gardens and is light filed due to its position in Lait House.

The second double bedroom also benefits from the views, recess area for double wardrobe if required and is across from the hallway where a further partially tiled shower room and storage cupboards are located.

Further features include hard wood flooring to the Living / Dining Room and inner hallway, new LED downlighters, secure gated parking, communal lift and access to the roof garden and terrace.

In our opinion this property is one of the finest presented properties in Lait House and offers the complete package for someone looking for a certain lifestyle of living, prospective purchasers are strongly advised to contact us immediately for a viewing of this all too rarely available example.

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £1,300,000 to £1,400,000**

* Virtual Viewing Available / Chain Free *

Formerly a pair of workers cottages on the Great Lullingstone Park Estate, measuring approximately 3000 sq ft (not including stables) this 19th century property has been beautifully converted to now provide a charming yet practical family home. Set amongst two and a half acres of garden and paddocks, the accommodation comprises two principal reception rooms, fitted kitchen with Aga and adjoining utility room and cloakroom. There is also a large family room with french doors to the gardens. The first floor consists of a master bedroom with fabulous panoramic views of the surrounding countryside and an en suite bathroom, three further double bedrooms and family bathroom with separate wc. The house sits within mature gardens that are surrounded by open countryside and also include a paddock with adjoining stabling for three horses, tack room and feed store. In addition, there is a detached triple garage with the fifth bedroom or annex above.

The property is located in this rural lane yet just 2 1/2miles from Chelsfield station and Junction 4 of the M25. The property is equidistant from Bromley and Sevenoaks (approximately 8 miles) and conveniently located for several excellent schools including St Olaves.

Energy Efficiency Rating F.

detailedDescription:
Full description Wisdom Estates are proud to present to the market this superb 4 Bedroom Detached Family-Home. Situated within beautifully landscaped grounds, and offering spectacular views across the local-countryside, this home has it all to offer. Secure gated parking, a double-garage, large living accommodation throughout, bundles of potential, as well as it's own self-contained 2 Bedroom Detached Annex. We urge you to enquire today on this unique property! EPC Rating 54 E

nearby amenities A huge advantage to this property and it's semi-rural location is the factor of all the nearby amenities it has to offer.

Chelsfield Train Station and the parade of local shops at Windsor Drive are within a 5 - 10 minute drive and these shops are perfect for day to day requirements. However if you need a high-street or shopping centre then Orpington is only a further 5 minutes away, whilst Bluewater is a short-drive up the motorway.

It is worth noting that Orpington Train Station runs Fast Trains to London regularly and takes approx. 15 - 20 minutes to either London Bridge / Charing Cross.

There is a range of Educational facilities within a 5 - 10 mile radius, and also local horse riding schools, and even the highly renowned golf course of Lullingstone.

The M25 can be joined at Junction 4 allowing easy access to all the major road networks including Gatwick and Heathrow airports.

Porch A feature wooden stable door welcomes you into this spectacular family-home. Further comprising of double-glazed windows to side and front, alongside fully-tiled flooring.

Entrance hall Entering through the feature front door you are certain to be impressed with the abundance of space and potential which is on offer throughout. Further benefiting from a fitted carpet, a wall-mounted radiator (with cover), and a large under-stair storage cupboard.

Downstairs cloakroom A handy bonus is the Downstairs Cloakroom which comprises of a low-level W/C, a hand-wash basin, alongside fully-tiled walls and flooring.

Lounge 24' x 12' 11" (7.32m x 3.94m) The Lounge is the ideal space in which to sit back, relax and unwind. Boasting an open feature fireplace, two large double-glazed windows to front, double-glazed 'French' doors to side, 3 x wall-mounted radiators, and a fitted carpet.

Dining room 14' 1" x 12' 10" (4.29m x 3.91m) A large double-glazed bay window to side brings the character and charm to this large reception room, whilst a wall-mounted radiator and fitted carpet ensures the warmth and comfort.

Reception room 3 / bedroom 4 12' 11" x 10' 11" (3.94m x 3.33m) Another large reception room which can be utilised to suit your families needs. Benefiting from a feature fireplace, large double-glazed windows to both front and side, as well we as two wall-mounted radiators and a fitted carpet.

Kitchen 21' 3" x 7' 9" (6.48m x 2.36m) The Kitchen has been intelligently designed to maximise on the use of space. Boasting an array of matching wall and base units (with worktops over), a sink and drainer unit, an integrated dish-washer, alongside ample space for a Range Master cooker and 'American' style fridge / freezer. Two double-glazed windows allow for bountiful natural light, whilst access to the adjoining conservatory is provided via the double-glazed door to rear.

Conservatory 28' 11" x 6' 3" (8.81m x 1.91m) The Conservatory is fantastic space in which to socialise and enjoy the peaceful surroundings. Comprising a wall-mounted radiator, easy to clean vinyl flooring, alongside double-glazed windows which cover the entirety of the rear, and a double-glazed door providing access to the Garden.

Utility room The Utility Room is a great addition to this family-home and provides a well-equipped and large space to house your utilities. Benefiting from a range of matching wall and base units, a sink and drainer unit, fully-tiled flooring, alongside plumbing and space for a washing machine, tumble dryer, and more.

First floor landing The First Floor Landing comprises of a double-glazed window to rear, a deep storage cupboard, a wall-mounted radiator (with cover), and a fitted carpet laid throughout.

Master bedroom 13' 6" x 11' 5" (4.11m x 3.48m) The Master Bedroom has it all to offer. Two double-glazed windows with scenic views, two wall-mounted radiators, a fitted carpet, and direct access to the En-Suite and balcony terrace.

En-suite 17' x 5' 7" (5.18m x 1.7m) The adjoining en-suite compliments the Master Bedroom and encompasses a low-level W/C, a hand-wash basin, and a 'jacuzzi' bath and power shower unit comprising; side jets and music capabilities. A double-glazed window to rear, alongside double-glazed 'French' doors provide access out onto the Balcony Terrace.

Balcony terrace A secluded decked Balcony which provides stunning views across the garden.

Bedroom two 17' 10" x 11' 9" (5.44m x 3.58m) Bedroom Two continues on the spacious theme found throughout and boasts two double-glazed windows to front, alongside a double-glazed window to side, two-wall mounted radiators, fitted wardrobes, and a fitted carpet.

Bedroom three 11' 10" x 8' 6" (3.61m x 2.59m) Bedroom Three comprises a double-glazed window to front, a range of fitted wardrobes, alongside a wall-mounted radiator and fitted carpet.

Family shower-room The Shower-room is of a contemporary design and benefits from a double-glazed window to rear, part-tiled walls, fully-tiled flooring, and a 3 piece suite to include; a low-level W/C, a hand-wash basin, and shower cubicle.

Bunaglow annex A Huge Advantage to this property is the private 2 bedroom, self-contained Annex. Please see below for measurements and room features:

Decking entrance A delightful decked area provides entrance to the Annex and also offers a fantastic space in which to enjoy the surrounding views.

Lounge / kitchen / diner 25' 5" x 11' 5" (7.75m x 3.48m) A large open-planned space with it all to offer. Double-glazed windows and 'French' patio doors to front allow for bountiful natural light throughout, whilst warmth and comfort is ensured by the log-burner, and fitted carpet.

The Kitchen area boasts an array of matching wall and base units, a sink and drainer unit, an integrated oven and electric hob, alongside ample space for a Fridge / Freezer.

Bedroom one 15' 5" x 11' 9" (4.7m x 3.58m) Bedroom One is a generously proportioned room and benefits from fitted wardrobes, a large double-glazed window to front, a double-glazed patio door (leading to balcony), a fitted carpet, and an electric wall-mounted radiator.

En-suite W/C An additional bonus to Bedroom One is the handy en-suite W/C which comprises a double-glazed window to side, and easy to clean vinyl flooring.

Bedroom two 12' 1" x 7' 9" (3.68m x 2.36m) The Second Bedroom which is also a good size double, offers a double-glazed window to front, an electric wall-mounted radiator, and a fitted carpet.

Shower room 12' 1" x 5' 11" (3.68m x 1.8m) The Shower-Room services the Annex and encompasses a double-glazed window to front, a low-level W/C, a hand-wash basin, a shower cubicle, as well as vinyl flooring laid throughout.

Garden The immaculate garden and the stunning countryside views really have to be seen with your own eyes to appreciate what it has on offer. Having been mostly laid to lawn and bordered by a variety of mature shrubs and bushes, alongside patio areas for outdoor dining, this private and secluded garden is certain to be a family-favourite.

Please Note: The property runs on Fuel-Oil

driveway The secure driveway which is located behind electric gates offers ample parking for 10+ cars.

Double-garage A large double-garage with power and light which offers further secure parking, or additional storage.

address: Beaumont Lodge, Addington Road, West Wickham BR4
detailedDescription:
Chain free.
Attractive first floor one bedroom retirement flat. This property is well presented and briefly comprises; entrance hall with storage cupboard, fitted kitchen, a generous reception room measuring 16'2 x 10'7. A bathroom and a bedroom with fitted wardrobes.
Beaumont Lodge offers a communal lounge, gardens, a laundry room and off-street parking.
This flat is conveniently situated close by local shops in Coney Hall Village, Hayes and West Wickham stations and high streets and local bus routes to Bromley and Croydon. Viewing recommended.<br /><br />
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Freehold / ground floor apartment with separate studio:

Extremely rare opportunity to purchase this unique and deceptively spacious three double bedroom ground floor apartment. The property is located off the ever popular Manor Park and benefits from a large rear garden, separate studio and a garage.

The property boasts a welcoming entrance hall, large living room with feature fireplace, dining room with double doors that give access to the large rear garden, fitted kitchen, three double bedrooms, family bathroom and two separate WC's. There is also the added benefit of a separate studio apartment that has its own shower room and kitchen area. The studio apartment sits above the garage and also has its own entrance.

Outside enjoys a large rear garden that wraps around the property, there is also the opportunity to extend the existing apartment, subject to the usual planning consents.

Properties of this size and calibre located in such a sought after location are rarely available. Viewing essential.<br /><br />
title: 3 bed flat for sale

address: Church Road, Biggin Hill, Westerham TN16
detailedDescription:
Victory house is A retirement living development by mccarthy & stone - designed exclusively for the over 60's
This stylish development offers a selection of one and two bedroom apartments and is ideally located close to the historical town centre of Biggin Hill.
The development has been designed to make it easy for you to live independently with every home comfort.
Victory House offers you the best of both worlds as you have the benefit of owning your own home, free from the worries of external maintenance or gardening with the support (if you need help with anything) of a dedicated House Manager who is on hand during the day.

Location

Victory House adjoins the library and swimming pool and is a very short walk of the shops and facilities in Main Road, there is a Waitrose Supermarket and Tesco Express.
Bus service from the Main Road go to Bromley, Orpington and the Croydon Tram link at New Addington.

Entrance Hall

A front door with spy hole opens into the hall where there is a 24-hour Tunstall emergency response pull cord system. There is a walk in storage /airing cupboard with tiled flooring, hot water tank, Vent-Axia system and a Bosch washer/dryer. There are illuminated light switches, a smoke detector and a security door entry system with intercom.

Living Room

With double glazed windows and door which opens to a paved patio area which benefits from a southerly aspect. There is a feature fireplace surround with electric fire and a part glazed door into the kitchen.

Kitchen

Fitted with base and wall units, stainless steel sink unit, eye level oven, ceramic hob, cooker hood and fridge freezer. Double glazed window and under pelmet lighting.

Bedroom

A double room with double glazed window and walk in wardrobe with clothes hanging rails, drawers and shelving.

Shower Room

Suite comprising a walk in shower, W.C. And vanity unit with hand basin with wall mirror over. Tiled walls and underfloor heating with individual thermostat.

Service Charge Breakdown

* Cleaning of communal windows.
* Water rates for communal areas and apartments.
* Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas.
* 24 hour emergency call system.
* Upkeep of gardens and grounds.
* Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas.
* Contingency fund including internal and external redecoration of communal areas.
* Buildings insurance.

The service charge does not cover external costs such as your council tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your House Manager, your water rates, the 24 hour emergency call system, the heating and maintenance of communal areas, exterior property maintenance and gardening.

Leasehold

The lease is for a period of 999 years from 2018 with a ground rent of £495.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stylish two bedroom end of terrace property is located in a popular residential road on the outskirts of Bickley and convenient for local train stations and bus routes. Presented in superb condition and offering flexible accommodation, this much loved home is brought to you exclusively by jdm Estate Agents Bromley.

The attractive property which has gone through extensive refurbishment during the current owners tenure benefits from sash cord style, double glazed windows and has a small and well maintained patio area immediately in front of the property. The property, which was recently re-rendered externally is accessed via a paved pathway at the side which leads to both the front door and provides useful a useful side access to the rear garden.

The front door leads directly onto the attractive sitting room which benefits from a feature fireplace with built in storage units in the alcoves surrounding the chimney breast. This room is flooded with light from the large windows which are dressed with plantation shutters providing additional privacy. The engineered wood flooring allows for easy maintenance. Walking past the stairs which divide the two reception rooms, there is a second good sized reception room which is used by the current owners as a dining room. This too has a feature fireplace as well as an understairs cupboard for additional storage.The wood flooring flows un-interrupted through from the sitting room. The kitchen which is immediately off the dining room has been well considered and comprises a range of farmhouse style base and wall units with sink over looking the rear access to the garden. The fully glazed back door gives this room a light and airy feel. A stylish and contemporary bathroom at the rear of the property with underfloor heating completes the accommodation on the ground floor.

To the first floor are two bedrooms. One has a view over the front of the property with the window being dressed with plantation shutters for privacy and built in mirrored wardrobes - the small LED downlights to the wardrobes give bring real sense of contemporary design to the bedroom. The second bedroom has an aspect to the rear of the property and is being used by the current owners as a study but could comfortably accommodate a double bed. This room also benefits from a built in storage cupboard.

The garden which can be accessed both directly off the kitchen as well as via the side access has been elegantly landscaped. It is laid part to a sunken patio which is ideal for summer entertaining, with steps up to an area laid partly to lawn with planted beds to both boundaries and features an oval patio area in the centre to accommodate an outdoor table. At the end of the garden is a recently installed garden office which is clad in a natural wood and blends in seamlessly to the surrounding garden. The garden room has large, sliding glazed doors making this flexible accommodation a bright space flooded with light and benefits from underfloor heating.

As well as being ideally located for commuter links to both the City and Bromley and a variety of local shops and leisure facilities the property is also walking distance to the popular La Fontaine Academy.

We anticipate a lot of interest in this stunning property and your early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Galloways are delighted to market this brand new converted two bedroom apartment offered to the market with no chain. Having been developed to an extremely high standard throughout, this property is perfect for those wanting a modern property in a very convenient location.

Perfectly located for the buzz of Penge High Street with an array of local shops, restaurants, and leisure facilities as well as being 0.3 miles from Penge East Station, 0.4 miles from Penge West Station and 0.7 miles from Anerley Station, all giving commuters flexible access into Central London (distances estimated via Google Maps).

Bright and airy throughout, this spacious property comprises of; open plan reception room with a modern fully fitted kitchen, eve storage and juliet balcony, two double bedrooms both with built in storage cupboard and a generous family bathroom. This property also benefits from having a lease of 125 years and a bike store. Viewing highly recommended.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Thomas Brown Estates are delighted to offer this very well presented, double storey side extended three double bedroom two bathroom semi-detached property, situated in a highly sought after quiet close within easy walking distance to Orpington Station and within close proximity to many sought after schools such as Darrick Wood, Newstead Woods school for girls and Tubbenden Primary. Ideal for the London bound commuter, the accommodation on offer comprises: Entrance hallway, lounge, dining room with bi-fold doors to the rear garden, modern fitted kitchen, utility room and a WC to the ground floor. To the first floor there is a landing giving access to three double bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes, family bathroom and en-suite to the master bedroom. Externally there is a mature garden mainly laid to lawn to the rear, detached garage to the side and a drive to the front/side. Summerhill Close is well located for local schools, shops, bus routes, Orpington High Street, and Orpington mainline station. Please call Thomas Brown Estates to arrange an appointment to view to fully appreciate the location, floor space and quality of specification on offer.

detailedDescription:
Virtual tour available

Located within the locally renowned ‘Links Estate’ is this meticulously maintained and extended three bedroom end of terrace home.

The current owners have lovingly maintained this house and the condition throughout is well kept with a great sense of space added thanks to the rear extension that has opened up the kitchen.

The current accommodation comprises of a large welcoming entrance hall with under stairs storage and WC, heading into the main living space you will find the open plan style kitchen/dining room measuring in at 22’5 by 16’2 which wraps around into the family’s reception room which is complemented by the stunning 1930’s bay window, access to the homes 52’ south facing garden is through a side door in the kitchen which also offers side access to the front of the house.

Upstairs you will find two exceptionally large double bedrooms, the first measuring in at 13’5 by 10’1 and the second sitting at 13’ by 10’1 both complemented by large bay windows, the third bedroom is perfect for a young child’s room or those looking for a home office, on the first floor you will also find the contemporary family suite bathroom.

Further benefits include double glazing, gas central heating and a large self-sufficient studio apartment at the back of the garden which can be easily converted into a stunning home office, gym or extra living space as well as off street parking for multiple cars.

The area is well served by good local schools and is very family orientated – quiet with limited traffic. Grove Park station (a short 0.8m walk) is one of the most versatile railway stations this side of the borough, with direct links into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street in as little as 14 minutes. Commuting drivers can access the A20 in as little as 3 miles and even the city-bound A2 is within 4 miles. Blackheath Village, with its chic boutiques and award winning restaurants, is less than a 3.7 mile drive/cycle north, while the contemporary Bromley town centre is just 2 miles south - boasting 'The Glades' shopping centre and a vibrant high street which can also be access via shuttles running from Grove Park station.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

A rarely available two bedroom first floor apartment within one of West Wickham’s most sought after conversions. The property is located just off the High Street offering easy access to local amenities and mainline station.

Built in the late 1800’s in typical Tudor fashion, this property truly offers something different with its unique style. Upon entrance through the communal door you are greeted with a grand hall and galleried staircase/landing that offers access to the apartment.

Internally the property has been well looked after by the current owners and briefly comprises; a 18’ x 16’ open plan kitchen/living room with integrated units and large picture window, spacious family bathroom and two double bedrooms both boasting fitted wardrobes and the master an en-suite. There are communal gardens surrounding the building and allocated parking under a car port.

Knotley Way is located within walking distance to West Wickham Station providing frequent services into London Bridge, Canon Street and Charing Cross and local buses provide direct and reliable routes into Bromley and Croydon. The property is also conveniently located for some highly regarded Primary and Secondary schools including Hawes Down, Oak Lodge and Langley Park school for boys and girls.

Tenure: Leasehold - 125 Years from 31st August 2007
Ground Rent: £215
Service Charge: £1,730

detailedDescription:
This well presented ground floor maisonette is ideal for those jumping on the property ladder, downsizing or even buying for investment. The property has been carefully maintained throughout. Boasting well proportioned accommodation, the spacious lounge/dining room provides access to the communal gardens. Unlike most maisonettes the property has ample storage with 3 cupboards plus each bedroom has built in wardrobes. The property has a long lease, garage en-bloc and there is residents parking throughout the development. Viewings are highly recommended. EPC grade C

Situation
Situated just off Avondale Road, the property is located between Sundridge Park and Grove Park mainline stations and just a short walk from local bus routes. The local amenities of Sundridge Park are within a short walk, and Bromley Town Centre is not far away with it's vast array of shops, supermarkets, bars, restaurants, leisure facilities and The Glades Shopping Centre. There are a number of local outdoor spaces nearby.

detailedDescription:
A spacious 4/5 bedroom detached family property located in a quiet residential close, a short distance to Bromley town centre.

Accommodation to the ground floor briefly includes: Enclosed porch which leads to a bright and airy hallway with a low maintenance wood laminate flooring; downstairs WC; spacious kitchen with a range of base and wall units with views to the front of the property; large living room with feature fireplace at one end also with double patio doors leading to a conservatory which spans the length of the reception room; double doors from the living room lead to the family room which also have sliding patio doors onto the garden at the rear of the property; the ground floor accommodation is completed by a dining room with a large window over the front of the property and direct access to the integral garage. The reception rooms all benefit from a laminate wood flooring with the reception rooms and conservatory at the rear of the property having been designed to take full advantage of the views over the rear garden.

To the first floor there are four double bedrooms, the master bedroom having a contemporary ensuite shower room and dressing room, which could be converted back to create a fifth bedroom. A further two bedrooms also benefit from built in wardrobes. A separate family bathroom completes the upstairs accommodation. The property has a large amount of off street parking and a garage with electric up and over door approached via a brick paved drive.

The property is offered to the market with no onward chain.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £610,000 - £645,000.

Situated in a small cul de sac is this three bedroom link detached house ideally located in a sought after location close to Kelsey Park.

Entering into an entrance hallway with a separate cloakroom the property opens up onto a spacious open plan triple aspect living/dining room with a feature fireplace divider.

The kitchen has been recently re-fitted with a full range of modern wall and base units with space for a dining area and a door leading out onto the private rear courtyard garden.

To the first floor are three bedrooms all benefitting from built in storage and sharing the newly fitted modern family bathroom fitted with a bath, WC and washbasin.

The property features a lovely courtyard garden which is divided up into two areas for private entertaining and benefits from a garage with an electric door. The property also features air-conditioning to the first floor.

The property also benefits from a large communal garden.

Beckenham town centre is close by with its wide range of shops, restaurants and transport links including trains and trams. Other benefits of the location of this property is its proximity to Kelsey Park and Clare House primary school.

The property is leasehold and we have been informed there are 948 years on the lease with a service charge of £250.00pa and ground rent of £26.00pa.

An immaculate three double bedroom luxury apartment located in a gated development just moments away from Elmstead Woods station.

Set on the first floor the property comprises a spacious entrance hall with floor to ceiling feature window, a large main reception room with double patio doors leading to a private 33 ft roof terrace, study, separate shower room, utility room and three double bedrooms of which two benefit from en suite bathrooms and the master with the additional walk in wardrobe. Other notable features include communal lift, telephone entry system, allocated parking, garage and additional storage room.

The property is located behind secure gates and situated just 1/4 mile from Elmstead Woods station offering regular and frequent services into Central London (London Bridge 22 mins). Chislehurst Village, with its variety of shops bars and restaurants is within 2 miles.

detailedDescription:
Lakes Road is in the heart of Keston Village close to its two local restaurants/ cafes, Heathfields and Daisy Grey, the village green and Greyhound public house, post office and other village shops. Keston Church of England Primary School is situated at the end of the road and the property also benefits from Ravenswood Secondary School for Boys and Hayes school just under a mile away. A short walk away is the highly popular Keston ponds, believed to have been home to Caesar's camp, with Keston sitting on the edge of the greenbelt of Nash and offering many local walks through the Three Commons. Regular local buses from Heathfield Road lead to both Hayes and Bromley.
The property itself is a much sought after character two bedroom terraced house having undergone significant improvement from its current owners. The ground floor features two well-appointed reception rooms with wooden flooring and traditional style radiators, a modern kitchen with farmhouse style door to the garden. There are two double sized bedrooms and a four piece contemporary family bathroom suite. Modern double glazed units are sympathetic to the properties original age and there is an attractive garden to rear with large bench seating. Viewing essential.<br /><br />

Outside is a well maintained garden with patio, lawn and storage shed.

Located within a mile of three mainline stations, which all offer fast and frequent trains into the Capital.

Take a look at this beautiful two bedroom split level maisonette in a quiet location situated in a desirable area within the Petts Wood, Crofton & Locksbottom triangle. Convenient for multiple schools and in the catchment areas of the very popluar Darrick Wood School and Crofton School. Brilliant transport links with Petts Wood and Orpington mainline stations within walking distances, numerous bus routes (208,61,353, R2, R3), with nearby shops in Crofton Lane and plenty of green open spaces.

As you enter the front door you head up the stairs into the bright and airy living room with door leading onto a modern fitted kitchen and dining room with plenty of storage cupboards. Leading onto the next floor you have two great size bedrooms and a family bathroom. The front of this home looks out onto a beautiful green area making this location a peaceful one. This home also comes with a garage en-bloc. This stunning home has been finished to a high modern standard making this home turn key ready.

Be sure to book your viewing today as this home will not be around for long.

Owing to Government guidelines and the safety of our clients and potential buyers we have amended the way we carry out open days and have a strict one in one out policy. Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Two Bedroom Retirement Flat – all interest and offers are invited.

Internal:
Hallway - The entrance from the communal hall opens to the hallway, with two storage cupboards and doors to the lounge, both bedrooms, the shower room and the WC.
Lounge - Offering generous space for furniture for both living and dining, with a feature fireplace, a door to the kitchen and a door to the external patio area.
Kitchen - Fitted with a range of modern wall and base units with wood worktops over. Inset stainless steel sink basin with a drainer and mixer tap and an integrated eye-level oven with a countertop induction hob and overhead extractor hood.
Bedroom One - Double size room with ample space for furniture and a double glazed window.
Bedroom Two - Double size room with a fitted wardrobe and a double glazed window.
Shower Room - Modern suite comprising a WC, a vanity unit fitted with the wash hand basin, and a large shower enclosure.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Coming to the market for the first time in a very long time, this home has been a great family home and has good size accommodation. A large welcoming hallway, with a good size coats cupboard, leads into the really good size lounge with gas feature fireplace and double glazed bay window overlooking the front. The dining room at the rear has double glazed French doors into the garden, you then find the kitchen again overlooking the garden with a nice sunny aspect and clean and tidy but possibly due for an upgrade, The 'Worcester' boiler is in this room and a door leads to a covered area with great storage and a fabulous area for drying clothes. There is a door to the front driveway and also one to the rear garden. Also possiblity for extending. A w.c completes the ground floor accommodation.

A wide staircase leads you to the first floor where you find a bright landing having a large double glazed window to the side. There are five bedrooms, one has a wash hand basin set in vanity unit and all benefit from double glazed windows and fitted wardrobes. There are features to the property which are so in keeping with the period of the property, for example some of the fitted cupboards have curved features.

The bathroom, is clean and tidy but again will require some updating and there is a separate w.c.

Outside to the front of the house there is a good size driveway leading to the garage with double doors and to the rear there is a good size tiered garden some 100 ft in length. This has been a great family property which needs another family to love it.

London Borough of Bromley - Council Tax Band G - £2,819.20

detailedDescription:
Rare, modern three bedroom, split level apartment in the sought after Trinity Village. This property offers a wealth of versatile, spacious accommodation. On entering the flat you are greeted by a bright hallway flooded by natural light which has the added benefit of a corner storage cupboard. The hallway leads to a superb dual aspect kitchen/living/dining room area which is spacious and benefits from engineered wood flooring throughout. The kitchen is fully fitted with contemporary red gloss wall and base units and fitted appliances. Also to this floor is a bedroom with fitted wardrobes and contemporary family bathroom.

This duplex flat has stairs off the hallway which lead to the upper level of this property. To the upper floor is a master bedroom with en suite shower room. There is also a third bedroom and additional storage cupboard directly off the landing. Additional benefits include a lift in the building, telephone entry phone system, allocated parking space in a gated area, bike storage and visitor parking spaces.

The property is served by excellent transport links including Bickley and Bromley South stations both offering frequent services into the City. There are also regular bus services into Bromley South benefiting from comprehensive shopping, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities.

We are delighted to market this substantial double fronted 5 bedroom detached house set within a gated drive. Ideally situated for Bromley South Station and a number of popular schools.

Spread over two floors, the internal accommodation exceeds 2000 square feet. The ground floor is accessed by a large entrance hall with seating area and a stunning walnut and glass staircase. The ground floor also offers a large living room and additional living space that flows into a huge open-plan kitchen/dining space that has been built to an exceptional standard and further leads out onto the rear garden.

The second floor comprises five substantial bedrooms, two bathrooms, including a master en suite. There is also a notably large loft space, with fantastic potential for a loft conversion.

Westmoreland Road is a short walk from Bromley South, ideal for accessing the many perks of Bromley including coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and independent stores. Bromley High Street is very close by and delivers many culinary delights, as well as arts and crafts and the Glades shopping centre.

Further features include a south facing rear garden and off street parking for three/four cars via electric gates. This will make an ideal family home and we welcome viewing requests and enquiries.

A well presented three bedroom family home is set between Petts Wood & Orpington with convenient access to both mainline stations & also within the catchment of Crofton & Darrick Wood Schools. The property has a selection of good features plus a well presented garden backing onto a pleasant green.

A well presented family home, which is set upon this popular development with access to Crofton & Darrick Wood Schools, as well as Petts Wood & Orpington Stations. The property is set upon a very popular side road and a number of independent shops can be found locally. The property comprises, on the ground floor, a large lounge across the back of the property with a fitted kitchen located at the front. The property also has a ground floor W.C. On the first floor there are three good size bedrooms & a family bathroom. To the rear the low maintenance garden has a good size brick built store & a gate which leads out to the green behind. The property also features a garage, which is positioned en-bloc just across the road from the property.

Stairs to first floor landing

landing Two built in storage cupboards. Loft hatch and fitted carpet.

Garage en bloc

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available

Measuring 4,206 sq ft the property offers spacious accommodation arranged over three floors with the ground floor comprising; a large entrance hallway which provides access to the principal reception rooms including a living room with fireplace and French doors to the rear patio and garden, a dining room and a large kitchen with bespoke Oak fitted units designed by Stoneham along with ample space for a breakfast table and snug area. Both the kitchen and dining room open to a conservatory which in turn overlooks and opens to the rear garden. The ground floor is completed by a study located off the entrance hallway and a utility room off the kitchen.

Upstairs are five generous double bedrooms accessed via a large landing. Three of the bedrooms benefit from en suite facilities while the remainder are serviced by a family bathroom. To the upper floor and accessed via bedroom three is a large games room.

The rear garden is south facing and mostly laid to lawn with mature trees and borders for privacy. To the front of the property is paved parking for several vehicles along with access to the integral double garage.

Keston Park was the brainchild of property developer Frederick Rogers who acquired the land in 1923 from the Earl of Derby. His travels had taken him to America where he had been inspired by houses in beautiful parkland settings so he set about recreating this with Keston Park. It remains one of the most exclusive private estates in the South East and is privately gated at all entrances.

Locksbottom is within a few minutes’ walk and has an array of excellent restaurants, traditional public houses, independent and national retailers, coffee shops and two major supermarket chains. Within close proximity are extensive shopping centres including The Glades in Bromley, Orpington High Street and Bluewater slightly further afield.

Keston Park has excellent transport links nearby with Orpington Station (1.7 miles), Bickley Station (2.9 miles) and Bromley South Station (3.2 miles) all providing direct services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Victoria and Blackfriars. There is a fast service from Orpington to London Bridge in 15 minutes, and Bromley South to London Victoria in 17 minutes. By car the M25 is easily accessible (4.4 miles), A21 (1.6 miles), Biggin Hill Airport (4.1 miles) and Gatwick Airport is within 40 minutes.

There are high performing schools, both state and private, in good supply within the local area including the likes of: Keston Primary School, Crofton Primary School, Ravens Wood Secondary School for Boys, Darrick Wood both Primary and Secondary and St. Olave’s.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

The property boasts a large open plan diner/living room area with windows to three sides of the apartment providing fantastic natural light throughout the day. This property has a contemporary fitted kitchen which includes integrated modern appliances. Further accommodation comprises one large bedroom located at the rear of the property with double height built-in wardrobes and one large contempory bathroom.The property also benefits from gated allocated parking to the rear of the property.

The property is offered to the market with no chain and a long lease remaining.

Viewings come highly recommended.

Location
The property is located centrally in the desirable Chislehurst area. Once in the village you will also find many local independent shops, boutiques restaurants and general amenities for your convenience. The location is ideal for commuting with Elmstead Woods station nearby providing direct services to central London.

The sole 1-bedroom apartment in a desirable development offers a fantastic opportunity for first time buyers and investors alike.

detailedDescription:
Located on the sought after Brackley Road of Beckenham within easy reach of Town Centre and Transport links is the ground floor two bedroom flat which has access to a small private terrace via an additional front entrance. The flat is offered for sale Chain Free.

The property could benefit from some updating, therefore perfect for those wishing to put their own stamp onto a property.

The accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hallway with storage, large lounge, kitchen, two double bedrooms and a bathroom.

Externally to the front and rear are well maintained communal gardens and parking and there is also a garage en bloc.
Moliner Court is situated on Brackley Road which is a prime residential road in the centre of Beckenham with transport and shops virtually on your doorstep. A good school is situated opposite. Both Beckenham Junction providing links to Victoria and New Beckenham offering services to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street are within walking distance. The vibrant High Street boasts an array of restaurants, bars and boutiques as well as benefiting from the Odeon cinema.

We have been informed that the service charge is approx £117.50 p/m and the Ground Rent £25p.a

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
The property is positioned near the hamlet of Well Hill and the charming semi-rural village of Chelsfield which has a Grade II* medieval Church - St. Martin of Tours, a primary school, a specialist independent school, two popular public houses and hospital. Local amenities including a convenient parade of shops can be found at Windsor Drive, Chelsfield about two miles, whilst further afield Bromley, Orpington and Sevenoaks provide a comprehensive range of shops and public houses/restaurants. Bluewater shopping centre is about a 20 minute drive away. Within a short distance, there are a good selection of highly regarded state and private schools. Entertainment, dining, leisure and sports facilities can also be found close by and the area is surrounded by multiple footpaths and bridleways for those who enjoy long walks or rides.

There are fast and frequent train services from Knockholt, Chelsfield and Orpington stations providing services into Cannon Street, London Bridge and Charing Cross. The M25 which can be joined at junction 4 is easily accessible linking with other motorway networks, Gatwick, Heathrow, Stansted and City Airports, Bluewater Shopping Centre, the Channel Tunnel and both Ebbsfleet and Ashford International Stations.

The accommodation incorporates both original and modern-day features. Extreme care and attention to detail is evident in all rooms. Entrance is via a reception vestibule that opens into a dining room featuring a beamed ceiling, exposed brick fireplace with lighting and part panelled walls. There is a connecting dual aspect study and also a sitting room with an exposed brick fireplace and two sets of doors opening out to a brick paved patio and then the gardens. Both of these rooms also have exposed beamed ceilings. The modern kitchen benefits from a tiled floor that extends through to the conservatory and is comprehensively fitted with a range of units, granite worksurfaces and appliances including range style oven. The adjoining conservatory provides excellent dining and relaxation space and is perfectly positioned to take advantage of the attractive gardens. A cloakroom completes the accommodation on this floor.

The first floor is arranged to provide a light and spacious master bedroom with an en suite shower room, three further bedrooms and a family bathroom with a ‘ball and claw’ fitted bath and a separate shower. All of the bedrooms have fitted wardrobe cupboards.

Outside

Forkways is set within attractive and meticulously maintained gardens that are undoubtedly a fine feature of the property and provide an idyllic setting. The house is accessed by a pedestrian gate to the front that opens onto a pathway flanked by areas of lawn. The front garden, enclosed by picket fencing, contains a variety of flowering plants, shrubs and trees, all providing visual interest.

To the rear and one side, the garden is enclosed by established hedging and enjoys a high degree of privacy and seclusion. The principal area of lawn is edged with creatively tiered and well-stocked borders, with steps rising to a further lawned area with pond. Other features include a heritage rose walk and a pergola and around to the side of the house is a paved patio that provides superb relaxation space from which to enjoy the appealing outlook. The property also has a detached double garage with an internal store room accessed from Jubilee Road. Planning permission exists for the replacement of the existing garage and associated landscape works ref: DC/18/03188/FULL6.
